story:
To get the recording: http://www.jsbachcellosuites.com/project.html#SgnfGKBX
 
 
 

--------------------------------------------

MARCH 21st 2018

JS BACH 333rd BIRTHDAY and the day of the release...

------------------------------------------------

The website of the project:

http://www.jsbachcellosuites.com

------------------------------------------------------------------------

Update December 2016

I got a last minute meeting with Yo-Yo Ma in Boston where i could share my work with him, and receive his support!  I then traveled in the USA , gave a masterclass in Pittsburgh and received great advice and feedback for this part of the project.

Thank you for your patience, making this project with a smaller budget  make things go slower but it's coming!

keep visiting www.jsbachcellosuites.com :) and follow me on Facebook!

--------------------------------------------

 

Update September 30th 2016:

New... http://www.jsbachcellosuites.com !

-------------------------------


Recorded the 6 cello suites!

 

As of March 18th , the 6 cello suites have been recorded but I am still looking for financial partners. Feel free to contact me to contact@mariannedumas.com or you can donate through Paypal

https://www.paypal.me/bachmeup

And I will honor the same perks as listed in the campaign, you can trust me! Thank you...
 

---------------------------

 
 

(Descendre pour la version française..)
 

What is this project all about?     

  • A 2CD album of the 6 suites  (a hard cover digibook)
  • A publication in the booklet about the discovery I made in October 2014 
  • A professional video performance (only if I reach the objective)
The campaign as of today 31/10/2015 :) !
I will make this project happen no matter what, using every Euro at its best :) There is no small donation, every donation is a smile and a "Go for it Marianne!". The higher we get, the easier it will be for me ! Merci!
ABOUT?

 

 

Bach and his wonderful Suites for Violoncello

It is about a new sound of the Baroque Cello, its set up and technique based on the discovery I made a year ago.

 

What is the project goal and who is the project for?

This project is for all the Bach Lovers and soon to be ;) 

 

Doors to a new sound of the baroque cello will be opened and first revealed on the Bach Suites CD Album. The booklet will be about my discovery, sharing with you all of the research and answers I have found during this past year. In addition to the Cd album and the publication,  I want to publish a video performance. 

Having dedicated all my time to investigate all sound possibilities of the cello with a variety of different set ups, different bows and gut strings I am adding my piece to the puzzle of the baroque sound...

 

Why would you support this project?

 

 

Because it's about Bach! But most of all it is about the sound, the resonance, the baroque cello and my discovery...

 

How will I use the money if the project is successfully funded? 

 

 

The money will be used for 

  • the realization of this Album (2 CD) 
  • The booklet with my publication about the discovery and pictures.
  • The rent of the cellos for this project (the cello and the piccolo cello).
  • Gut strings.
And then:
  • A professional video of a performance of the Suites.

 

 

Who are the people behind the project?

 

 

I am on my own in this project. 

During this year I met people from the "Baroque world" who helped me and made a difference in my research/work : Maestro Ton Koopman, my bow maker Hans Reiners, the wonderful maker of the baroque cello I am playing : Daniel J. König. 

Hello Stage (see hellostage.com ) believed in my Bach project from the beginning they have been helpful and supportive, they gave me wonderful advice and helped me a lot during this journey. (If you are a professional musician , check the 55€ reward!) 

Who Am I ?

 

I am a cellist, in Love with Bach and the baroque Cello.
My name is Marianne Dumas, I was born in France, as far as I can remember, my love for Bach started when I was 3 when the organist of the church would play Bach for the opening and the closing of the service. 
Me at 3  ->      Me now ->     
 

I remember spending the whole services looking at the pipes of the Organ amazed by what I was hearing, Bach was the god I was cherishing. I started playing piano when I was 3,5 and then cello at 12.

I see in Bach all the beauty of the world, I find answers and inspiration. The cello is my passion, music is the voice of our soul, it is one of the most beautiful way to connect and share with people, all origins and languages.
 
I did my undergraduate studies in France and then moved to Pittsburgh, USA, completed my Master Degree and Performer Diploma in Carnegie Mellon University. I love orchestra, chamber music, teaching : it is all about sharing. After 7 years in the USA, I moved to Spain where I worked during 6 years.
So to make it simple... France / USA / Spain / Germany

I was always a little frustrated when I would play the Bach suites on my modern cello, the cello had too much tension, this is why I decided to get a baroque cello and baroque bow (really special...) and started my search of the sound I had in mind. In September 2014, I moved to Berlin and started my journey to the sound and to Bach.
It has been an amazing experience, coming to Germany was one of the best decision I took in my life. I am learning this beautiful language and living in Bach's beautiful country.
I want to share all of what I have explored and learned through this journey with you, and for that I need... you !
It is not about how much you will give, it is about solidarity, believing that when you have a dream, it can become reality.
Thank you for "Baching" me up !

Pictures by Andrée-Anne G.ROY.
The cello has been made by Daniel König in Leipzig.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Do you want to hear more?

About donating:

This is a flexible funding, there is no bad ending, I have to make the CD no matter what!

Make sure you receive a confirmation by email, and that your amount was added to the current number, sometimes, it doesn't go through and you have to try again:) don't give up!

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

        Version Française!

 

 

Point sur la situation au 27/10/2015 :
Comme vous pouvez le voir ce n'est pas une campagne facile! Mais je ne vais pas abandonner, vous êtes déjà 60 personnes à bord, j'irai jusque au bout! J'ai décidé de réduire le budget video afin de consacrer l'argent qui sera récolté à la réalisation de ce double CD album et de ma publication dans le livret. Plus haut nous arriverons dans la collecte, meilleures seront mes conditions de travail et de réalisation de ce projet, cette découverte que j'ai fait sur Bach le mérite...

En quoi consiste ce projet ?

Ce projet concerne le violoncelle baroque ainsi que les Suites pour violoncelle seul de Jean-Sébastien Bach.

 

Le 9 octobre 2014, j'ai fait une découverte importante en ce qui concerne l'écriture des 6 Suites pour violoncelle seul de JS Bach. Cette découverte m'a menée à faire des recherches aussi bien du côté historique que du côté du violoncelle baroque en lui même. J'ai alors décidé de préparer un enregistrement audio et video des suites et de rédiger une publication.

 

Comment en suis-je arrivée là?

En 2010 j'ai commencé à me passionner pour le répertoire pour violoncelle seul de Bach à Ligeti. Pendant 4 ans j'ai travaillé principalement sur la recherche du son, optimiser le son de son instrument par le geste, la posture  la respiration. Devenir l'instrument du violoncelle et non le contraire comme il se fait genéralement.
En septembre 2014 j'ai démenagé à Berlin dans l'intention de continuer mes recherches sur le son mais avec le violoncelle baroque. J'ai eu la chance d'en trouver un à Leipzig, ville de J.S. Bach. C'est alors qu'à commencé mon voyage vers Bach, le violoncelle baroque et les 6 Suites.

Je me suis consacrée à plein temps dans ce projet depuis mon arrivée à Berlin en 2014. Un an plus tard, je veux pouvoir partager mon travail ainsi que la découverte que j'ai fait sur les suites en octobre dernier.

Pourquoi soutenir ce projet?

Parce qu'il a quelque chose d'unique et d'innovant dans les Suites de Bach et dans le son du violoncelle baroque.

La publication de ma découverte va ouvrir un nouveau débat et apporter un nouveau son au violoncelle baroque. Plus rond et plus résonnant.

Pourquoi vous? Plusieurs possibilités :

 

  • Nous nous connaissons et vous savez combien ce projet me tient à coeur, et combien il est important. J'ai besoin de vous pour aller jusqu'àu bout de mon projet.
  • Nous ne nous connaissons pas mais on vous a parlé de moi en vous disant qu'il fallait me soutenir et que j'avais besoin de vous. C'est vrai... !
  • Vous êtes arrivé là par hazard. Peut-être vous dites vous que pour y avoir consacré une année à plein temps, ma découverte doit être réelllement importante. Vous avez raison! Si vous aimez Bach ce projet est vraiment pour vous, et si vous ne connaissez pas bien sa musique ou peu, c'est alors l'occasion de découvrir ou redécouvrir ce chef d'oeuvre pour violoncelle seul.

Qui est derrière ce projet?

Moi même, j'ai tout fait depuis ma découverte. 
J'ai reçu les précieux conseils de Ton Koopman, mais aussi de Hans Reiners à Berlin ( auteur des archets avec lesquels je joue), ainsi que ceux de Daniel J. König, luthier à Leipzig qui est l'auteur du violoncelle baroque que je loue pour ce projet (et que vous voyez sur les photos). 
Pour ce qui est de cette campagne, c'est moi qui l'ai conçue et rédigée, c'est aussi moi qui la gère. Hello Stage (www.hellostage.com) m'a guidé et conseillé tout au long de cette année, ils ont été les premiers à m'apporter leur soutien dans cette aventure. C'est grâce à Hello Stage que j'ai pu rencontrer Maestro Koopman, jouer pour lui,  lui poser des questions et recevoir ses précieux conseils.
Quelle est la répartition du budget?

 

  • Enregistrement: 3500€
  • Conception, réalisation, production, post-production du double album avec livret (1000 exemplaires) : environ 7000 €
  • Sous-total pour la réalisation du double album avec livret: 10750 €
  • Frais annexes à l'enregistrement: (déplacement, hébergement, donation pour l'église, repas) : 1200€
  • Location des violoncelles: 2000€
  • Frais Indiegogo et Paypal : 5% du total, Paypal 3% par opération
  • + Frais des contreparties 
  • Le reste pour la réalisation d'une video professionelle des suites (4 jours de filmage + montage).

Qui suis-je?   

 

 
Je m'appelle Marianne Dumas, je suis française, née à Bordeaux. J'ai grandi dans le Médoc puis sur le Bassin d'Arcachon. C'est un dimanche, à Lesparre Médoc, que j'ai rencontré Jean-Sébastien Bach.. L'organiste, était un ami de mes parents, il  adorait jouer Bach à la sortie de la messe. Moi, j'étais fascinée par la puissance de cet instrument mais aussi par les harmonies qu'il dégageait. 
J'avais 3 ans 1/2 quand j'ai commencé le piano. J'assistais aux cours de piano de ma soeur aînée avec un tel bonheur que son professeur a proposé à ma mère de me donner des cours, j'ai alors courru au piano, je me souviens de ce moment.
J'ai commencé le violoncelle plus tard, à 12 ans. Le jour ou je l'ai vu et entendu  pour la première fois, j'ai aussitôt demandé à ma mère de prendre des cours. La suite.... des heures innombrables de gammes et d'études, mais aussi des stages, des concours, des ampoules, des tendinites, et des pleurs aussi,  l'apprentissage!
J'ai travaillé avec Etienne Péclard, Roland Pidoux, Yvan Chiffoleau en France, puis avec David Premo et Anne Williams aux Etats Unis où j'ai vécu 7 ans. A la fin de mes études j'ai déménagé à Madrid ou j'ai vécu et travaillé 6 ans avant de venir à Berlin.
Au résultat cela donne quelque chose comme ça:

Dès mon arrivée à Berlin, j'ai été accueillie et aidée par des personnes du milieu baroque. Cette année a été une expérience extraordinaire, il me semble impossible de ne pas la poursuivre par le partage de tout ce que j'ai découvert, et recherché.
Merci d'avoir pris le temps de lire, d'écouter , et n'hésitez pas à partager!
Rejoignez la page Facebook du projet, suivez et commentez ! Toutes les marques d'encouragements sont bienvenues :)

Merci pour votre soutien. Il n'y a pas de petite aide, il suffit de regarder la dune du Pyla pour se rendre compte que les grains de sables peuvent faire des montagnes.

Après avoir fait votre don, vérifiez que vous apparaissez dans la liste des soutiens, et que vous avez reçu un email de confirmation car il arrive que les transactions n'aboutissent pas. 
A la fin de votre commande, lorsque vous payez par carte  cliquez "continuer" sinon l'opération n'est pas confirmée, merci!

story:
Hi everyone! My name is Samantha Johnson. I'm 26 years old, from New Bedford, MA and I need your help! 

I recently competed on Season 10 of America's Got Talent where I made it to the Semi Finals. Unfortunately, I was cut just before the Finale. During the show and since, I've done A LOT of writing and I'm very excited about the original music I am creating- but need YOUR HELP to officially release my very first EP.

I can't wait to give you all some original music :)

All proceeds will go entirely to the recording, mixing, mastering, designing, marketing and printing of my debut EP. The goal is to raise $10,000. This will get me the studio time I need, the resources to produce a quality CD, help me travel to California (Dreamin'- per usual) to collaborate with some incredible writers and producers, and also put together a team of creatives  to fully realize a physical CD for distribution! 
I also plan to launch my official website ASAP on which the first "Samantha The Bomb" merchandise items will be available.
If we happen to raise more than that (think positively!), all the extra proceeds will go towards the production of my first official music video. 

I've been chasing this dream for a long time!

The amount of support I have gotten from each one of you is incredible, and it has changed my life. I honestly believe that all things are possible. I have no interest in putting out a half @$$ album. I have strived since I was very young to be taken seriously and respected as a musician, and I can guarantee that my final project will be the BEST it can be. Every cent helps my dream come true! If you can't donate, please help by spreading the word! 

It won't be easy but with your help it's POSSIBLE!

It's very scary being entirely independent. I have found so much comfort in everyone's supportive words and prayers and knowing that you believe in me has kept me very focused on taking my career as far as it can go.

In the past 4 years, I have basically lived out of my car and suitcases, traveling the world (UK, Ireland, Scotland, Germany, Scandinavia, Switzerland, Japan, Australia, Malaysia, New Zealand, and all over the US) trying to chase my dream and perform as much as possible. I understand the risk involved in this lifestyle, and I am fully aware that I can do other things, but I do THIS the best. I was born to sing and perform and I hope that all the people I've been lucky enough to sing for agree!

Enjoy the perks!

Check out the many incentives there are for donating, including merchandise, Skype calls, and personalized songs and performances. Send me your ideas: if there is something you think would make an awesome perk, be sure to tweet me (@SamanthaTheBomb) so I can make it happen!
story_txt:
Hi everyone! My name is Samantha Johnson. I'm 26 years old, from New Bedford, MA and I need your help! 
I recently competed on Season 10 of America's Got Talent where I made it to the Semi Finals. Unfortunately, I was cut just before the Finale. During the show and since, I've done A LOT of writing and I'm very excited about the original music I am creating- but need YOUR HELP to officially release my very first EP.
   I can't wait to give you all some original music :)
All proceeds will go entirely to the recording, mixing, mastering, designing, marketing and printing of my debut EP. The goal is to raise $10,000. This will get me the studio time I need, the resources to produce a quality CD, help me travel to California (Dreamin'- per usual) to collaborate with some incredible writers and producers, and also put together a team of creatives  to fully realize a physical CD for distribution! 
I also plan to launch my official website ASAP on which the first "Samantha The Bomb" merchandise items will be available.
If we happen to raise more than that (think positively!), all the extra proceeds will go towards the production of my first official music video.  I've been chasing this dream for a long time!
The amount of support I have gotten from each one of you is incredible, and it has changed my life. I honestly believe that all things are possible. I have no interest in putting out a half @$$ album. I have strived since I was very young to be taken seriously and respected as a musician, and I can guarantee that my final project will be the BEST it can be. Every cent helps my dream come true! If you can't donate, please help by spreading the word! 
  It won't be easy but with your help it's POSSIBLE! It's very scary being entirely independent. I have found so much comfort in everyone's supportive words and prayers and knowing that you believe in me has kept me very focused on taking my career as far as it can go.
In the past 4 years, I have basically lived out of my car and suitcases, traveling the world (UK, Ireland, Scotland, Germany, Scandinavia, Switzerland, Japan, Australia, Malaysia, New Zealand, and all over the US) trying to chase my dream and perform as much as possible. I understand the risk involved in this lifestyle, and I am fully aware that I can do other things, but I do THIS the best. I was born to sing and perform and I hope that all the people I've been lucky enough to sing for agree!
Enjoy the perks!
Check out the many incentives there are for donating, including merchandise, Skype calls, and personalized songs and performances. Send me your ideas: if there is something you think would make an awesome perk, be sure to tweet me (@SamanthaTheBomb) so I can make it happen!

story:
Temenos Quartet:  Mind Moving  Body Grooving Music.

We want to thank All of you who donated to our first campaign!  While we fell short of our goal to raise the  complete funds needed for our first CD, we were greatly moved and gratified by your support and vociferous encouragement.  Because of that we are doing a Relaunch, Temenos Quartet redux if you will.  So once again we are turning to you Beautiful Community. We can't do it without you.  So please, donate, pass the word along and Boost this signal. Thank you. And let us introduce ourselves once again.


Will Clipman        Heidi Wilson      To-Ree-Nee Wolf     AmoChip Dabney


Will Clipman: Drums and Percussion

•  Is a seven-time GRAMMY® Nominee

•  Has recorded over sixty albums

•  Plays over one hundred instruments

•  Is the house percussionist for Canyon Records

•  Has performed and recorded for twenty-five years with Gold & Platinum Record         winning Native American flutist  R. Carlos Nakai

http://www.willclipman.com/

Heidi Wilson: Saxophone and Vocals

•  Co-Founder (along with Ajule Rutlin of the Black Artist Group of St. Louis)  of               Eneke-the-Bird peforming company and arts organization that presented                     creative innovative music performances in the  U.S. Southwest for seventeen             years

•  Currently a performing member of Babamarimba of Tucson

•  Daughter of Professor Keith Wilson, concert clarinetist and Director of Yale                 Music School for forty years

 www.heidiwilsonfluidhealing.com 

www.babamarimba.com

To-Ree'-Nee' Wolf: Guitar and Vocals

•  Has opened for Larry Coryell, Brownie McGhee & Sonny Terry, Paul Geremia,               Tom Paxton, Dave Van Ronk, Jeanie Bryson and John Gorka

•  Currently performs in the singing duo The Scorpio Sisters with  Kathleen  Williamson                       

•  Founding member of The Badgirl Storytelling Brigade, a performance art                       musical ensemble

•  Women On The Move Award Winner, 2003

•  Five-time Lumies Life Time Achievement Award Nominee

http://www.toreenee.com/

AmoChip Dabney:  Bass, Brass and Vocals

•  Is a two-time GRAMMY® Nominee

•  Has worked with Sun Ra and his Omniverse Arkestra, Cyril Neville of the                       Neville Bros. Band, Stephen Stills, Zydeco's Queen Ida and the worlds                             premiere Native American  flutist R. Carlos Nakai

•  Has appeared on over fifty albums

•  Engineered.  mixed, mastered, co-composed and performed on the 2005                     GRAMMY® Nominated Canyon Records  album People of Peace  with                               The R. Carlos Nakai Quartet

http://www.amochip.me/



TEMENOS QUARTET  plays mind moving  body grooving music: intelligent and emotionally evocative lyrics set to an eclectic collection of trance-dance grooves, powered by masterful musicianship and enlivened with high-spirited soulfulness featuring four of the Southwest's most enduring and original musical and artistic personalities. To-Ree'-Nee' Wolf / vocals and acoustic guitar, Heidi Wilson / sax and vocals, AmoChip Dabney / electric bass, brass, vocals, Will Clipman / drums and percussion.

 
We play music that puts you in an altered state naturally
 
We play music from all quarters of the Globe.
 
We play  music that you can trance and dance to.
 
 We play music that's well crafted with lyrics that Tanith Lee, Rumi, and Gil Scott Heron would have loved.
We play music informed by Mingus, Monk, Mitchell and Trane laid on top of a bittersweet Brazilian beat.

We play music that negates the war drum, believes in Quantum Dreaming and celebrates our shared Humanity and Heartbeat.

See you love us, you just don't know it yet. We want you to know us. We want to  share our music with you...... New World Music..... Music for the New Timeline. Music that makes your mind move and your body groove. And for your fine fabulous financial support we have  PERKS!
GREAT!!!!!  WONDERFUL!!!!!  GROOVY!!!!  PERKS!!!!

Beautiful Community, our main goal is to continue raising funds for our first CD and making sure that all the costs are covered but in this age of Social Media, we understand how vital it is to have a dynamic internet presence. So we also need a great working website. Any extra monies raised will help us create a website so that we can stay in touch and reach out to you, our ever expanding delightful audience.

If you would like to know more about us, please read this  article by Eric Swedlund

http://www.ericswedlund.com/temenos-quartet-excited-and-experienced/

     

   

 

Budget Breakout/$7300.00

Studio Time/ Engineering/Recording...............................................$2305.00

Mixing/Mastering.................................................................................$950.000

CD's/ 1000............................................................................................$2000.00

Ad Min/Photos/Videos.......................................................................$500.00

Shipping.................................................................................................$500.00

Posters/Design/Materials/Printing..................................................$500.00

Marketing...............................................................................................$500.0




Opportunities and Challenges

We are in an interesting semi-catch-22 situation. There are Venues that would love to hire us. These Venues would allow us to move to the next level in reaching out and connecting to new audiences, better pay and more creative endeavors. However to book these Venues, we have to have a product i.e.  a CD. In order to be able to make a CD, we have to have the funding in place. And in order to receive the funding, we have to reach a wider audience. So to that end, the  Relaunch. Our first campaign was launched during the Summer.  We  have a nick name for the Summer in Tucson...... The Season of Hell. People leave the city. They travel and go to cooler climes. We thought that wouldn't matter because  of social media and the internet. But we think it was a factor in not being able to reach our goal the first time. Added to that, one of our members suffered an unexpected death in the Family.

Now as the summer heat is winding down, the city is full again. Students are back at the University, people are back from traveling and the Snowbirds (escapees from the brutal winter) have arrived. As the rest of the Country prepares for the deep cold  and semi-hibernation, Tucson comes alive and enters it's busy season.  So we are very optimistic about this campaign. If you donated to the first campaign, A Big Hellacious Thank You!!!!!! I cannot tell you how much it means to us. And your PERKS!! will be a-comimg.  Send this out upon the Cyber Sea and help us reach as many people as possible.   For those new to the campaign, check out our PERKS!!!!   We have a level for everyone and All donations are very deeply appreciated.

story:
Let's do THIS!

I am beyond excited to live in a time where I as an independent artist can create music that is authentic to my core and organically connects with my friends/fans that love it!  The power of social media,  music apps, online  tools, endless technology, crowd funding websites, loyal fans and so much more have launched a momentum for artists to create music on our own terms.....  Music for the people that reflects a music career for the artist.  

C0-Creating

I like this "funded by the people approach", it's organic, personable and engaging.   Platforms like Indiegogo support artists to reach out to people that believe and share in co-creating our dreams.  I am an avid believer that It takes TEAM WORK to MAKE A DREAM WORK.  And who doesn't like being part of something that will continue to expand & give beyond oneself.  Music is most definitely one of those gifts that keeps on giving......its universal reach touches all..... Doing your part in Gifting the GIFT (music) that keep on giving CAN TOUCH THE WORLD!

 To MAKE IT RAIN NOW ~ Click Sidebar!


As an independent artist I have always envisioned a career that allows me to control my own music destiny. I've already started my CD PROJECT, it's an Incredible experience!  I have a fully capable professional team consisting of musicians, producers, sound engineers, photographers, videographers/film makers, social media team and an AWESOME manager at the helm to bring it all together like a refined orchestra.  This project is special, it's my first and the tunes are powerful! they are inspirational, entertaining and universal in reach.  We have completed the recording process and shot the video for the first single "BELIEVE" , it is currently being edited and mastered ~ the whole team is excited and we All Love what we have seen and heard!   This song is beyond a song, it's a work of compelling compassionate art for the soul's heart beat...I KNOW it will have a global impact you and so many others.....
Your gift will help to fund the entire album project.  Helping us produce for you a professional product that maintains its organic feel because we are able to be funded in house....creating my music on my terms. 



Gift the GIFT:  Your gift will help to offset the following expenses:

>Studio fees

>Marketing

> Video Shoots

>Mixing/Mastering

>Wardrobe

>Equipment

>Musician Fees

>Promotion/Marketing 

>Copyrights

>Publishing

>CD Pressing/Manufacturing/Graphics

>Artists Accommodations

>Transportation/Travel

>Sustenance

>Wardrobe

>CD Launch Party


My Thank You Gifts to YOU":  These are some of the special gifts that you can receive in addition to the perks already assigned to each amount you give to complete the project. These special gifts are for our "do more drawing" offered to those who give $50 and up. You can receive your perk plus one of these special prizes.


*Vinyl Signature Copy of my first single "BELIEVE".  An invaluable gift.

*A pair of Handmade, "Handfit" custom jeans for Women & Men.  Gifted by Alicia Lawson of Shape My Jeans @ www.shapemyjeans.com.  A gift valued at $300 and up. 

*Vocal Enhance by THEE' Oracle.  One on One session sharing the disposition necessary to capture and impact your audience.  A gift valued at $150 and up.

* V.I.P.  Passes to CD Launch party 

*Session w/ music industry experts.   Sharing on The Business of Music, inside tips on how to take your career to the next level. 

*Fall Photo Shoot by CYT Images.  Enjoy a Fabulously fFll photo shoot at the beautiful Botanical Gardens.  A (2) hour session for individual or group.

*Introductory Training Session with Erika.  A (30) minute personal training session with Erika PLUS a Fitzone Class Pass.  A gift valued at more than $60.

 A WORD OF THANKS!  Thank you to all of you in advancing for believing in me and my music over the years and even in this moment to those of you who are new to me....THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!!!


Let's make MUSIC 2gether!!!

Thank you for considering me and the music ~ 

In Gratitude ~ Lisa A. HighTower aka THEE' Oracle
https://www.facebook.com/Lisa-Hightower-Encounter-183667108356831/?ref=hl

story:
LAST DAY on INDIEGOGO!
Click the arrow to listen to the NEW Sampler as you read about Ricochet...


In a NUTSHELL:
Over 4 years in process & full-on recording past 5 months, we are here to bring beauty to our world, to put our small Iowa town on the musical map & create a model for mature musicians to place quality music into film music libraries and onto the albums of well-known artists through LICENSING. Of course we also want our versions - these gorgeous pieces of art for which we unzipped our chests a thousand times over in the recording process - to reach a diverse and expanded audience. YES! They stand alone as world-class wonderful. Now it's time to pay the piper. In the process of funding, releasing and placing these songs, we can create a model for other talented writers to use. Donate or pre-purchase the new Ricochet album = manufacturing, recording, musician fees paid. In return we offer CDs, downloads, concerts and that model I mentioned - PERKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

The Who-What-Why

My name is Sharon Bousquet, and I am a life-long musician and a lucky mom. As a  singer-songwriter, published poet, seminar leader and a member of the diverse and extraordinary arts community in Fairfield, Iowa, my musical partners and I are recording an extraordinary album project titled Ricochet. Beautiful and inspired songs, professionally recorded - the launch of an income dream in music licensing to fund this mature musician's future, paving the way for more recognition of the extraordinary talent in my home town and a model for skilled, talented players to get their music heard by those who want to pay for it. Here's a bit of my story.

25 years of music-making (and child-raising) has brought the release of  6 albums of original Bousquet music plus inclusion on two compilation CDs. I've succeeded in placing numerous songs in independent Hollywood feature film projects and a promotional short film or two, receiving a scoring credit for the Hollywood independent feature film "Cosmic Radio" - due for release on Netflix any minute. Now a big transition arrives at my door:  my youngest son Tomas graduates in June, marking the second half of my life as a musician-mom. I am here to put some ducks in order for my very successful musical future, and in so doing create a model for others to do the same.

"Licensing" is a sustainable way to mature as a working musician. To get paid for 25 years of work via royalties and licensing fees from films and tv shows that pay to use original music. Success at licensing the songs on Ricochet and future projects will allow me to continue making music that's true to my nature and a boon to listeners: bright, deeply felt and inspired gems that make use of the deep talent pool in our entrepreneurial. artsy town of Fairfield, Iowa. Then we look to use that experience to create a model for other talented artists around the world to do the same. 

LOVE is a RICOCHET:
What we need/what you receive

It's an interesting time in the music business. We as artists and musicians understand that music isn't free, yet that concept is prevalent among a listening audience that streams and downloads without having bought albums, CDs or even singles - ever. Our reality is this: untold hours in the studio producing this gorgeous project, and it shows like a peacock in the snow. Ricochet is also graced by the substantial time & talents of many of Southeast Iowa's top musicians, including: George Foster (bass), David Hurlin (drums), Eric Hurlin (keys, organ), Lauryn Shapter (violin), Tim Britton(flute, whistle, mando), Phoenix Jordan (vocals, keys), Steve and Michaela McLain (vocals), Ed Raines (sax), Sara Sanders (vocals) and Donna Nelson (cello). We are so very blessed to swim in this talent pool.

Five months into this focused leg of the album, we are finished - tomorrow the music is off to manufacturing. EXCITED HERE!! - a new (albeit plastic) baby is about to be born. And you can help - we need the village to raise this baby to it's full potential. In return, we have set a range of gifts and "perks" for anyone who contributes to this campaign. The perk packages are connected to the donation buttons on this page. They range from pre-purchasing a $10 download card for a digital version of the entire album, to a signed CD for $25; from an intimate house concert for you and your friends, to covering some of the studio costs with a check written to Pied Piper Productions.This is a way that you can support the arts in a very direct and meaningful way - by checking out the perk packages or donating any amount that works for you.  Many options, all appreciated! 

>>>>>>>>>Breaking the $ Down<<<<<<<<<<

NOTE: All funds gratefully accepted, and PayPal strongly preferred whether using credit card (via PP) or your PP balance. This way the $ gets to us NOW as opposed to late March (2 wks after end of campaign if direct cc payment).

>>>>>>>>>Breaking the $ Down<<<<<<<<<<

I have set the minimum goal for this crowd funding campaign at $8150.
Here's how that breaks down:

+$4000 for the studio & engineer, about half of what will be owed for the countless hours creating this gorgeous recording 
+$1800 in studio musician fees 
+$250 for the beautiful CD artwork
+$1200 for manufacturing CDs & Download Cards: glass master, packaging, shrink-wrapping, etc.
+$500+ for "Mastering" the tracks- a required final step after mixing and before manufacturing
+$350 for one of the best online MUSIC PLACEMENT SERVICES/lists (per year) for licensing the songs
+$25 for a UPC Bar Code (stores require them to sell CDs)

If we are supported beyond this first measure, the next phase looks like this:
+$550 for an introductory trip to BMI in Nashville for co-writing & putting a face on these songs
+$250 plus for Merchandise = T shirts, stickers, Ricochet underwear..kidding! :) 
+$4K for Tim's services at Pied Piper (the 2nd payment for studio & engineer)
+$70 for 2 Commemorative "Ricochet" Plaques – a gold CD with CD info plaque, framed for the studio and one for the artist
+$$ A new website for licensing the catalog at Love-Buzz Music Publishing
+$$ Marketing budget for song pluggers (radio), online and print ads; office help/data entry/marketing assistant's wages at $10/hr to upload, input and update 10 online music pages and platforms

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NhP7MJG-9C8

(Phoenix, Sara and Sharon were in the studio on Valentine's Day BRINGIN' the LOVE: recording harmonies on SB's funky song, "Only Game in Town". YES!

A Peak Along the Timeline...

4 years ago, while launching an inspirational CD called “How Spirit Sings” and smack-dab in the heart of 5 years with my brilliant songwriting partner Heather Love, we enthusiastically began a campaign to create the Ricochet CD. Back then, in the middle of Heather's brain injury, we raised $1200 here on IndieGoGo and pre-sales of that much again, which we used to record acoustic gems like “Sidestep”, "Troubled" and “I Fell". We were able to pay some wonderful studio musicians as well as the studio/engineer as we put a marker in the ground for “Ricochet 2011”. If you are one of the friends and fans who helped with those early steps toward Ricochet, your CDs are still coming with our thanks for your patience!  I wonder what that original CD would have sounded like... Clearly, the CD that we now have brewing at Pied Piper Productions would not exist if it weren't for the past few years of “growth opportunities” as life has spun us into the Us that is now creating the most beautiful music of my life. 

Suffices to say that this CD is extraordinary. It's filled with deep light and a path through sorrow. It is imagistic and powerful and tapestry-like. It's folky and funky, full of beautiful harmonies and musical hooks that stick in your brain. I have never been more excited about music than I am about the songs in this collection, superbly captured, mixed and produced by Tim Britton of Pied Piper Productions. As part of the production team, PJ and I have brought many important ideas to the sonic table, yet Tim is the man who is up til 4 am, refining every little thing. He's been along for the entire ride, stepping up this past fall and forging ahead, finishing “Ricochet” with the full knowledge that this project has legs. Really nice gams. Mercury's wings to carry us into our fully supported lives.

The Goal and How We Scale It

Our goal amount of $8150 was chosen to allow us to get the discs made, musicians and studio paid, and the licensing framework laid: as a number that people could wrap their heads around. Your donations can be for ANY amount from $1 to a million, with a variety of ways to give: in person check or cash, credit card via PayPal or in person with my PayPal card reader. Any funds sent through PayPal or other cash-in-hand options are immediately available to us to pay the players, studio, manufacturing, etc. And all of it will be input into this campaign page where the names, amounts, perks and timelines are organized and maintained. 

When we reach our goal of $8150, the platform fees here at IndieGoGo are only 4%. Yay! Were we to fall short of our goal, the fees would jump to 9%. Eeek! Needless to say, we are FIRED UP to meet our goal, encouraging our friends and fans to spread the word via Facebook and other social media sites, arts funding sources, and friends of heart music with soul. IndieGoGo also has impressive tools for sharing - check it out while you are looking at the gifts and perks. Between us, we can lift this campaign and the music that inspires it, well past the eight thousand mark. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Check out the video at the top of the page. If you are not in a position to contribute financially, but see the value in helping these songs find a larger audience, there are other ways to lend a hand.

  • Please spread word of the project by sharing the link on social media, email, talking to friends over coffee, listening to the available tracks online, etc.
  • Do you have a helpful connection for music licensing? I'm all ears! 
  • Write a review of the project, this campaign, or Sharon's music in general, and submit it to online and print media - we'd love to see it first!
  • Remember you can use the Indiegogo share tools, too!

Patrons of the Arts

By choosing a donation button & clicking your way to patron of the arts status, you will be our beloved heroes with great music in hand, and we will be able to finish making and promoting this album - artists doing what we do best. NOTE: PAYPAL is preferred, whether paying with your credit card via PayPal or with your PP funds. The donations come straight to us with PayPal, for paying our CD costs now. Credit card payments arrive 2 wks AFTER the campaign end date has past. 

With our deep and abiding thanks,

Sharon, Tim & PJ
Bousquet Music - www.soundcloud.com/sharonbousquet 
www.ReverbNation.com/SharonBousquetSolo 
Pied Piper Productions - www.soundcloud.com/piedpiperprod
800 South 3rd Street, Fairfield, IA 52556
Phoenix Fire Productions - www.phoenixfireproductions.com 
(641)472-4005 - Tim
(641)954-2139 - Sharon
story_txt:
LAST DAY on INDIEGOGO!Click the arrow to listen to the NEW Sampler as you read about Ricochet...



In a NUTSHELL:Over 4 years in process & full-on recording past 5 months, we are here to bring beauty to our world, to put our small Iowa town on the musical map & create a model for mature musicians to place quality music into film music libraries and onto the albums of well-known artists through LICENSING. Of course we also want our versions - these gorgeous pieces of art for which we unzipped our chests a thousand times over in the recording process - to reach a diverse and expanded audience. YES! They stand alone as world-class wonderful. Now it's time to pay the piper. In the process of funding, releasing and placing these songs, we can create a model for other talented writers to use. Donate or pre-purchase the new Ricochet album = manufacturing, recording, musician fees paid. In return we offer CDs, downloads, concerts and that model I mentioned - PERKS FOR YOUR SUPPORT! 

The Who-What-Why
My name is Sharon Bousquet, and I am a life-long musician and a lucky mom. As a  singer-songwriter, published poet, seminar leader and a member of the diverse and extraordinary arts community in Fairfield, Iowa, my musical partners and I are recording an extraordinary album project titled Ricochet. Beautiful and inspired songs, professionally recorded - the launch of an income dream in music licensing to fund this mature musician's future, paving the way for more recognition of the extraordinary talent in my home town and a model for skilled, talented players to get their music heard by those who want to pay for it. Here's a bit of my story.

25 years of music-making (and child-raising) has brought the release of  6 albums of original Bousquet music plus inclusion on two compilation CDs. I've succeeded in placing numerous songs in independent Hollywood feature film
projects and a promotional short film or two, receiving a scoring credit for the Hollywood independent feature film "Cosmic Radio" - due for release on
Netflix any minute. Now a big transition arrives at my door:  my youngest son Tomas graduates in June, marking the second half of my life as a musician-mom. I am here to put some ducks in order for my very successful musical future, and in so doing create a model for others to do the same.

"Licensing" is a sustainable way to mature as a working musician. To get paid for 25 years of work via royalties and licensing fees from films and tv shows that pay to use original music. Success at licensing the songs on Ricochet and future projects will allow me to continue making music that's true to my nature and a boon to listeners: bright, deeply felt and inspired gems that make use of the deep talent pool in our entrepreneurial. artsy town of Fairfield, Iowa. Then we look to use that experience to create a model for other talented artists around the world to do the same. 



LOVE is a RICOCHET: What we need/what you receive
It's an interesting time in the music business. We as artists and musicians understand that music isn't free, yet that concept is prevalent among a listening audience that streams and downloads without having bought albums, CDs or even singles - ever. Our reality is this: untold hours in the studio producing this gorgeous project, and it shows like a peacock in the snow. Ricochet is also graced by the substantial time & talents of many of Southeast Iowa's top musicians, including: George Foster (bass), David Hurlin (drums), Eric Hurlin (keys, organ), Lauryn Shapter (violin), Tim Britton(flute, whistle, mando), Phoenix Jordan (vocals, keys), Steve and Michaela McLain (vocals), Ed Raines (sax), Sara Sanders (vocals) and Donna Nelson (cello). We are so very blessed to swim in this talent pool.
Five months into this focused leg of the album, we are finished - tomorrow the music is off to manufacturing. EXCITED HERE!! - a new (albeit plastic) baby is about to be born. And you can help - we need the village to raise this baby to it's full potential. In return, we have set a range of gifts and "perks" for anyone who contributes to this campaign. The perk packages are connected to the donation buttons on this page. They range from pre-purchasing a $10 download card for a digital version of the entire album, to a signed CD for $25; from an intimate house concert for you and your friends, to covering some of the studio costs with a check written to Pied Piper Productions.This is a way that you can support the arts in a very direct and meaningful way - by checking out the perk packages or donating any amount that works for you.  Many options, all appreciated! 

>>>>>>>>>Breaking the $ Down<<<<<<<<<<
NOTE: All funds gratefully accepted, and PayPal strongly preferred whether using credit card (via PP) or your PP balance. This way the $ gets to us NOW as opposed to late March (2 wks after end of campaign if direct cc payment).
>>>>>>>>>Breaking the $ Down<<<<<<<<<<
I have set the minimum goal for this crowd funding campaign at $8150. Here's how that breaks down:
+$4000 for the studio & engineer, about half of what will be owed for the countless hours creating this gorgeous recording +$1800 in studio musician fees +$250 for the beautiful CD artwork+$1200 for manufacturing CDs & Download Cards: glass master, packaging, shrink-wrapping, etc.+$500+ for "Mastering" the tracks- a required final step after mixing and before manufacturing+$350 for one of the best online MUSIC PLACEMENT SERVICES/lists (per year) for licensing the songs+$25 for a UPC Bar Code (stores require them to sell CDs)
If we are supported beyond this first measure, the next phase looks like this:+$550 for an introductory trip to BMI in Nashville for co-writing & putting a face on these songs+$250 plus for Merchandise = T shirts, stickers, Ricochet underwear..kidding! :) +$4K for Tim's services at Pied Piper (the 2nd payment for studio & engineer)+$70 for 2 Commemorative "Ricochet" Plaques – a gold CD with CD info plaque, framed for the studio and one for the artist+$$ A new website for licensing the catalog at Love-Buzz Music Publishing+$$ Marketing budget for song pluggers (radio), online and print ads; office help/data entry/marketing assistant's wages at $10/hr to upload, input and update 10 online music pages and platforms
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NhP7MJG-9C8

(Phoenix, Sara and Sharon were in the studio on Valentine's Day BRINGIN' the LOVE: recording harmonies on SB's funky song, "Only Game in Town". YES!

story:
"Delia’s Heart Transplant"

We are Intuitive Compass, a musical project with a broad history.  Since 2011 Intuitive Compass has passed from a six piece with Guitar, Banjo, Mandolin, Washtub, Washboard and Fiddle through various arrangements to a two piece consisting of Guitar, Accordion, foot percussion and the occasional Banjolele played by the youngest member, our son Theo.  Since its inception in 2011, the band with its many faces has consistently served as an avenue through which to share the most personal and universal human experiences through poetry and Original Folk Melody.  This Spring we are touring as a four-piece with the addition of Washboard and Trombone!

For the past year we have been enjoying the luxurious experience of touring and traveling in our beloved Delia, our 24 foot red Mobile Palace of a bus.  She has carried us for thousands of miles, from Oregon to Arizona and back, out to our first East coast tour and journey up into Quebec, through the Midwest and back to our Northwestern home. At the end of our recent Winter Jaunt Tour on the fateful day of December 13th, sometime after midnight she stalled and would not be revived.  We had her towed a whopping 217 miles to our last show of tour and home to the rural high country of Southern Oregon.  With our upcoming spring tour on the horizon and dates booked, we reeled in the wake of necessity.  The newest addition to our entourage of vehicles is a 1997 Dodge Van. While it will temporarily suffice, when traveling with 6 people it feels like a clown car. We hope that it will be a reliable but short-term solution, and a much-enjoyed reward to some generous contributor!

In addition to the obvious justification for having such a lovely touring rig, it also enables us to travel with all the necessary props and equipment for our full show, have a guest musician or two along, save on hotel accommodations and generally improves the day-to-day experience! The show must go on, and our band leader, manager and son Theo has become quite accustomed to traveling in the comfort of his mobile living room.  It gives him the option of retreating (with his assistant of course)  if he’s not feeling up to performing or socializing during a show, or if the venue is unaware or uncomfortable with the child performers laws that apply to under-age performers.

With the help of all of you we are hoping to replace Delia's engine. We have researched rebuilding it, and have come to the conclusion that rebuilding is not the most sustainable option and switching it out is a better choice.  We will be happy to replace our engine with the same kind and roll on down the road!

We will need $5,000 minimum to achieve the majority of the work needed.  We have received quite a range of estimates, but in aiming to be realistic we are shooting for $5,000.  We have a variety of rewards or "perks" to choose from, many of the rewards are handmade items, customized for the people who select them.  You can choose color schemes and styles for your rewards!  Also included in the rewards to choose from are various albums, one of witch is not yet released!  Also available are T-shirts which will be the first Intuitive Compass shirts ever!

Our goal is $5,000.   If we overfund or only make a fraction of our goal we will be putting 100% of it towards the bus and will, by the skin of our teeth if necessary, repair it anyhow!

By participating in supporting us in this endeavor you will be supporting the continuation of Intuitive Compass's mission in the world and the growth of Original Folk music and preserving folk tradition and its evolution in the modern world.  Thanks to the support of so many wonderful people last year we reached our Kickstarter goal and succeeded in recording, mastering and replicating our most recent album. Even if you can't donate, please share this around on your social network of choice - we really can't do it without you!

Thank you all for your time and generosity.

Yours truly,

Aurelia Cohen, Jason O'Dea, Theo O'Dea, and Delia

story:
My name is Daniel Bell, I'm 26 years old from a town called Moorestown, NJ about 15 minutes from Philadelphia, PA. I write songs and perform them live both, by myself as well as with others or as we in Nashville call co-writers.

The project was birthed around the question that I'm asked on several occasions both during and after shows - Do you have any music recorded? - My answer has always been 'Not yet.' Well guess what... I'm tired of saying that.

  • This will be a life-changing project that will launch me out of being a hobbyist and allow me to live my dream
  • Every dollar that you give puts me one step closer to getting the music that I've worked so hard on into YOUR hands! Let's make it happen!!

The BREAKDOWN

WHAT I NEED

As with every goal - there's a reason... Mine is love. There's nothing I love more than music - sorry Mom... But in all seriousness - in any and every other walk of life that I've tried there has been this fish out of water feeling. The only time I truly feel happy and myself is with guitar in-hand and a song on my tongue.

So, what do I need? Help... I need YOUR help to do what I love.

WHAT YOU GET

  • $10+ - Thank you card handwritten from me
  • $25+ - digital download of the album +above perk
  • $50+ - Signed CD + above perks
  • $100+ - Diggin Graves t-shirt + above perks
  • $300+ - Entrance into House concert sweepstakes 6 winners of 30 possible + above perks
  • $500+ - Your favorite cover video + Liner Notes + above perks (15 possible)
  • $1,000+ - Dinner Date + House Concert + above perks
  • $3,000+ - Labeled as Producer on the record + above perks

The Impact

This record isn't just good music, it's my real life. These songs are coming from the ups and downs of my day to day with tributes to my family, the ever abrasive past that me and others are running from, and most importantly the growing process from acting like a child to becoming a man. So I'm not about to compare this to Songs in the Key of Life but I will say if you want to understand where my heart is - then you should help me make this record!

Risks & Challenges

There are definitely things that I'm worried about in this journey: Unexpected expenses, inability to promote properly, and basically not being able to follow through in a reasonable amount of time. However, it wouldn't be a step of faith if you didn't have challenges and risks.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, you CAN still help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Use the share tools to spread the word!!!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Tip

The Tip united as a chain gang of Nashville's best Rock N Roll bands. This supergroup joined forces in the fall of 2013 and haven't looked back since. 

Faster, harder, louder, and tighter than anyone who has crossed their path, The Tip is on a mission to bring their music to the masses.

The band draws attention by simply stepping into a room, turning heads of curiosity as to what this dynamic cast of characters is up to. Late nights, hot licks and boundless energy are exactly what The Tip is made of. 

Rock N Roll hasn't gone anywhwere....it exists in the songs, the style, and the lives of The Tip. 

2014 was a tremendous year with The Tip touring with Hammered Satin and opening shows for the likes of Sebastian Bach. Now in 2015 it is time to take the next step....it's time to make a record.

Stepping on board to produce this rock n roll whirlwind are Chris Lohr(Frank Foster) and Scotty Schultz(Shooter Jennings). These two have worked together on a number of projects and strive to make records that represent an artist at their very best. Recording at Nashtray Studios is ready to commence, please come along for the ride with us.

With all that being said, recording is not a cheap endeavor. We are coming to you, the fans, to help us achieve that goal. Our aim is $10,000...that may seem hefty but consider all the working parts. Studio time, engineer, producer, mixing, mastering, artwork, duplication, and promotion all have to be done in a proper way. We also want to release this project on a special pressing of vinyl for our backers in this journey. This will add to our duplication cost but we see it as a special reward for helping us out.

Please check out all the perks offered and we truly appreciate each and every one of you who helps our cause. Should we not reach our goal, we will put every cent that we have raised into finding a way to get the music out. 

If you aren't able to contribute financially we fully understand and hope to see you at a show sometime soon. We do ask that you share this page on any of your social media accounts or pass along this link to anyone that may be interested in contributing.  Help us promote this fundraising campaign and lets make a record together.

Thanks again and long live Rock n Roll!!!

Here is what we have already been up to in The Nashtray. Enjoy.

 Killin' It! Wasted!
-The Tip

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0xWoIixysqE&feature=player_detailpage

With all that being said, recording is not a cheap endeavor. We are coming to you, the fans, to help us achieve that goal. Our aim is $10,000...that may seem hefty but consider all the working parts. Studio time, engineer, producer, mixing, mastering, artwork, duplication, and promotion all have to be done in a proper way. We also want to release this project on a special pressing of vinyl for our backers in this journey. This will add to our duplication cost but we see it as a special reward for helping us out.
Please check out all the perks offered and we truly appreciate each and every one of you who helps our cause. Should we not reach our goal, we will put every cent that we have raised into finding a way to get the music out. 
If you aren't able to contribute financially we fully understand and hope to see you at a show sometime soon. We do ask that you share this page on any of your social media accounts or pass along this link to anyone that may be interested in contributing.  Help us promote this fundraising campaign and lets make a record together.
Thanks again and long live Rock n Roll!!!
Here is what we have already been up to in The Nashtray. Enjoy.
 Killin' It! Wasted!-The Tip
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0xWoIixysqE&feature=player_detailpage

story:
Night is Electric is Starting a War

Join us...share the night's energy with us.

Our campaign goal is to raise needed funds to complete our band's debut project. Already, so many talented people have sacrificed their time and energy for this project and now we are asking our fans (new and old [those who knew us formerly as homeless J. on MCA]) to join in our adventure.

For this debut project, we had amazing opportunities to work with Ivor Novello Award-Winning Producer Cassell the Beatmaker in London, UK as well as US-based producers in New York, Nashville and Chicago.  The recording process began in January 2014 and now in 2016 (with YOUR help and seed money), we will launch our 1st Night is Electric tour.

Your contributions will allow us to mix, distribute, promote and tour our debut project. 

We need YOU to help us debut our GREATEST SONGS YET!  We are very excited to share our NEW MUSIC with you!  The sooner we get the music done, the sooner Night is Electric can get it into your hands.  We are trying something new.  We have no label and no limits...it's just us and the fans working TOGETHER to create something amazing.

We are already doing the work because we want you to come on the journey with us.  We need YOU.  It takes SO many things to release an album.  We NEED you.

That's the bottom line.  For ideas and visions to be their best, we need each other, we need community.  We've been down this road alone before, and we won't do it again.  This time we're doing it differently.  We are taking our amazing community of creative collaborators along with us (as you will quickly notice in our perks).  Our story is YOUR story.  Help us tell it.  Help us share Hope.

"We never really can tell where ideas will lead," says Chad Van Meter (songwriter and frontman of Night is Electric).  "When I was 16 years old a very distinct melody hit me on my front porch.  I ran after my guitar and found three chords that would accompany the melody and a passion was born for songwriting that has never left.  I love creating music, or more accurately - having music created through me. Night is Electric (NiE) is my newest and greatest muse and is comprised of myself along with Jon Hill (bass) and Dan Willig (percussion)."

NiE is a metaphor, much like the night itself.  The night is our most tangible daily reminder that our deepest human longings are not yet satisfied.  We sleep.  We wait.  Yet the night IS electric -- potent with the energy of the day, fertile with the dawn it preludes.  Will you help us start a war on apathy, indifference, on settling to break even? 

Join the War,

Chad (the Flash)

Here is What We Need & Here is What You Get

Here's the deal:

  • We need at least $8,000 in funding to meet the base need costs of mixing, distributing, promoting and touring our debut project
  • Funds will be used to: 1)Finish production on our new songs 2)Film our next couple of music videos 3)Help us pay for basic things (like food and gas) when we take the new music on tour later this summer
  • We have some very unique perks made by amazing midwest artists
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will have to be used to mix, distribute, promote and tour on a much smaller scale and we will not be able to promote and create music videos for all of our new songs

Your Contribution Makes a HUGE Impact

The Night is Electric means the night is pregnant, fertile, full of the capacity of a day that is coming.  Don't get stuck in the night.  Don't lose sight of the coming dawn.  Don't let go of your longings.  Plug into the electric night.

Every once in a while an idea comes around that you just cannot shake.  It takes hold of you, takes your imagination captive.  The songs born out of the newly formed Night is Electric possess that power.  The songs are fiercely energetic, lyrically inspiring and smartly crafted to appeal to a wide scope of musical genres.

We have willpower and conviction - but we NEED YOUR HELP to gather resources.

Kicking at the Darkness

We don't expect this campaign to be easy - as veteran musicians, we are familiar with the sacrifices required on the way to achieving goals in the music world.  Our songs capture the heart of the creative initiative.  It's about refusing to see life as mundane.  It's about finding the spark of life in the simple things.  It's about not letting go of what we hold dear.  It's about kicking at the darkness.  It's about starting a war within ourselves to go for it -- even when it is BIG.  It is THERE we find the stolen moment, the sign, the re-assurance within the whirlwind.  We are embracing the chaos.  Here we go...

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow and like us on social media @NightisElectric.  Spread the word on social media!  Please utilize the Indiegogo sharing tools.  You can also help NiE by posting:

On your Facebook page:

  1. Help #NightIsElectric fund their debut project! http://igg.me/at/NightIsElectric #StartAWar #newmusic
  2. Like #NightIsElectric on FB at https://www.facebook.com/NightIsElectric #newmusic
  3. Check out #NightisElectric  https://www.facebook.com/pages/Night-Is-Electric/75476536401  #StartAWar 
  4. Subscribe to #NightIsElectric on YouTube at 

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCAm3HeiaYkFrhexJ_IcvXQQ

 #StartAWar
On your Twitter page:
  1. Help @NightIsElectric fund their debut song project!  igg.me/at/NightIsElectric #StartAWar #newmusic
  2. Follow @NightIsElectric #StartAWar  #NiE #newmusic

Perks

story:
About our Charity:

Cazfest was established by Johnny & Lesley Johnstone in 2008 in memory of their daughter Caroline Johnstone (Caz), a healthy 17 year old student at Bishops Stortford High School, who collapsed suddenly from an undiagnosed heart condition and despite the prompt attendance of medical services, failed to regain consciousness and sadly died a few days later. 

Cazfest aims to prevent tragedies like Caroline’s through providing free ECG screenings for young people and increasing awareness of heart risk in the young through our regular fundraising events. Over the past 5 years we have screened over 1,000 young people in Hertfordshire & Essex. While most people we screen are thankfully given the all clear, others have issues identified which need treatment.  With your support we can screen many more young people in Hertfordshire & Essex and save lives.


What else can you do to help? 

Please share and shout about our campaign, there are lots of share tools you can use from here. Please do 'like' us on Facebook and 'Follow Us' on Twitter - all of the links are here. 


Fundraising Overview:

We are seeking £35,000 to ensure our annual charity festival, Cazfest, goes ahead 11th July 2015. Whether you are a small or large business, a member of the local community or an avid supporter of our cause, please give as much or as little as you can afford - every penny counts!

All profits from the event are used to finance screening at schools in Hertfordshire and Essex and raise awareness of heart conditions in young people.

In return for your donations, we are offering a number of "perks" from Platinum, Gold, Silver & Bronze packages for business sponsors who want to be identified with this worthy cause, to T-shirts, tickets and much more for those who want to attend the event and support the charity.  


About the Event:

Cazfest is held in July each year on Sworder’s Field, Bishop Stortford, Hertfordshire. Last year’s event brought Alexander O’Neal, X-Factor’s Rough Copy, Ed Drewett, Artful Dodger and many more international and local acts who performed to over 2,000 people. Previous headline acts include, Scouting for Girls, Sugarbabes, Lemar, SClub, The Hoosiers and many others. The event predominantly attracts a family audience in the daytime and a teen/young adult crowd in the evening/night (18-35 year olds).

Touched by the story and inspired by previous Cazfests, there is now a solid team of local volunteers, working to organise the event but it is as important as ever to secure funding to support the logistics of the day and secure headlining acts.

This is an excellent opportunity for businesses looking to raise their profile locally and to be associated with a strong community based initiative, or simply an opportunity for individuals to contribute to a local cause.

story:
The story so far

I have been writing songs about Australian characters, moments in time, hardships and joys and would love to put an album together of the stories. Songs remembering diggers, celebrating those on the land, the toils of our mountain cattlemen, the hardships of our FIFO workers and a bit of Aussie humour thrown in.

By being a contributor to this project you will make it possible, it is as simple as that. You can help get this project off the ground.

Not only do you help make this possible but you get exclusive access to the process of recording an album like never before, exclusive access to stuff no one else will see. The inner sanctum of a recording studio is fun, can be stressful but is definitely totally exhilarating when you get it right.

 

Making it Possible

In order to make this possible I need you. 

The goal is to raise $10,000.00 which will partially fund the project. 

What's in it for the contributors you say? We'll here's the exiting bit!

 

What you get

Whatever your situation whatever you can do there is a club for you to join. have a look below at the different clubs and become a member of the one you would most like to receive the perks from.

If we don't reach the total goal for the funds we will still be putting what we have towards making this album a reality.

The Impact

Do you feel like you need another Billy album, an Australian country album, with some laughs, tears and tongue in cheek songs?

  • The project will help bring these stories to life.
  • You can help, become a member of one of the clubs below and this becomes a reality. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn't mean they can’t help:

If you cant afford a contribution you can still lend a voice by spreading the word about this campaign to everyone you know, post it in on Facebook, Twitter or share it with your fellow country music friends. And my friends around music with the major festivals coming can spread the word.

 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Cancer Survivor delivering a message of Hope 

JackieO. Kelley aka "JackieO." I am thankful to be known as a God loving, Bible Believing, Breast Cancer Surviving (20 years), Independent, Inspirational Christian Gospel Recording Artist, Songwriter, Musician, Author, and Visual Artist. After singing songs and playing piano in my hometown for three decades I decided to pursue my dreams and motivate others to do the same.  I am humbled to have won several awards in the music field, and my music has aired on many  radio stations throughout the country.I have a passion to make music that impacts the world with the message of hope. 




What We Need & What You Get

    This project is important because it is a way to bring the message of hope to as many people as we humanly can. The money we raise is  a matching fund for what we are willing to put up of our own money to make this happen. Every penny that we raise will go for the furtherance of the message of hope. We do not use any of the funds for our personal expenditures. 

    These funds will go to:

    CD and book Postproduction

    1. Marketing-35%

    2. Distribution-25%

    3. Management Software-2%

    4. Radio promotion-25%

    5. Social media management-2%

    6. Licenses and fees etc-1%

    7. Produce an entire illuminating video about the song”Never Give Up” and      "Stronger" -10%


Thank you again for your love,prayers and support and be encouraged there is Hope. JackieO.Kelley

Don't forget to look at the Perks on the your right side!!!

story:
Summary

AraPacis are planning their next album for early 2016 and would like you to share in this enterprise!

If you like a mix of hard rock, classic metal, doom, prog and blues rock, our band is for you!

Check out our latest single featuring Don Airey of Deep Purple on keyboards!

http://arapacis.com/sounds/Tearing_the_Mist_by_AraPacis.mp3

Indeed, our last album featured guests spots by awesome people like Leonardo Fagelli, Mathieu Roy, Guy LeBlanc (Camel, Nathan Mahl) and Don Airey (Deep Purple, Ozzy), we already have John Gallagher of Raven signed up for this one on bass!

Come and participate in this endeavour!

Shelle and Jerry

<3


What We Need & What You Get

We need some funds for studio time, paying for pressing, shipping albums to you, etc. You will get rewards such as downloads, albums, communications with the band members, even a private show!

The Impact

We have successfully funded our last album with a Kickstarter campaign and sent out all the rewards to our awesome fans!

Challenges

We are hoping to finish by the end of 2015 and release the album in early 2016, so this is our challenge!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • You can tell others about this campaing!
  • You can also use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you all!
