story:
Friends,

Thank you all for being there over the last three years as I've taken the first timid steps towards a dream I had all but forgotten. The community, support, and inspiration I've found have been unbelievable, and I'm grateful for every piece of encouragement, every gentle nudge and swift kick in the butt, all of which have guided me in the direction of my passion.

From taking the first frightened step onto the open mic stage at Cafe Deux Soleils, to writing the first songs I was actually proud of, from touring around Western Canada, to busking through the seasons to make a living on my own terms, music has shown me that I'm capable of much more than I think. It has continually pushed me, and it has allowed me to connect deeply with people through the powerful alchemy that transforms struggle into something universal and lasting.

It's taken me three years to trust it. To admit to myself how much it matters to me, and to prepare for the next challenge... Surrendering and committing myself seriously to developing a career in music. Now, I am ready to take the next step - recording my first full-length studio album. I have put my heart and soul into this collection of songs, and I'm thrilled to have some of the most talented musicians in Vancouver working with me to bring them to life. Joining me on the album will be Kenton Loewen (Dan Mangan and Blacksmith, The Crackling), Wynston Minckler (Bocephus King, Tim Sars) and Paul Pigat, who has played with the likes of Neko Case and Carolyn Mark. We will be recording the album at Afterlife Studios, under the expert guidance of John Raham, who has produced records by some of my favourite artists, including The Be Good Tanyas and Dan Mangan. I could not be more excited to work with these folks, and their talent and love of the songs has made them so much more than I ever thought they could be.

In order to make this album as we envision it, to capture the music that has been such an important part of me these last few years, and to share it with the world, some serious financial support is needed. From recording and musicians' fees to mixing, mastering and pressing, there are significant costs involved (you'll find a detailed breakdown of the album budget below). You can play an important role in making this dream a reality, simply by pre-ordering the album, or by making a donation.

As a thank you for your contribution, I have put together a selection of perks, ranging from hand-written lyrics sheets and hand-knit items, to a private house show or personalized song. You can find all the perks listed to the right. Please feel free to look them over and choose the one that appeals to you.

I invite you to share this campaign with your friends and family (via Facebook, email or good-old word of mouth). This would be a huge help. If you know someone who you think would connect with my music, or loves to support independent artists, please pass it along!

If you'd like to know more about the album, making a donation, or the perks available, please read the important information below.

Once again, thank you all for believing in me, for letting my music into your hearts, and for all of your support.

With much love,
Joline

Meet the friendly faces who are coming together to make this album happen
(clockwise from top left).


Wynston Minckler - Bass guitar
Paul Pigat - Electric guitar
Kenton Loewen - Drums, co-producer
John Raham - Recording and mixing
Joline Baylis - Songwriter, vocals, guitar, co-producer

Here is a breakdown of how your generous donations will be spent:

Important - This division applies to my fundraising goal of $12,000. Any addition money raised will go directly towards marketing, media promotion and touring.

Signed Art Print by Lauren Carr

I first discovered Lauren's artwork last summer and instantly knew I wanted her to design the cover art for my album. I also knew I wanted to incorporate Lauren's amazing work into the indiegogo campaign, and share it with all of you!

I have hand-picked three of my favourite pieces to offer as archival quality art prints. Choose one of the following, and receive an 8X10 print, signed by Lauren herself.

  • "Mermaid"


  • "Curious Ghosts"


  • "Swimmers"

  • You can check out more of Lauren's work at http://laurencarr.ca
Hand-knit Fingerless Glove Styles

  • "Branching Out"


  • "Diamond in the Rough"


  • "Cascade"


Hand-knit Fingerless Glove Colours

  • If your first choice is unavailable, I will choose an appropriate substitute

If you are unable to pre-order or donate at the moment, there are still lots of ways that you can help.

  • Direct people to the indiegogo page
  • Share the campaign on your Facebook or Twitter
  • Email your family and friends around the world (this is most effective)
  • Spread the word to music magazines, websites, blogs and other industry folks about my album and campaign

Word of mouth is still the most trusted form of advertising, so if you think this project is worth supporting, please mention it to your friends and loved ones. Anything you can do to help get this campaign on people's radar is extremely important and so very much appreciated!

Joline Baylis is a Vancouver-based singer-songwriter, poised to take her music far beyond the city that has shaped her. With a voice reminiscent of Eva Cassidy and Ani Difranco, her original material is fresh, haunting, and deeply personal. Her lyrics explore the depths and complexities of her experience with honesty and vulnerability, inviting listeners to encounter and connect with their own emotions.

In the three years since Joline has been performing in Vancouver, she has crafted an intimate and powerful solo show. She has played in local venues such as Cafe Deux Soleils, The Railway Club and The Backstage Lounge, as well as festivals around BC, including Arts Wells and Harmony Arts Festival. Touring throughout BC and Alberta, she has performed at such venues as Nancy O's in Prince George, The Bear's Paw Cafe in Wells, Owl Acoustic in Lethbridge and Ellison's Market in Nelson, where she was featured in an interview on CJLY 93.5 FM.

She has also built a loyal following by busking extensively for the past two years, in beautiful and scenic locations throughout Vancouver. Joline brings her captivating live show to the unsuspecting masses by approaching busking as another chance to deliver a powerful performance, striving to create intimacy in an unlikely setting.

Now, Joline is taking her soulfully written songs to new depths and new heights, by welcoming Kenton Loewen on drums (Dan Mangan and Blacksmith, The Crackling), Wynston Minckler on bass (Bocephus King) and Paul Pigat on electric guitar (Cousin Harley, Neko Case). The band has played together at The China Cloud and The Media Club, and are currently starting production on Joline’s first full-length album, due out in October 2015.

If you have any questions about the album, the campaign, the perks, or anything else, please don't hesitate to email me at joline.baylis@gmail.com
story_txt:
Friends,

Thank you all for
being there over the last three years as I've taken the first timid
steps towards a dream I had all but forgotten. The community,
support, and inspiration I've found have been unbelievable, and I'm
grateful for every piece of encouragement, every gentle nudge and swift kick in the
butt, all of which have guided me in the direction of my passion.

From taking the
first frightened step onto the open mic stage at Cafe Deux Soleils,
to writing the first songs I was actually proud of, from touring
around Western Canada, to busking through the seasons to make a
living on my own terms, music has shown me that I'm capable of much more
than I think. It has continually pushed me, and it has allowed me to connect deeply with people through the powerful alchemy that transforms struggle into
something universal and lasting.

It's taken me three
years to trust it. To admit to myself how much it matters to me, and
to prepare for the next challenge... Surrendering and committing myself
seriously to developing a career in music. Now, I am ready to
take the next step - recording my first full-length studio album. I
have put my heart and soul into this collection of songs, and I'm
thrilled to have some of the most talented musicians in Vancouver
working with me to bring them to life.
Joining me on the album will be Kenton Loewen (Dan Mangan and
Blacksmith, The Crackling), Wynston Minckler (Bocephus King, Tim Sars) and Paul Pigat, who
has played with the likes of Neko Case and Carolyn Mark. We will be
recording the album at Afterlife Studios, under the expert guidance
of John Raham, who has produced records by some of my favourite
artists, including The Be Good Tanyas and Dan Mangan. I could not be
more excited to work with these folks, and their talent and love of the songs has made them so much more than I ever thought they could be.In order to make this album as we envision it, to capture the music that has been such an important part of me these last few years, and to share it with the world, some serious financial support is needed. From recording and musicians' fees to mixing, mastering and pressing, there are significant costs involved (you'll find a detailed breakdown of the album budget below). You can play an important role in making this dream a reality, simply by pre-ordering the album, or by making a donation.As a thank you for
your contribution, I have put together a selection of perks, ranging
from hand-written lyrics sheets and hand-knit items, to a private
house show or personalized song. You can find all the perks listed to the right. Please feel free to look them over and choose the one that appeals to you.I invite you to share this campaign with your friends and family (via Facebook, email or good-old word of mouth). This would be a huge help. If you know someone who you think would connect with my music, or loves to support independent artists, please pass it along!If you'd like to know more about the album, making a donation, or the perks available, please read the important information below.Once again, thank you all for believing in me, for letting my music into your hearts, and for all of your support.With much love,JolineMeet the friendly faces who are coming together to make this album happen(clockwise from top left).Wynston Minckler - Bass guitarPaul Pigat - Electric guitarKenton Loewen - Drums, co-producerJohn Raham - Recording and mixingJoline Baylis - Songwriter, vocals, guitar, co-producerHere is a breakdown of how your generous donations will be spent:Important - This division applies to my fundraising goal of $12,000. Any addition money raised will go directly towards marketing, media promotion and touring.Signed Art Print by Lauren CarrI first discovered Lauren's artwork last summer and instantly knew I wanted her to design the cover art for my album. I also knew I wanted to incorporate Lauren's amazing work into the indiegogo campaign, and share it with all of you!I have hand-picked three of my favourite pieces to offer as archival quality art prints. Choose one of the following, and receive an 8X10 print, signed by Lauren herself.
"Mermaid"

"Curious Ghosts"

"Swimmers"
You can check out more of Lauren's work at http://laurencarr.ca
Hand-knit Fingerless Glove Styles"Branching Out""Diamond in the Rough""Cascade"Hand-knit Fingerless Glove ColoursIf your first choice is unavailable, I will choose an appropriate substituteIf you are unable to pre-order or donate at the moment, there are still lots of ways that you can help.
Direct people to the indiegogo page
Share the campaign on your Facebook or Twitter
Email your family and friends around the world (this is most effective)
Spread the word to music magazines, websites, blogs and other industry folks about my album and campaign
Word of mouth is still the most trusted form of advertising, so if you think this project is worth supporting, please mention it to your friends and loved ones. Anything you can do to help get this campaign on people's radar is extremely important and so very much appreciated!Joline Baylis is a Vancouver-based singer-songwriter, poised to take her music far beyond the city that has shaped her. She has also built a loyal following by busking extensively for the past two years, in beautiful and scenic locations throughout Vancouver. Joline brings her captivating live show to the unsuspecting masses by approaching busking as another chance to deliver a powerful performance, striving to create intimacy in an unlikely setting.

story:
Welcome everybody.  I am Harrison B, a Progressive American Soul artist born and raised in Tennessee.  I was 22 when I packed up my Jeep for Juneau, Alaska for the first time.  I learned  about this Continent and the people, and about myself.  In a small bar in Juneau Alaska, I found my voice.  6 Months later I drove home and recorded "The Harrison B LP".  A year after that I recorded "Down At Brown's" in my Hometown of Lascassas, TN.  Now, 18 months later I am driving the whole continent to record my first Full-Length Studio Album in Anchorage, AK.

Since 2010 I have been driving, flying, bussing, and boating this country performing all along the way.  The songs on this album grew out of all those places and people.   Starting March 18th I decided tore-trace my footsteps from New York to Alaska and a recording studio named Studio 2200.  I am excited that we are finally in a place to record music that has been in the works for many years.  I feel like we are finally ready and I want you to share in this experience with me.
You contributing to this journey will help achieve the largest mile-stone in my recording career to date and in return, you will receive my best work yet.  I am still an Independent Artist, and I need support to get projects like this off the ground.  Once it is, I guarantee you will be pleased with the end product.

We have a goal of $3,000 for this recording.  Where does this money go? 
  • Studio Time: We are recording in Studio 2200 in Anchorage, AK.  A studio with the ideal setup and gear for this project.
  • Studio Mastering:  This is a critical part of all Recordings, a final pass that gives you the Warmth, Brilliance, and Volume that you have come to love in your favorite recordings.
  • CD Printing:  Creation and Duplication of the Discs themselves, their Packaging, and their Distribution.
  • Approx. Half of the Travel Expenses:  Taking care of a portion of the cost of the drive from NY to AK where the album is to be recorded.
  • Delivery:  All shipping costs are included in this project.
This Pre-Sale Fundraiser is set-up around you being a part of the process. So alot of the Items & Experiences available are based around this principle of immersing you with the experience as much as possible.  Concerts in your home, a cover of any song you choose, the Original Hand-Written Album Lyric Sheets from the "Song Wall".  Not to mention an Acoustic version of the Album is Included with every purchase!  
If we do not reach our goal,  I will do whatever it takes to make sure that those that contributed get the album that they paid for.  It may take more time but I will get it done.  I will honor those who have commited.

This Project is my unique take in a forming Genre. My approach has always been to listen to my heart and make the music in my head.  You have the chance to be a part of this sound.  This album is the incarnation of that idea, and a chance to forge a direction in the Musical Landscape.

My Last Pre-Sale Project, "Down At Brown's", released on time as promised and was exactly what it was promised to be.  Expect nothing different from this album, you will get exactly what you pay for.

This has been an in-surmountable undertaking from the start.  Before we even record the first note the planning will have been carried out for over 4 Months and by the time it is over I will have traveled over 7,500 Miles.  But if I was in the habit of allowing hurdles to become road-blocks, I would have been out of this a long time ago.    All the nights sleeping in the truck, all the travel and the cold, all worth getting to share the playback with all of you.  I am commited.  To this dream, to this Music, to you people.  I can't thank you enough for your time, now let's make an album!

-HB

Love the idea and just don't have any means to help out?  I know the feeling and you can still be a crucial part!  Spreading the word will be a HUGE part of this!  Share on Facebook, tell your friends, co-workers, Grandmother, or anyone else you think might legitimately enjoy this project!  Indiegogo has great tools to help with this sharing and get the word out!

story:
Ladies and Gentlemen, we have TWO brand new CD's for you!

Since we released Bones of Contention a couple of years ago, ("Voluptuously proportioned and an infectious disregard for musical convention" - Folk Radio UK, "****" R2 Magazine), we've been rather busy! However, somewhere between two busy festival seasons, numerous tours, John having a baby, Ali writing film music for Hollywood, and Dave starting about eight new bands, we've managed to put together not one but two fantastic CD's of music for your ears!

The EP


First of all, we have the EP, entitled I'm Alive. This consists of five new tracks that we have slowly been integrating into our set for the past year or so. The title comes from the track I'm Alive Mamma that has been one of the spearhead tracks of our live set for a while now. You can find a video of the track here - filmed by the wonderful people at the Arena Sessions.

We also have two new original tracks, Old Tom's  Waltz  and The Little Man - both of these are taken from tunes that JLB fiddler Alastair Caplin wrote, along with words and music from John, and mind-blowingly diverse arrangements and grooves from Bassist Dave Tunstall. 

Finally, we have two completely unique arrangements of traditional Romany Gypsy songs, Djelem Djelem and Amarisi Amari. John picked up these songs while he and his wife Emily were travelling around Eastern Europe. We have taken these gypsy anthems and given them a heavy dose of JLB madness and punch, creating two massively powerful and evocative tracks for musicians and music-lovers around the globe.

The EP was recorded at DADA studios in London by George Botis and Alex Miaris, mastered by Garry Boyle.

Live at The Globe


Last November we had the privilege to play at The Sam Wanamaker Theatre at Shakespeare's Globe. We played two sets to a packed house full of your smiling faces! We were lucky enough to have the amazing Matthew Organ doing our live sound, and also the extremely talented Tansay Omar recording every note that we played! We were also blessed to have Annie Klein from New Horizon Media filming the whole gig - you can see the resulting video of The Winter Song here.

JLB fiddler Ali mixed the recordings from the gig, again mastered by Garry Boyle, into a 70 minute 8 track album. The tracks are a mix of songs from our previous album Bones of Contention and new songs. 

The recordings on this album are completely infused with the wonderfully electric energy that we received from the audience, and though you may recognise the songs, you won't have heard them like this before! 

A unique double CD

We have decided to release these two CD's as a double CD featuring original artwork from Glen Leslie who has designed our posters and website for the last 18 months, and photos of our gig at The Globe courtesy once again of Annie Klein. 


THE RELEASE

 


We are doing two releases of this double album in two fantastic venues - in The Islington Assembly Rooms in London on the 8th May, and in the newly rebuilt Art School in Glasgow on the 15th May. For both these events we have the very cream of the current folk scene supporting us (Phillip Henry & Hannah Martin, Dallahan, Ross Ainslie & Jarleth Henderson, DJ Dolphin Boy) and they are guaranteed to be phenomenally entertaining nights!

What we need and what you get

We have already recorded, mixed and mastered both of these recordings and they are ready to go straight to get pressed! To make this happen, we are inviting you all to preorder your copies! They will be available for you on the Launch dates of the albums. If you look to the right of this text you can see a list of the options you can purchase, including coveted tickets to the launch night gigs and brand new band T-shirts.

So, finally … 

We are immensely proud of both of these sets of recordings, and we can't wait to get them out into the world! To make this happen we need as much help from people as possible in terms of both pre-ordering copies of them, and also sharing around this crowd funding page so as many people as possible get to hear about what we are releasing!

So please, lovers of music, lend us a hand in releasing this beast and we will reward you with hours of ridiculous sweat-drenched dancing and frivolity!

Many thanks,

John, Dave and Ali

Photo by Francesca Wilkins

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm Andrei Gherman.  I’m a song writer, and I’m passionate about God’s love for all peoples. There are lots of people that have never had a chance to experience this love. So through a project I found a way to put my passions together for a greater cause.

How? I gathered many Romanian Christian artists together to record an album that also shares their passion. It contains songs that display the reality of God's global perspective and the opportunity for us to participate in it. The album’s name is  "Dincolo de Frontiere" (Beyond Frontiers)

This project is off to a great start: recordings are in process, the first two concerts are already planned and interest is rapidly growing. For this effort to have an exponential impact, however, we need even more funding and support.

Here’s where you can help:

Cost for entire project: 3500 Euro (3,760 USD):

  • three days (coordinating) meeting with artists 200 Euro (215 USD)
  • record and distribute 500 albums - 1,500 Euro (1,610 USD)
  • overhead for concert hall - 500 Euro (537 USD)
  • media production for the entire project - 350 Euro (376 USD)
  • sound systems installation: 350 Euro (376 USD)
  • promotional materials : 250 Euro (270 USD)
  • travel expenses: 350 Euro (376 USD)

Impact

We know that concerts come and go. From this one (and others to come), we desire to see his love move “Beyond Frontiers” to where it is seldom experienced.


Artists
Do you want to know more details? Check out these links: 

Cristian Cazacu  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iLEVuI3_5IY
Chris https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TksijrmtlJk
Viorela Cioban https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Wc5a3nqy8q0
Viorel Dejeu https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=97gb4Er_IBI
Liviu Bocaneala https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3ZtWVBy8xOg
Cornel Olar https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uEzZyCummJ4
Andrei Gherman https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WPTxofYDpxc
Stacy Walker https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BYGREkSJ70M
4motion https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=03Z8Kpe8C-g
SkyDive https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IlgSmos90SA
Ami si Crista https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q_7g77ye_KY
Adi Calbajos https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YJSZ9JiyBY0
Cristi Tranca si Liviu Deac https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=l71utLJZbUc
Alex Cuibus https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wmEJ5uCTw4U

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute financially at this time, please make some "noise" about the campaign. Use indiegogo to share it!

story:
My name is Kayla Loren. These past few years haven't been the easiest. I have stack of lyrics, melodies and songs just sitting, collecting dust. I continue to write a song a day which only furthers my frustration. I HAVE to make this EP, not only to get these songs out but for my own sanity. So I reached out to a musical hero of mine, Kevin Devine, and asked if he'd be interested in helping me achieve this dream of my first solo EP. To my surprise he has agreed and I know the final result will be music i can stand by and be 100% proud of it.

   The funds are around $5,000 for production and all that good studio stuff. If you donate I will either cover the song of your choice and send you your own customized flannel OR create a some artwork just for you. All funds raised will go directly into the EP.

story:
Hace mucho tiempo que deseábamos que CONSOLACION fuera la sede de algún evento relacionado con las artes escénicas o con la música.
Y no solo por lo mágico del lugar, sino porqué creemos que no todo debe pasar en las ciudades y Monroyo, sus estrellas, el aire, el espectacular paisaje son el escenario perfecto para que pasen "otras"cosas...

Como los sueños necesitan financiación;  hacer cosas en los pueblos cuesta pasta ya que no es fácil mover a la gente y como CONSOLACIÓN no puede sufragarlo en su totalidad, hemos decidido abrir esta vía de financiación. Con el dinero que pedimos podremos trasladar a los dos grupos invitados (hemos sido modestos) desde Liverpool y Barcelona y habilitar la sala para que suene de cine.

Nos encanta la idea de que la gente del Matarraña, del Bajo Aragón , del Maestrazgo y todos aquellos que lo deseen, vengan de donde vengan , tengan la oportunidad de escuchar buena música internacional cerca de su casa o en el más bello de los escenarios posible.

FILA CERO. Nos gustaría que vengáis todos, pero aquellos que no podáis hacerlo  podéis colaborar con lo que os apetezca y así también estaréis con nosotros (en cierto modo) y colaboraréis a hacer posible este festival.

7 de marzo 2015: Sensational HIT Soul Band. Liverpool
9 de mayo 2015: A Contra Blues. Barcelona

story:
Our mission.
It is known that 1 in 7 people from age 12 and older will have an issue with addiction and is estimated that 40 million people are affected as a whole. RecoveryRockFest wishes to provide a clean, sober, and substance free rock-folk concert environment with a message of recovery from addiction with a portion of RRF funds going to support our local university UNCW-CRC Recovery Program* for students in recovery.

THE CRC program at The University of North Carolina Wilmington offers resources for UNCW students in recovery from alcohol and drug addiction, gambling addiction, and those affected by other people's addiction.
What it costs to produced RRF:

 

Most concert events drive their income by selling alcohol and being known for other available substances at these events, which is why RecoveryRockFest needs donations to make this happen.

The cost to produce RecoveryRockfest is $11,700 which pays for: artists/performers, Kenan Auditorium, transportation services, hotel accommodations, crew chief and crew technicians, security, parking attendants, ushers, food services, sound engineer and stage crew, sound equipment rentals, print t-shirts/posters, pay for and maintain the website, advertising and print tickets.

    What becoming an RRF Partner means:

    By reaching our goal, it will give us an opportunity to carry a message of hope of recovery through the gift of music. **
    **Some persons newly in recovery may not be able to afford a ticket.               By choosing levels 4-7, it gives the opportunity help those newly in recovery to attend RecoveryRockFest. 

    AND by your support at any level, it would also allow RRF to provide:

     

    • a substance free environment supporting people in recovery from addiction
    • inspiration to someone who might want recovery and/or has been thinking about recovery
    • an environment families and friends can all enjoy together
    • continued support for students in recovery as they continue their education
    • a message that you can have a cool fun time without using substances
    • an event model for future clean and sober events throughout the USA
    • allows RRF to become self supporting after its first years funding through ticket sales

    Other ways to help.

    By getting the word out and and sharing this event by using the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Story

My name is Pete Cannella. I am a local singer/ song writer/arranger in New Jersey trying to get my start as a professional recording artist. I got my start as a singer in Okinawa Japan. When I returned home I continued singing as a solo artist in the U.S. mostly in New Jersey, Delaware, and Pennsylvania. I have written quite a few songs but my equipment is not good enough for professional quality. I have raised enough for one track but I have 6 more to go to complete my EP album. People are really going to enjoy this. It's a breathe of fresh air from the same sound, same vibe and sets itself to a high standard. With your contributions I can make what I am out to pursue happen a lot faster. Once my EP is complete it is time for promotions.

How You Can Help & What You Get

  • All funding is transferred to my business paypal account that I use for selling merchandise and credit card payments for live performances. The funding then goes to WesMix Productions in Detroit Michigan owned by Kevin Wesley Williams. He will then take the charts I wrote and hire studio musicians to play and record their parts. Once finished it goes into mixing with my vocal tracks that I record in New Jersey and e-mail to Detroit. The price range for this is between $500 to $1100 per song. The last phase of recording is mastering. The mix track gets sent to Mastering House Inc in Pottstown Pennsylvania to Tom Volpicelli for a total of $75 per song. When all recordings are complete they go to Disc Hounds in West Chester PA to be packaged for a total of $700 for every 300 CD's. These songs will also be on I Tunes and sold digitally. The total project cost is anywhere from $5,000 to $10,000 dollars
  • If funds are left over they are kept in the business paypal account and will be used for the full length album LP. The songs I write will never end so the money will always go to production.

The Impact

  • This project has much value to many people who love music. There are many people out there that want to hear a new sound with real instruments and a fresh new talent. The originality stays in the pocket of the norm to not get too abstract to where the audience doesn't get it. Most of the songs I write are about real life events. Some are happy, some sad but all great for the mind and soul.
  • Innovative new artists always catch the main stream if they catch the peoples attention. What catches their attention is a great rhythm/beat, melody, a great voice and themes they relate to. My facebook audience has always given me praise and loves my tracks. On my youtube account my videos are at a 98% like rate. I can't reach everyone but the people I do all like it. These are strangers 90% of the time so I know it's right.

Risks & Challenges

  • The risk is simple, the with all the talent and all the work I put into this, it still needs to be noticed by someone. I can promote myself and run campaigns for promotions but I still need to get a little lucky to be found. To me I don't lose out if I don't hit it big. My project is for my fans I have already and to continue expressing myself through music.
  • My plan for minimizing this list is getting together with promotional companies and agencies to help get my stuff out there. On my own I will also promote as much as I can and share to as many as possible. It's a matter of marketing and with the right methods in place I can increase my chances.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Contribution with money is not the only way to help my campaign. Just getting the word out about it can really help what I am doing. So if you are interested but don't have the extra and still want to help, a simple sharing on facebook or word of mouth can help.
  • To share use the indiegogo share tools to make it all easier!!!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hi,
this is Massimo Kyo, musician, composer and a meditation facilitator as I spent so many years in meditation communities where I trained.
I'm born the 3rd october 1974 in Castellammare di Stabia, Naples.
As a musician I grew passing through many different kind of music, starting with classical music, experimenting with electronic music, reaching a point of softness and firmness thanks to the meditation.
After a period spent on a process of personal introspection and growth, I created a brand new musical project called Music is Love.

Here in tuscany  I have, with my family, a small home meditation  center where once in a week we propose Mantra Yoga.

I'm also doing Mantra Yoga in many Yoga centers in Italy.

This Mantra Yoga or Mantra Chanting is a process that, through songs and awareness techniques, leads us to a deep relaxation and to the rediscovery of our harmony. 

Here a Video slideshow with images from the circles of Chanting and Meditation:


In April 2015 I released a first  Cd Sing a Mantra, which is a collection of Mantras played and recorded by me and many other talented musicians.
And now I want to keep on doing that's why I'm working to the second volume of the album Sing a Mantra.
 Any Spiritual traditions use the chants as a moment of sharing, celebration and integration and I love to discover the most beautiful songs of different cultures.
In this new episode I propose you Mantras with Millenium of History, Instrumental Songs for Meditation and much more..
Many Artists collaborations will be working on the cd as in the first one.
Your Support is very welcome and will be a  contribute to spread more light in this world.
Please enjoy it
Namasté

The jacket cd will be 4 panel foldable eco-wallets

Have a Listen of Sing a Mantra  - vol.1

story:
Short Summary

Hi we're First Year On Earth. We're a band based in Austin Texas but hail from all over - Montana, California, Texas and Australia. 

This campaign is about completing our dream of recording/releasing a full length album. 

With your help we can get our music out there. We'd love to show the world what we've been up to!

What We Need & What You Get

Including studio hire, production fee's, mixing, mastering, artwork and distribution we're estimating the album to cost around $5500. That will give us 10-12 new songs. If we're lucky enough to raise more then that we will put it towards a US tour.
Absolutely anything helps, we're all poor musicians, me with a baby on the way! $5 or $500 and we'll be your BFF.
Some incentives for donating:
$1 - $10 = Highfive next time we see you
$10 - $20 = Digital copy of the album + free entry to album release show
$20 - $50 = Signed physical copy of the Album + Digital copy
$50 - $100 = Entire FYOE catalog including first EP, unreleased material studio recordings and live performance recordings + All of the above 
$100 - $200 = Signed album/tour posters + All of the above 
$200-$300 = Physical or Skype music lesson with anyone in the band (Guitar, Drums, Bass or Vocals)  + All of the above 
$500+ = Private solo or duo show for you and friends at your place (Travel expenses would need to be covered) + All of the above 
$700+ = Private full band show for you and your friends at your place (Travel expenses would need to be covered) + All of the above 

Risks & Challenges

To save on cost and to help create a cool vibe we'll be tracking most the instruments live with good friends and collaborator Matt Meli. No fancy bells and whistles or studio tricks, just us in a room together playing our hearts out.
We hope recording this way will capture something raw. Maybe not the perfect polish you hear on the radio, but something uniquely us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/firstyearonearth/

You'll find us on the other social media outlets to,  just search First Year on Earth.

Thank you for your time and support.

Ryan

story:
I am Jelena, nice to meet you!

Here is my story...
I am a girl born in Serbia. I moved to Slovenia to study oboe at Music Academy, where I graduated from both artistic and pedagogic program. After that I've continued my studies in Vienna for one more year. 
Since than I have been teaching part-time in music school and for the rest of the time composing, practicing, performing... composing, practicing, performing (you can find my CV in Image Gallery).... and all that on cracked instrument. When that oboe stopped playing I managed to borrow one used instrument 4 years ago and since than I had hard time saving money for a new one. But I did it, with concerts and a lot of hard work a got a brand new professional oboe and with that jewel I passed the audition for Berklee!!!


And this is where my campaign begins.
I have been accepted to Berklee Master's program Contemporary Performance with Production Concentration in Valencia Campus but I have used all of my funds for buying my own instrument, and the tuition fee is $41,100. I have already managed to cover half of the fee by winning the Berklee scholarship. Half more to go!

So here are the numbers:

Expences:
$41,100 tuition fee
$1,215 comprehensive fee
- Required software bundle (the amount not announced yet) 
- Rent and living expenses for 10 months (min. 500e per month)
- Indiegogo fee and conversion form USD to EUR fee (depends on collected amount)

What I got:
$20,000 scholarship from Berklee

 To sum it up, the $25,000 are just to cover the tuition fee.

So, if we manage to exceed this amount, I will use the extra money to cover rent expenses and it will allow me to have more focus on my studies and less on working on monthly bases.
But if we don't reach the goal, still every euro counts and helps. The tuition is to be paid in 3 payments, and with every payment I get to stay longer in school and develop more.

And why is this important to me?
Because for once it is a recognition of all of mine hard work and dedication. But it is also a tremendous opportunity for me to develop my talent further and learn from some of the world's leading musicians in contemporary music field.
And here you can help bring this talent to blossom. You can help enrich the future music treasures as I can hardly wait to learn and work even more and set free all this music trapped inside of me.

I believe that music and art in general is the best medicine to human's soul. In my seven years of active teaching and working with children, I have been convinced of how much impact music has on both psychical and physical development of a person. The time has come in my life where I am ready to go to the next level, develop more and be able to give back more through playing and teaching. And to reach that goal, Berklee College of Music is the way for me. 


To say thanks for your generous help, I have prepared a bunch of interesting perks, like writing songs with dedication, drawing personalized mandalas, funky birthday songs, live concerts and much moreeeeee....
Just check out the list on the right and pick your favourite. 

      

(some of my drawings - mandalas)

Even if you can't help by donating, every share (via Facebook or Indiegogo share tool) and spreading word to friends would mean a fortune!
Here are links to some of my projects, and please check video gallery for live concert recorgings. 
PostArt Ensemble
Natemago

story:
Why?

Last Summer, members of the S.T.A.R.S. (Singers Taking Action Reaching Souls) traveled to Burundi, East Africa. During that visit, the S.T.A.R.S. shared the stage with some of the most incredible choirs we have ever heard.  The music was so inspirational, we immediately decided to form The International Music Exchange. 

For the last several years, we have been traveling around the world sharing our music and we realize that it is time for us to bring some of the amazing voices we've heard to our friends, families and loved ones. . . America.

We are happy to announce that our inaugural exchange will be Kenya's Safari Voices International (SVI), a twenty-voice ensemble that gives soul-stirring performances and shares our vision for raising the vibration of our human family through song.  

Our intention, with your support, is to bring the Kenyans to America this Fall to perform in venues in New York, Washington D. C., Los Angeles and Las Vegas.  

This project will require your generous support, as flights, hotels, chartered buses and food will be needed during the ten days that the S.T.A.R.S. Foundation will be hosting them.  SVI will perform in churches, schools and concert halls and it will be a dream come true to have them perform in the White House and . . .we believe in miracles.

The S.T.A.R.S. Foundation (Souls Taking Action Reaching Souls) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization and all of your donations are tax deductible.

Donate Today and Be Part of This Miracle!
story_txt:
Why? Last Summer, members of the S.T.A.R.S. (Singers Taking Action Reaching Souls) traveled to Burundi, East Africa. During that visit, the S.T.A.R.S. shared the stage with some of the most incredible choirs we have ever heard.  The music was so inspirational, we immediately decided to form The International Music Exchange. 
For the last several years, we have been traveling around the world sharing our music and we realize that it is time for us to bring some of the amazing voices we've heard to our friends, families and loved ones. . . America.
We are happy to announce that our inaugural exchange will be Kenya's Safari Voices International (SVI), a twenty-voice ensemble that gives soul-stirring performances and shares our vision for raising the vibration of our human family through song.  
Our intention, with your support, is to bring the Kenyans to America this Fall to perform in venues in New York, Washington D. C., Los Angeles and Las Vegas.  
This project will require your generous support, as flights, hotels, chartered buses and food will be needed during the ten days that the S.T.A.R.S. Foundation will be hosting them.  SVI will perform in churches, schools and concert halls and it will be a dream come true to have them perform in the White House and . . .we believe in miracles.
The S.T.A.R.S. Foundation (Souls Taking Action Reaching Souls) is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization and all of your donations are tax deductible.
Donate Today and Be Part of This Miracle!

story:
Who are We? 

Philanthropy Tea & Coffee Co. and The Purple Cat Winery are two separate businesses working in the same building located in Chepachet, RI.  The Purple Cat Winery is producing and selling its wine right there on site and hold wine tastings and corporate events and host special events. 

Philanthropy or "the Phil" as it's sometimes affectionately called is a full service restaurant serving crepes, salads, sandwiches, desserts, and amazing drinks.  Philanthropy gives a portion of its sales to the NOT FOR SALE organization.  NOT FOR SALE is an amazing group working to abolish human trafficking and modern day slavery.  Philanthropy believes that NO ONE is for sale.

-The campaign is to raise funds for a sound system for events, open mic nights, and full concerts at the amazing space here!  We've been holding open mic nights every Thursday night for 7 weeks now.  Started with a few and now has grown and continues to grow every week.  Amazing artists have come out to share their hearts through their particular art.  Poetry, stories, and music mostly.  We desperately need to outfit location with sound reinforcement.  It is our goal to do everything we put our hands to with exceptional-ism to the best of our ability.   Not to be a "cool venue" but to be a inviting, warm, special place, where art meets the needs of people suffering all over the world.  


What We Need & What You Get

We need 2 powered 12" speaker tops

2 powered 18" sub speakers

8 XLR cables

5 Microphones

         - 3 vocal microphones

         - 2 instrument microphones

Sound Board digital  hoping for a Mackie DL1608 

2 powered stage monitors QSC K10

3 Direct Boxes

story:
Ella May Wiggins Memorial Committee

The Ella May Wiggins Memorial Committee was founded in 2011 with the purpose of establishing a memorial for Ella May.  The group became a nonprofit organization in 2014 and chose award-winning sculptor Steve Pi to construct a 5'6" bronze statue of Ella.  Steve, like many when exposed to Ella May's story became passionate about paying tribute to this pioneer of social justice.

Award-Winning Sculptor Steve Pi

Steve Pi donated the two foot clay mock up he constructed of Ella May. The mock up will be used as a model for the life-sized version of the statue.  The total for expenses involved in the construction and placement of the life-sized bronze statue are estimated between $80,000-$100,000.  Right now we are seeking the minimum amount required to begin construction of the life-sized statue, $10,000.  The statue will be placed in a prominent place in Gastonia, the epicenter of the 1929 Loray Mill Strike.  

We the People Can Do It

The task of raising the full amount required for the statue is a daunting one.  The memorial committee will continue to pursue grant opportunities throughout this process.  However, we don't want the construction of Ella May's statue to halt.  $10,000 will keep the project moving.  Furthermore, it seems only fitting that working men and women, the working class, spearhead this cause.  

Ella May-Martyr fighting for Social Justice

  

Ella May was a textile worker, a union organizer, and a balladeer.  A pregnant Ella May was shot to death on her way to a Gastonia, NC union meeting in 1929.  She was the mother of nine.  Four of her children died due to her inability to feed them properly, or give them appropriate medical care.  She boldly spoke up publicly about her plight, and the plight of her black neighbors, the need for a living wage.  She sang heartfelt ballads and others were moved.  Her ability to make a difference, her promotion of social change, made her a target.  On September 14, 1929 Ella May was forever silenced, however with your help we will make sure that she will always be remembered.  


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially yourself to a fitting memorial to Ella May please consider sharing this link on facebook.  

Thank You to Campaign Contributors

Committee Photo-Mike Hensdill                                                                                   Sculpture Photos-Tammy Cantrell                                                                                       Video Production-Suzanne Hinesley                                                                                             Music Incentive Contributors-David Childers, Mule Dixon, and Dan Montville                 Book Incentive Contributors-Kristina Horton and George Loveland                                 Art Incentive Contributors-Tammy Cantrell, Facet Foundrey, and Steve Pi

story:
This is my dream. Can you help with it?

I'm Anu from Finland and I'm huge fan of indie music.

I have helped many musicians and bands from all over the world. I have donated money to them to make albums, I have bought their music, t-shirts, coffee mugs etc. and I have sent quite a lot of money to sick musician to help him with medical expense.

Aaaand now I think I'm screwed. I'd like to go to UK in June to see TEN-79 band and two amazing guitarists, Jack and Tom (Bad Cardigan). They will be performing in Fylde Rock and Roots festival at Birchwood Country Park, on the Fylde coast, just outside Lytham, Lancashire, UK.

YOUR contribution would make a HUGE different for me. I'm most humble if you can help me with this - even a little...

I have already bought the tickets for weekend and paid the hotel reservation. I'm taking my daughter with me to help me due to my own lame vision. I'm a bit scared to go alone. I need your help to get airline tickets and train tickets for both of us and it might be nice to eat too couple of times.

Deeply thanking everybody!

story:
The COLLECTION

After over a decade combined of rapping and 2 1/2 years of working together as FYC Militia Productions, Jessy James and Isaac Stinson are excited to be able to put out "The Collection," an album inspired by poetry and the desire to reverse the negative state of music, especially hip-hop, today.

What We Need & What You Get

We'll keep this simple. We're a relatively new and unestablished label being headed up by two college students trying to turn it into a career, and the cost of album production, manufacturing, promotion and distribution ain't cheap. Some different aspects of the process include:

  • Musical production (acquiring beats, recording, mixing, mastering, etc.), for which we have agreed to pay our producer $1,500
  • Artwork such as graphic design (approx. $600) and photoshoots (approx. $200)
  • Physical production and distribution for CDs (anywhere between $500-$1200) and, if fundraising goal is reached, vinyls (anywhere between $1500-$2500)
  • Marketing, ordering merchandise, and other miscellaneous costs (upwards of $1000)
While the total costs illustrated here are higher than the fundraising goal covers, we are also working diligently to contribute to the project for the sake of individually funding as much of it as we can.
I'll also point out that the more support we get, the more able we are to make a high quality project. We both believe that this album will legitimately impact people in a positive way, and it certainly has the potential to change the hip-hop scene in Nashville.

The Perks

We want to treat this crowdfunding effort similarly to how we would treat preordering the album, with some modifications. That being said, here are the benefits to contrubuting (keep in mind that the "INCLUDING" segment only applies to one tier at a time, i.e. if you were to donate $50, it includes a reward at the $5 and $25 levels, but does not count the fact that the $25 level already includes the $5 level.):
-$5 will get you an FYC Sticker upon the release of the album.
-$10 will be considered a standard preorder of the album, meaning a physical copy of "The Collection" will be shipped to you on the day of the release. (INCLUDED: $5 perk)
-$25 towards our goal will get you a signed physical copy of "The Collection" delivered to your door along with our most recent release "Butterfly Effect," shipped on August 26th. (INCLUDED: $5 perk)
-$50 gets you an exclusive signed "The Collection" poster. (INCLUDED: $5 and $25 perk)
-$100 earns you the privilege of taking as your own whatever item you want from the "The Collection" merchandise upon the album's release (t-shirts, hoodies, etc.). (PLUS the $5, $25, and $50 perk)
-$250 aka The Full Package: 3 (signed) albums, 1 (signed) poster, 2 pieces of merchandise and a special mention on our website and social media upon the completion of your donation. (INCLUDED: $5 perk)
-$500 gets your name in a special thank you on the inside flap of the album. (INCLUDED: $5 and $250 perk)
-$1000 (seriously, thank you) will be good for a personalized performance at your choosing, whatever your location may be. House party, birthday, youth group, work retreat, sporting event, etc. We don't care what it is, we will be there and we will be happy to perform. (INCLUDED: $5, $250, and $500 perks)
-Over $1200: Let's discuss potential returns on album sales, special artwork, or anything else you might want. This gift would be a real blessing.

The Impact

Since we released "Butterfly Effect" last November, we've seen an incredible response to our mission. People from church groups and dive bars alike have been excited about our music, and we are equally as excited to be able to share the best music we have to offer. Rap today has deviated from truth, and we want to bring it back. We want it to be about our collective story, about poetry, about what it means to be human. We believe that this album will have what it takes to spark a new movement in hip hop, and we are beyond ecstatic about the implications of being a part of that.

Risks & Challenges

FYC has some ambitious goals, and we recognize that. As it is, the biggest risk is that the money we need doesn't come in as soon as we would prefer, and album production has to be delayed. You can help this! Any donation is appreciated and will play a pivotal role in the release of this record.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word!!! We have a plethora of social media outlets where people can hear our music and follow us as artists. Help share this project and some of our previous music and you could inspire more people to invest in the cause of meaningful and impactful hip-hop!

  • www.fycmilitia.com
  • Instagram: @fycmilitia
  • Twitter: @fycmproductions
  • https://soundcloud.com/fyc-militia-productions

story:
We're putting on our next concert with CLAW, the Contemporary Los Angeles Winds, and we need your help!

Members of the Los Angeles Composers Collective have written new pieces for CLAW and we're excited to present this collaboration this month. The composers whose pieces will be premiered are:

Jon Brenner
Derek Dobbs
Gregory Lenczycki
Ryan Lester
Tu Nguyen
Danielle Rosaria
Nicholas White

All of the money we're raising goes directly to pay for performance and venue fees, and because LACC is a 501(c)(3) non-profit, your donation will also be tax-deductible!

By supporting our campaign, you'll receive great perks including recordings of this upcoming concert, commissions for pieces by a composer of your choice, and more!

Live new music has always been a part of our history, but it's become more challenging to keep that tradition going. Help us in our mission to support this generation of music-making by contemporary composers and performers and make a contribution today!

Thank you!


Friday, October 23, 8pm
Ross Chapel, Neighborhood Unitarian Universalist Church
301 N. Orange Grove Blvd
Pasadena, CA 91103
$15 admission
Get tickets

story:
Left to right:  Andy Zipper, Jordi Baizan, Jose Verdugo, Dustin Wolfe

Summary

QandA is a band on a journey that began in 2010.  We have put our heart and soul into making music that resonates within us and that pushes our creativity to a level we have never achieved.    Our music has brought us local success both on the radio and at some of the best venues.  We have also made some inroads regionally and outside the country.

But we feel strongly that QandA's music needs to be heard by more people.  This campaign for our third record is a huge opportunity to help our band become a very strong regional player with a growing following around the country and abroad.   What does it mean to achieve our goal of being a strong regional player?  

  • Regular regional/national radio play
  • Success on the record charts from regular radio play
  • More shows at quality venues and festivals due to record chart success and radio play
  • Greater fan attendance at shows and growing fan base due to all the above

What a huge honor is it is for us to partner with the friends and fans who believe in us and what we are doing.   Together we can make a great record and get it into the hands, minds, and ears of more people than ever before!

What We Need & What You Get

 $8,000 is needed to make this record.  $2,000 is needed for a national radio campaign targeted to the type of audiences that we think will value our music.  What we have done is put together a series of valuable reward packages in exchange for contributions.  There's some really cool stuff for contributors to enjoy!

We need to raise $13,000 worth of contributions to achieve the $10,000 funding goal after you take out the costs of goods, shipping, and fees (Indiegogo, payment).  If we don't reach the entire goal,  QandA commits to using the funds towards the $10,000 needed and we will have find a way to raise the rest over time.

The Impact

Many of you have followed our progress over the last 5 years.  We have come a long way and could not have done it without your support.  Because of your faith in QandA and what we do, your contribution and support will get us to a level we only dreamed about just a few years back.  A little band from Houston, TX  growing to a regional and national player?   It seems hard to believe.  Thank you for believing!


Risks and Challenges

Of course, there are no guarantees in life.  The record might not be as good as we think it is.  The radio audiences might not like our music.  The promotion efforts might fall flat. 

What we have done to overcome these challenges is to associate ourselves with proven players in the business.  Our producer, Ren Renfree, is a successful national touring musician with a record deal, chart success, and tremendous connections across the country with festivals and venues alike.  Ren takes very few projects each year, but he truly believes in QandA and in this project.  Additionally, we have his support after the recording is done and access to his contacts in all aspects of recording, booking, touring, and promotion.   With a great team behind us, we are confident that we will meet and exceed our goal.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

    • We are asking all of you to please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
    • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Hello!!!

Just a quick thank you for taking to time to check out this project.

With this Indie Go Go campaign's success I hope to record the record of my dreams. Currently I am creating and recording music with an incredibly talented and supportive team. With your help we can execute a very high quality production and give us room to really take the songs I have written to another level! 

I have been following music as a career for years and been through many ups and downs as you do. After years of chipping away I feel I have finally found my feet with the help of Anthony Braunagel and Cameron Tyler. We are using all I have learned from my pop background combined with my love of Soul, Blues and R&B to create a new and evolved sound that is "Magenta Harley"

Anthony's experience as a touring drummer and grammy award winning producer has been irreplaceable in this journey. He is a constant source of inspiration and wisdom.

Tony introduced Cameron on a whim. Cameron and I hit it off and started making tracks immediately. So it began...

Our hope with this EP is to get 5 to 6 songs of immaculate quality. Using the best of the best live musicians in town.

We have a goal of $6000. The funds will go towards studio time, session musicians, mixing, mastering, printing CD's and other promotion. 

We are offering great incentives such as digital downloads, physical CD's, an array of merchandise, live shows, media shout outs and more. 

I look forward to bearing my soul and sharing with you some great music in the very near future!!!

Other ways you can help with supporting this project is to TELL YOUR FRIENDS! Please share on social media and word of mouth. Every penny counts to make this dream become a reality.

Thank you so SO much for your support!

Magenta xx
story_txt:
Hello!!!
Just a quick thank you for taking to time to check out this project.

With this Indie Go Go campaign's success I hope to record the record of my dreams. Currently I am creating and recording music with an incredibly talented and supportive team. With your help we can execute a very high quality production and give us room to really take the songs I have written to another level! 
I have been following music as a career for years and been through many ups and downs as you do. After years of chipping away I feel I have finally found my feet with the help of Anthony Braunagel and Cameron Tyler. We are using all I have learned from my pop background combined with my love of Soul, Blues and R&B to create a new and evolved sound that is "Magenta Harley"

Anthony's experience as a touring drummer and grammy award winning producer has been irreplaceable in this journey. He is a constant source of inspiration and wisdom.
Tony introduced Cameron on a whim. Cameron and I hit it off and started making tracks immediately. So it began...
Our hope with this EP is to get 5 to 6 songs of immaculate quality. Using the best of the best live musicians in town.
We have a goal of $6000. The funds will go towards studio time, session musicians, mixing, mastering, printing CD's and other promotion. 
We are offering great incentives such as digital downloads, physical CD's, an array of merchandise, live shows, media shout outs and more.

Magenta xx

story:
Click aquí para versión español!

Summary

We are a Celtic folk metal band from Argentina, founded in the year 2011. Our music combines heavy metal with traditional Scottish and Irish instruments like the bagpipes, tin whistle and bouzouki. To this date, we have made two albums, the latest of which, titled “The Power & the Will”, was released world-wide through the German label Powerprog in late 2015. This summer, the band will perform for their first time in Europe.  

We have also taken up a new challenge for this year: during the course of the following months, we will prepare an album of unplugged versions from our songs, with new arrangements and alternative instrumentation!! Our greatest production values will be put to use, aiming at a wide variety of sounds and textures. When it's ready, it will be available for download through the Internet with its exclusive artwork. 

Our proposed release date is August 2016. With your collaboration, the band will be able to finance the whole process of recording and production in due time and deliver to their fans around the world a great piece of work with a novel sound and the finest quality. 


Production costs: recording, editing, mixing & mastering

Cost of Studio per hour: ARS 250$ (US$17 approx) .

Estimated total recording time: 60 hours. 

Editing and post production: 40 hours for selection of takes, noise reduction, quantization, resampling of percussive sounds, added synthetizers and MIDI. 

Mixing: 100 hours.

Mastering: ARS 5000$

SUBTOTAL: 200 hours = ARS 50000$ (3400 US$ aprox)

Artwork: ARS 9000$ (600 US$ aprox)

TOTAL (mastering and art): ARS 59000$ (4000 US$ aprox)


Prizes for contributors

We are very thankful to all of you, fans and followers around the world and that's why we have prepared a set of different prizes for all those who wish to contribute.

You will be able to download the album in digital format with its artwork, but we are also offering many other prizes for you!! Exclusive t-shirts, autographed posters and more merchandising to be announced!


Impact

We will take a selection of our favorite songs and take them in a different direction: new arrangements, more instruments, a more acoustic folk sound, even a touch of orquestral arrangements. We are sure that our followers and all newcomers will be captivated by this new experience!

Not only will you hear plenty of bagpipes and tin whistle, which are already common to our sound, but also the bouzouki, string arrangements, folk percussion instruments and perhaps a few extra surprises! 

Our fans in Buenos Aires have already enjoyed our live unplugged shows and have an idea of what's coming up. Now they'll have the opportunity to take this experience to their homes! On the other hand, fans from around the world that know our current studio music, will for their first time hear the acoustic versions of our songs!

The band have already released two albums in the past, and everyone who has listened to us knows very well that whenever we go into the recording studios or set foot on a stage, we do everything within our reach to deliver the best for our followers! 


The challenge

We have set ourselves the goal of carrying out this project in a very short period of time, so we can release it in August 2016. While we work on the album, we will also prepare an unplugged show for our audience in Buenos Aires, which will also serve to promote the release. This will take some effort and rehearsal time, but we are well prepared for it. 

The production of the CD is already on its way. All the necessary means are within our reach already and the different stages of production have already been carefully planned.   Actually, one of the songs is already finished, which will be used as promotion. 

The experience is not new to us, as we have self-produced and self-financed its previous records. With the necessary funding, the album will be finished by August, and it will be recorded and mixed with all the best technical equipment and resources within our reach. The listener will notice!!

Also, before releasing our CD, the band will travel to Europe for their first shows in the continent!  


Help us spread the word!

ll of you are invited to take part in the creation of this project, which we know you will receive enthusiastically!!

We will be eternally grateful to everyone that collaborates. But a contribution to the funding is not the only way of helping! Anyone who spreads the word, shares the link or tells a friend is also contributing an invaluable amount. The more people get to know, the better!!


Thanks to everyone!

------------------------------------------------
Versión Española

Resumen

Somos una banda de folk metal celta originaria de Argentina, la cual fue fundada en el año 2011. Nuestra música combina heavy metal con instrumentos tradicionales escoceses e irlandeses como la gaita, el tin whistle y el bouzouki. Llevamos realizados dos discos de estudio a la fecha, el último de los cuales, titulado “The Power & the Will”, fue lanzado a nivel mundial por el sello alemán Powerprog a fines de 2015. Este verano, la banda realizará además sus primeros conciertos en Europa.

Pero también hemos asumido un nuevo desafío para este año: durante los próximos meses, prepararemos un álbum de versiones acústicas de nuestas canciones, con nuevos arreglos e instrumentación alternativa! Todos nuestros recursos serán puestos en uso, apuntando a una variada gama de sonidos y texturas. Cuando esté listo, estará disponible para descargar a través de Internet, junto con su arte gráfico exclusivo.

Nuestra fecha propuesta de lanzamiento es agosto de 2016. Con su colaboración, la banda podrá financiar todo el proceso de grabación y producción en el tiempo estipulado, y darle a sus fans alrededor del mundo un gran trabajo con un sonido novedoso y la mejor calidad!


Costos de producción: grabación, edición, mezcla y mastering

Costo de estudio por hora:ARS 250$ (US$17 aprox).

Tiempo total estimado de grabación: 60 horas. 

Edición y post producción: 40 horas para la selección de tomas, reducción de ruido, cuantización, resampleo de sonidos percusivos, adición de sintetizadores y sonidos MIDI.  

Mezcla: 100 horas.

Mastering: ARS 5000$

SUBTOTAL: 200 horas = ARS 50000$ (3400 US$ aprox)

Arte gráfico: ARS 9000$ (600 US$ aprox)

TOTAL (masterización y arte): ARS 59000$ (4000 US$ aprox)


Premios para los contribuidores

Estamos muy agradecidos con todos ustedes, fans y seguidores alrededor del mundo, y es por eso que hemos preparado un conjunto de premios especiales para aquellos que deseen contribuir.

Podrán descargar el disco en formato digital junto con su arte gráfico, pero además estaremos ofreciendo una variedad de premios para ustedes! Remeras exclusivas, posters autografiados y mucho más por anunciarse!


Impacto

Haremos una selección de las canciones favoritas de la banda y las llevaremos en una nueva dirección: nuevos arregos, más instrumentos, un sonido más acústico y folk, algunos arreglos orquestales incluso. Estamos seguros de que nuestros fans de siempre y nuevos seguidores serán sorprendidos por esta nueva experiencia!

No sólo estará presente el sonido de las gaitas y las flautas, ya habitual en nuestro estilo, sino que también abundará el uso del bouzouki, arreglos de cuerdos, percusión folk y tal vez otras sorpresas!

Nuestros fans en Buenos Aires ya han disfrutado nuestros shows acústicos y pueden imaginarse lo que se viene. Ahora tendrán la oportunidad de llevarse esta experiencia a sus casas! Por otro lado, los fans alrededor del mundo que conocen nuestros previos discos de estudio podrán escuchar por primera vez versiones acústicas de nuestras canciones!

La banda ha lanzado dos discos acústicos en el pasado, y todos los que han escuchado la banda saben bien que siempre que entramos al estudio de grabación o ponemos pie en el escenario damos lo mejor de nosotros para darle lo mejor a nuestros seguidores! 


El desafío

Nos hemos propuesto llevar a cabo este trabajo en un período corto de tiempo, de modo de poder lanzarlo en agosto del 2016. Mientras trabajamos en este álbum, también preparamos un show acústico para nuestro público de Buenos Aires, lo cual también servirá para promocionar este lanzamiento. Esto nos llevará algo de tiempo de ensayo y esfuerzo adicional, pero estamos preparados para el desafío!

La producción del disco ya está en camino. Todos los medios necesarios están a nuestro alcance y las distintas etapas de producción ya han sido planeadas cuidadosamente. De hecho, una de las canciones ya está terminada, la cual usaremos como promoción.

La experiencia no es nueva para nosotros, ya que hemos auto producido y auto financiado nuestros trabajos anteriores, Con el financiamiento necesario, el álbum será terminado en agosto, y será grabado y mezclado con todo el mejor equipamiento técnico y recursos a nuestra disposición. Nuestro público notará la calidad del trabajo!

Además, antes de lanzar el disco, la banda viajará a Europa para sus primeros shows en el continente!


Ayuden a correr la voz!

Están todos invitados a formar parte de la creación de este proyecto, que sabemos recibirán con el mejor de los entusiasmos!

Estaremos eternamente agradecidos a todos los que colaboren. Pero una contribución al financiamiento no es la única manera de ayudar! Todo aquel que corra la voz, comparta un link o le cuente a un amigo también está ayudando en forma invaluable. Mientras más personas sepan, mejor!

Muchas gracias a todos!!

story:
Start With The Hard Questions

My sister asked me something.

 "You have more money then everyone, how the hell are you asking other people for money????"

It's a good question. A fair question. I certainly could max out my credit cards and pay for everything on my dream list. I could probably rent out a large club like House of Blues, and give the appearance of success.

But that isn't what I am trying to do. I thought about how to answer my sister's question. My first thought was to call her a goober. But after more careful consideration, I realized that I am just testing the waters. I want to see if there is any interest in my type of thing.

Are people willing to spend a few bucks on what I have created? And this site seemed like the best way to find out.

So there you have it. I don't really need everyone to buy private shows. In fact, just let me know and I will probably be thrilled to play one at your house. All I want to get out of this is to find out if I should jump in with both feet, or keep it like a stupid little hobby.

So there you have it. That's the 'why'.

I will share some links to my finished songs in the updates, so you can be the judge of what I'm putting out. And you can vote with your wallet.


Short Summary

My name is Nick Carter. I started asking my parents for a drum set when I was 10 years old. By the age of 15 I had an electric guitar and a drum set. By the age of 17 I was playing bass guitar in a band.

I finished writing my first song at the age of 16, while sitting on my bed late one school night. I wrote my first love song at age 19.

I have been writing riffs for over two decades now. I have spent the last 3 years writing, refining, and recording my album. 14 songs. 

I spent a lot of time on the road and had many successes with my previous projects. But they all were missing theatricality. Striving for more than just faithfully reproducing music and words on a stage. This year I started performing my songs in front of audiences, to very positive responses.

What started as a fun hobby now has legs. It has a beating heart. And I could not be more excited about the results. 

I have what I need to finish the album. I am in the final stages of polishing the songs and recordings. I know that this is the digital age, and digital distribution is king. But I dream of something tangible. I would like to hold a CD in my hand. I would like to hold a record in my hand. Everyone can record an album on their phone now, and sell it digitally. I have bigger dreams. I want to fight bigger fights. I want to play all over the country, and physical merchandise is the think that makes it all possible.

Anyone can make an album. I want to take another shot at saving the world with my music. 


What I Want

I want to press some CD's. And if I make enough, I want to press vinyl records. There are some great PA systems made by Bose that are great for touring and playing house shows in living rooms and back yards. These are the sorts of things that will help me chase my dream for a little longer.

If I don't reach the goal, then the money will go towards whatever merch and CD's I can buy.

  • CD Production $450
  • Vinyl Production $1200
  • Bose L1 Compact Portable PA $900
