story:
Version française en dessous                                          Versión española por debajo

                     One Love Soul 

 

Hi, we are "One Love Soul" a humanitarian project utilizing music, dance and expression as a fusion of love and healing. We will deliver different humanitarian supplies to those most in need and also offer free performances of original music with live instruments and dance. We are M&M (Michaël Kormla Akortia and Marcia Banasko), two individuals united by love and our Ghanaian heritage. We plan to perform and travel via land (as much as possible) in a camping van from France to Australia, fly to the Americas and back to Europe. 

Who we are

We wish to continue in our love for promoting happiness and peace around the world. We are multicultural Marcia (British, Ghanaian and Jamaican) and Michaël (French, Ghanaian and Armenian) through our diversity we wish to contribute to humanity. Michaël is a professional musician and teacher; he has studied traditional West African music in Senegal, Mali, Ivory Coast and Ghana, as well as taking time to learn in Morocco. Marcia has a first class bachelor degree in International development and has worked for several years for an international women's rights NGO as Communications and Advocacy Officer. She is community project worker and performer having worked locally, nationally and internationally. 

We're taking on this ambitious project as we wish to offer support to those most vulnerable, perform and learn about all the different cultures musically as we make our journey. We plan to learn the virtue of music and how it brings healing - music therapy is REAL! We want to raise funds to enable us to buy and collect humanitarian supplies as we plan to help different individuals and organisations such as orphanages - children homes, homeless shelters and various charities. 

                 

Where your money goes

Your donations will help us cover the following costs:

  • Humanitarian supplies (clothes, shoes, school materials, books, food, blankets)
  • Website Development
  • Professional Camera

We will deliver different humanitarian supplies (clothes, shoes, school materials, books, food, blankets) to those most in need (charities, children homes, homeless shelters, refugee centers etc). We are contacting different organisations on our route to identify what support we can offer depending on the needs of the people. We will also offer the organisations free performances of original music with live instruments and dance. We believe that music has a healing energy that can move people and ease stress in times of suffering.

Travelling across Eastern Europe into the Middle East and through Asia, down to Australia and across the Americas, we wish to document our journey and share the stories/life histories of the people we meet. We hope that by sharing the realities that people face it will bring about a deeper understanding of the struggle and joys of humanity and also contribute towards positive change in the lives of the people we meet. Therefore, we will develop a website where we can share our daily experiences through blogging, photographs and film.  

Challenging Racism: We wish to conduct a survey which explores the misconceptions of race. We will ask the same set of questions in each country we visit and document the results. We hope to demonstrate the similarities and differences amongst each culture. As two mixed race people we hope our very presence and warm smiles will already begin to break down barriers through our creativity and performance. 

The Impact 

For us, crowdfunding is about way more than the money we raise. Our ultimate goal is to bring musical healing to new people across the world and to deepen connection and engagement with the communities we meet. We hope your likes, shares, comments, and donations will be a genuine act of community participation and validation. We want you to be part of our community. And through this, you'll help us, and we'll help you. We'll grow together.  

Thank you 

Thank you for taking the time to watch our video and read our story. In a world where we are all bombarded with Facebook, Twitter, online petitions to sign and good causes to support, we really appreciate your time.

Any donation, however small, will be well appreciated and used towards the costs of "One Love Soul". If you are not able to donate, you can still contribute by sharing our campaign with any friends, family and colleagues who believe in  the true value of happiness around the world. Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word. With your help, this project will see the day from August! 

 

Bonjour!

Nous sommes le projet “One Love Soul” qui peut se traduire par « l’amour et l’âme ne font qu’un! ». “One Love Soul” est un projet humanitaire à travers lequel nous utilisons musique, danse et expression pour apporter amour, soin et apaisement. Nous distribuerons diverses fournitures humanitaires à ceux qui en ont le plus besoin. Nous offrirons aussi des spectacles de musique originaux, accompagnés d’instruments et de performances de danse. Nous sommes M&M (Michaël Kormla Akortia et Marcia Banasko), deux personnes unies par l’amour et notre héritage ghanéen commun. Nous planifions de faire des spectacles et de voyager en passant principalement par les voies terrestres avec un camping-car. Nous partirons de France pour rejoindre l’Australie. Puis, nous rejoindrons les Amériques par avion avant de revenir en Europe.

Qui sommes-nous?

Nous voulons persévérer et croître dans notre amour en encourageant et faisant la promotion du bonheur et de la paix dans le monde.

Nous avons des origines multiculturelles et souhaitons contribuer à l’humanité par notre diversité. En effet, Marcia est anglaise, ghanéenne et jamaïcaine et Michaël est français, ghanéen et arménien. Michaël est un musicien professionnel et un éducateur. Il a étudié la musique traditionnelle d’Afrique de l’ouest au Sénégal, au Mali, en Côte d’Ivoire et au Ghana et a aussi passé du temps à apprendre au Maroc. Marcia a un diplôme de bachelor en Développement international et a travaillé de nombreuses années en tant que responsable de la communication et du plaidoyer pour une ONG internationale au service de la cause des droits des femmes. Marcia est une travailleuse sociale et communautaire ainsi qu’une artiste ayant œuvré aux niveaux local, national et international.

Nous nous engageons dans ce projet ambitieux car nous souhaitons apporter notre aide aux plus vulnérables et apprendre à connaître de nouvelles cultures musicales lors de notre voyage. Nous planifions d’apprendre les vertus de la musique et ce qu’elle peut apporter en bien-être, soin et apaisement – une véritable thérapie par la musique est en effet possible!

Nous souhaitons trouver des financements qui nous permettront d’acheter et de collecter des fournitures humanitaires car nous planifions d’aider différents individus et organisations tels que des orphelinats – foyers pour enfants, refuges pour sans-abris et diverses organisations caritatives.

Où ira votre argent?

Vos dons nous aiderons à couvrir les coûts suivants :

-  Fournitures humanitaires (vêtements, chaussures, matériel d’école, livres, nourriture, couvertures)

-  Le développement du site web

-  Un appareil photo à usage professionnel

Nous apporterons les fournitures humanitaires (vêtements, chaussures, matériel d’école, livres, nourriture, couvertures) à ceux qui en ont le plus besoin (œuvres caritatives, foyers pour enfants, refuges pour sans-abris, centre pour les réfugiés, etc…)

Nous sommes en train de contacter différentes organisations sur notre itinéraire afin d’identifier l’aide et le soutien adéquats par rapport aux besoins des personnes. Nous offrirons aussi des spectacles gratuits avec instruments et danse. Nous pensons que la musique a un pouvoir bénéfique, qu’elle peut émouvoir les gens et apporter une réponse au stress dans les moments de souffrance.

Nous souhaitons documenter et partager les histoires et le quotidien de ceux que nous rencontrerons lors de notre voyage en direction de l’Australie à travers l’Europe de l’Est, le Moyen-Orient et l’Asie, puis de notre périple à travers les Amériques.

Nous espérons qu’en partageant ces récits sur le quotidien des personnes rencontrées, nous apporterons un éclairage et une meilleure compréhension sur les difficultés et les joies de l’humanité. Nous espérons aussi que cela contribuera à apporter une impulsion positive dans la vie de ceux que nous rencontrerons. Nous développerons donc un site web où nous partagerons nos expériences quotidiennes à travers l’écriture, la photo et la vidéo.

« Confronter le Racisme »: nous souhaitons faire une étude sur les mécompréhensions autour du concept de race. Nous poserons les mêmes questions dans chaque pays où nous irons et noterons les résultats détaillés. Nous espérons montrer les similarités et les différences entre les cultures. Nous espérons que notre présence, en tant que deux personnes mixtes, et nos sourires chaleureux ainsi que notre créativité et nos spectacles permettront de commencer à soulever les barrières qui peuvent exister.

L’Impact

Le financement participatif (crowdfunding) est, pour nous, plus qu’un moyen de collecter des fonds. Notre objectif principal est d’amener le pouvoir bénéfique de la musique aux nouvelles personnes que nous rencontrerons et d’approfondir les liens et notre engagement avec les communautés. Nous espérons que vos « J’aime », « Partager», commentaires et dons soient un véritable acte de participation à la communauté et d’approbation. Nous voulons que vous fassiez partie de notre communauté. Et, à travers cela, nous vous aiderons et vous nous aiderez. Nous grandirons ensemble.

Merci!

Merci d’avoir pris le temps de regarder notre video et de lire notre histoire. Dans un monde où nous sommes constamment bombardés  de messages Facebook, Twitter, de pétitions en ligne à signer et de bonnes causes à soutenir, nous apprécions vraiment que vous nous accordiez du temps.

Quel que soit le montant de votre don, il sera véritablement apprécié et utilisé pour contribuer à payer les coûts du projet « One Love Soul ». Si vous n’êtes pas en mesure de faire un don, vous pouvez aussi contribuer en partageant le lien vers cette campagne avec vos amis, familles et collègues qui croient en la valeur et le pouvoir du bonheur dans le monde. Utiliser les outils d’Indiegogo et partagez la campagne sur les réseaux sociaux et par email ! Avec votre aide, le projet débutera en août.

 Hola!

Somos “Una Amor Un Alma”, un proyecto humanitario que utiliza la música, la dance y la expresión artística como una fusión de amor y sanación. Entregaremos diferentes productos humanitarios para aquellos más necesitados y también ofreceremos presentaciones de música original y en vivo con instrumentos y danza. Somos M&M (Michaël Kormla Akortia and Marcia Banasko), dos seres humanos unidos por el amor y nuestra herencia Ghanesa. Planificamos realizar presentaciones artística y viajar por tierra (dentro de lo posible) en un auto caravana desde Francia hasta Australia, luego volar a América del Sur y volver a Europa.

Quiénes somos

Deseamos continuar nuestro amor para promover felicidad y paz alrededor del mundo. Somos multiculturales Marcia (inglesa, ghanesa y jamaicana) y Michaël (francés, ghanés y armenio) y a través de nuestra diversidad deseamos contribuir a la humanidad. Michaël es un músico profesional y profesor, ha estudiado música Tradicional del África del Oeste en Senegal, Mali, Costa de Marfil y Ghana, como también pasó un tiempo aprendiendo en Marruecos. Marcia tiene un Licenciatura en Desarrollo Internacional y ha trabajado por muchos años en una ONG internacional de derechos de las mujeres como Oficial de Comunicaciones y Abogacía. Ella es una trabajadora de proyectos comunitarios y artista con experiencia laboral a nivel local, nacional e internacional.

Nos aventuramos en este ambicioso proyecto y deseamos ofrecer un apoyo a aquellos más vulnerables, realizar presentaciones artísticas y aprender acerca de todas las diferentes culturales a nivel musical, mientras realizamos nuestro viaje. Planificamos aprender la virtud de la música y como entrega sanación – la terapia musical es REAL! Queremos recaudar fondos para poder comprar y recolectar productos humanitarios ya que planificamos ayudar a diferentes personas y organizaciones como orfanatos – hogares de niños,  personas sin hogares y diferentes organizaciones de beneficencia.

Dónde va tu dinero?

Sus donaciones ayudaran a cubrir los siguientes gastos:

·  Productos Humanitarios (ropa, zapatos, materiales escolares, libros, comida, frazadas)

·  Desarrollo Sitio Web

·  Cámara Profesional

Entregaremos diferentes productos humanitarios (ropa, zapatos, materiales escolares, libros, comida, frazadas) para aquellos más necesitados (organizaciones de beneficencia, hogares de niños, personas sin hogar, centro de refugiados, etc.) Estamos contactando diferentes organizaciones en nuestra ruta, para identificar que apoyo podemos ofrecer dependiendo de las necesidades de las personas. También ofreceremos a las organizaciones presentaciones artísticas gratuitas de música original con instrumentos y en vivo. Creemos que la música tiene una energía de creación que puede mover a las personas y aliviar el estrés en momentos de sufrimiento.

Viajando a través de Europa del Este hacia el Medio Oriente, atravesando Asia, luego a Australia y cruzar a América, deseamos documentar nuestro viaje y compartir las historias de vida de las personas que reencontramos. Esperamos que al compartir las realidades que las personas confrontan entregara una profunda comprensión de las batallas y alegrías de la humanidad y además contribuir a un cambio positivo en las vidas de las personas que reencontramos. Por lo tanto, desarrollaremos un sitio web donde compartiremos nuestra experiencia diaria a través de blogs, fotografías y videos.

Desafiando Racismo: Deseamos llevar a cabo una encuesta que explorará las diferentes ideas erróneas sobre las razas. Realizaremos las mismas preguntas en todos los países que visitaremos y documentaremos los resultados. Esperamos demostrar las semejanzas y diferencia entre cada cultura. Como dos mestizos esperamos que nuestra presencia, historias de vidas y cariñosas sonrisas comenzaran a quebrar barreras a través de nuestra creatividad y presentaciones artísticas.

El Impacto

Para nosotros, crowdfunding (Financiamiento colectivo), es algo más allá del dinero que recaudemos. Nuestro objetivo final es entregar música sanadora a las personas que reencontremos alrededor del mundo y profundizar la conexión y el compromiso con las comunidades que reencontramos. Esperamos que  sus “me gusta”, “compartir”, “comentarios” y donaciones serán un acto genuino de la participación y validación comunitaria. Queremos que sean parte de nuestra comunidad. Y a través de esto, nos ayudaran y los ayudaremos. Creceremos juntos.

Gracias

Gracias por tomarse el tiempo para ver nuestro video y leer nuestra historia. En un mundo donde estamos bombardeados con Facebook, Twitter, peticiones en línea para firmar y buenas causas para apoyar, realmente apreciamos su tiempo.

Cualquier donación, sin importar el tamaño, será muy agradecida y utilizada para el proyecto “Un Amor Un Alma”. Si no pueden donar, aún pueden contribuir compartiendo nuestra campaña con sus amigos, familia y colega que crean en el verdadero valor de la felicidad a través del mundo. Usen las herramientas para compartir de Indiego para compartir el mensaje. Con su ayuda, este proyecto comenzará a partir de agosto.

Version française
en dessous                                          Versión española por debajo

                     One Love Soul 

 



Hi, we are "One Love Soul"
a humanitarian project utilizing music, dance and expression as a fusion of
love and healing. We will deliver different humanitarian supplies to those most
in need and also offer free performances of original music with live instruments
and dance. We are M&M (Michaël Kormla Akortia and Marcia Banasko), two
individuals united by love and our Ghanaian heritage. We plan to perform and
travel via land (as much as possible) in a camping van from France to
Australia, fly to the Americas and back to Europe. 
Who we are
We wish to continue in our love for
promoting happiness and peace around the world. We are multicultural
Marcia (British, Ghanaian and Jamaican) and Michaël (French, Ghanaian and
Armenian) through our diversity we wish to contribute to humanity. Michaël
is a professional musician and teacher; he has studied traditional West African
music in Senegal, Mali, Ivory Coast and Ghana, as well as taking time to learn
in Morocco. Marcia has a first class bachelor degree in International
development and has worked for several years for an international women's
rights NGO as Communications and Advocacy Officer. She is community project
worker and performer having worked locally, nationally and
internationally. 
We're taking on this ambitious
project as we wish to offer support to those most vulnerable, perform and learn
about all the different cultures musically as we make our journey. We plan to
learn the virtue of music and how it brings healing - music therapy is REAL! We
want to raise funds to enable us to buy and collect humanitarian supplies as we
plan to help different individuals and organisations such as orphanages -
children homes, homeless shelters and various charities. 
                 
Where your money goes
Your donations will help us cover the
following costs:

Humanitarian
     supplies (clothes, shoes, school materials, books, food, blankets)
Website
     Development
Professional
     Camera

We will deliver different
humanitarian supplies (clothes, shoes, school materials, books, food, blankets)
to those most in need (charities, children homes, homeless shelters, refugee
centers etc). We are contacting different organisations on our route to identify
what support we can offer depending on the needs of the people. We will also
offer the organisations free performances of original music with live
instruments and dance. We believe that music has a healing energy that can move
people and ease stress in times of suffering. 
Travelling across Eastern Europe into
the Middle East and through Asia, down to Australia and across the Americas, we
wish to document our journey and share the stories/life histories of the people
we meet. We hope that by sharing the realities that people face it will bring
about a deeper understanding of the struggle and joys of humanity and also
contribute towards positive change in the lives of the people we meet. Therefore,
we will develop a website where we can share our daily experiences through
blogging, photographs and film.  
Challenging
Racism: We wish to conduct a survey which explores the misconceptions of race.
We will ask the same set of questions in each country we visit and document the
results. We hope to demonstrate the similarities and differences amongst each
culture. As two mixed race people we hope our very presence and warm smiles
will already begin to break down barriers through our creativity and
performance. 
The Impact 
For us, crowdfunding is about way more than the money we raise. Our
ultimate goal is to bring musical healing to new people across the world and to
deepen connection and engagement with the communities we meet. We hope your
likes, shares, comments, and donations will be a genuine act of community
participation and validation. We want you to be part of our community. And
through this, you'll help us, and we'll help you. We'll grow together.  
Thank
you 
Thank you
for taking the time to watch our video and read our story. In a world where we
are all bombarded with Facebook, Twitter, online petitions to sign and good
causes to support, we really appreciate your time.
Any donation, however small, will be
well appreciated and used towards the costs of "One Love Soul". If
you are not able to donate, you can still contribute by sharing our campaign
with any friends, family and colleagues who believe in  the true value of
happiness around the world. Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the
word. With your help, this project will see the day from August!

través de blogs, fotografías y videos.
Desafiando Racismo: Deseamos llevar a cabo
una encuesta que explorará las diferentes ideas erróneas sobre las razas.
Realizaremos las mismas preguntas en todos los países que visitaremos y
documentaremos los resultados. Esperamos demostrar las semejanzas y diferencia
entre cada cultura. Como dos mestizos esperamos que nuestra presencia,
historias de vidas y cariñosas sonrisas comenzaran a quebrar barreras a través
de nuestra creatividad y presentaciones artísticas. 
El Impacto
Para nosotros, crowdfunding
(Financiamiento colectivo), es algo más allá del dinero que recaudemos. Nuestro
objetivo final es entregar música sanadora a las personas que reencontremos alrededor
del mundo y profundizar la conexión y el compromiso con las comunidades que
reencontramos. Esperamos que  sus “me
gusta”, “compartir”, “comentarios” y donaciones serán un acto genuino de la
participación y validación comunitaria. Queremos que sean parte de nuestra
comunidad. Y a través de esto, nos ayudaran y los ayudaremos. Creceremos
juntos.
Gracias
Gracias por tomarse el tiempo para ver nuestro
video y leer nuestra historia. En un mundo donde estamos bombardeados con
Facebook, Twitter, peticiones en línea para firmar y buenas causas para apoyar,
realmente apreciamos su tiempo.
Cualquier
donación, sin importar el tamaño, será muy agradecida y utilizada para el
proyecto “Un Amor Un Alma”. Si no pueden donar, aún pueden contribuir compartiendo
nuestra campaña con sus amigos, familia y colega que crean en el verdadero
valor de la felicidad a través del mundo. Usen las herramientas para compartir
de Indiego para compartir el mensaje. Con su ayuda, este proyecto comenzará a
partir de agosto.

story:
At times it may seem that our cultures are incompatible, but we have more in common than we can even imagine.

What is Country for Syria?

We are an international musical collective of Syrian musicians and refugee helpers, blending Middle Eastern folk music with American Country.  

You can support us in our daily efforts helping refugees and folks affected by the conflict, and help us record our first album. Please, donate now.



What kind of music do we make?

Country music has its origins in the American Civil War. Now, Syria is in the midst of its own civil war. Our music combines Country Music with Middle Eastern Folk Music to draw parallels between the musical and lyrical themes of these genres, and to connect personal experiences of conflict and migration from around the world, especially in the Middle East. 

Country and Arabic folk music share themes of migration, love, loneliness, longing for home, patriotism, relationship to God, and relationship to place. They tell their stories through narrative ballads, through pastoral meditations, by praising folk heroes and in the idealization of a lost way of life. 

How can it be that these two musical genres, from continents apart, can possibly sound good together?

Just Listen. 



Your donation will help folks affected by the crisis, and help us record our album:


  • $4000 will go to Syrian and Turkish guest musicians, who will be featured on our album
  • $900 will go to our videographer, who has already worked with us shooting at our concerts and rehearsals and editing our videos. He will document our album's development in the studio
  • $1000 will go to equipment and instruments including microphones and effects
  • $3000 will go to the recording studio and sound engineers working with us
  • $1100 will go to the cost of the IndieGoGo campaign and to sending you special thank you gifts from the Olive Tree Women's Craft Collective
  • Any extra money will go to refugees and people affected by the conflict. We  do this by providing money directly to refugees, helping them with their daily needs or in emergencies, and by playing shows whose proceeds go to organizations whose mission is to help those affected by the conflict. 

A special thank you for your donation from

 Olive Tree Women's Craft Collective


Small Projects Istanbul runs a craft collective at its Olive Tree community center in Fatih, Istanbul, where Syrian refugee women have the opportunity to develop skills in hand crafts and earn livelihood support to help them rebuild their lives. They produce a range of jewellery and bags including sterling silver rings, woven silver charm bracelets, knitted hats and scarves, urban design cotton pouch and tote bags and a range of embroidered accessories based on Syrian tile designs.

They have offered to send you a special gift for your donation, and part of every donation will go to support Small Projects for Syria and the Olive Tree Women's Craft Collective.
For a $50 donation, you will receive a handwoven bracelet.
For a $100 donation, you will receive a handmade tote bag featuring the Country for Syria and Small Projects Istanbul logos.
For a $200 donation you will receive a handwoven bracelet with a Sterling Silver charm.
Find out more about them along with links to buy their crafts at
 Olive Tree Women's Craft Collective


Why do we do what we do?

Those affected by conflict are not just refugees. They are musicians and artists, mothers and fathers, football fans, students, and ice cream lovers; they are whole people. This temporary situation does not define them, but their culture and creative work does.

Country for Syria’s mission is cultural diplomacy and mutual aid. Middle Eastern and American cultures are often seen as polar opposites, yet they have so much in common. Not only do we strive to help people see and hear these connections, but we also work to raise awareness about and raise money for those affected by conflict in the Middle East. 


We make regular trips to refugee camps and conflict areas to deliver supplies and donated items and to play solidarity concerts for those affected by the conflict. Some places we have visited include Fidanlık Refugee Camp in Diyarbakir, the village of Dargeçit, and the town of Cizre on the Turkish/Syrian border.


Our partners include:

Small Projects Istanbul For Syria

Project Lift

Humanwire

Istanbul&I

Clowns without Borders

Komşu Kafe Collective


We invite you to become a part of our collective, and to show your support for by donating now.

-Country for Syria



PS. Please share our campaign and follow us at https://www.facebook.com/countryforsyria/ , http://www.countryforsyria.com, and @countryforsyria on Instagram and Twitter.

story:
Hello! My name is Katia Kuziakina. I am 7 years old. I'm from Yasnohorodka, it's nof far from Kyiv. I began to play with Chinese sticks on the table or on my father's chair AС/DC songs one year ago. My father liked it and presented drums for me. I like to play covers on a System Of A Down and Ukrainian rock bands. I even played with Mad Heads on their concert.

l don't take the music lessons on the music school. I had only four lessons with a teacher. I play drums by myself using the video lessons. I like to play drums with great pleasure and it's very easy for me.

My parents and my elder sister support me. My sister shoots a video with me.
A real dream for me and my parents to find a good teacher.

I want to evolve and get a professional music education.

And l hope my dream will come true.

story:
Rooster Eggs

Hi, Pete Madsen here. As most of you know I have been performing acoustic finger style guitar for over fifteen yearsI. I have recorded two previous acoustic finger style CDs, The House of Pete and Good Time Music: Blues and Rags. I have almost finished recording a new CD of all instrumental finger style guitar called Rooster Eggs and I need your help to release it.

 For a good part of the past year I have been recording at the Wally Sound in Oakland. Wally is great guy and excellent engineer. His expertise has allowed me to focus on just getting the best performance possible without the hassle of me worrying about mic placement, or other technical issues. And….quite frankly, I believe this is the best CD I have ever recorded! I know I say that about every CD, but I sincerely believe this is my best playing and best recording to date.

I have returned to playing the 12 string guitar and there are several cuts that feature my own 12 string and a beautiful baritone 12 string built by master Bay Area luthier, Tony Yamamoto. Most of the tunes are original compositions. There is plenty of slide guitar, some blues and some not so bluesy pieces.

Here's a sample:

Pete's Barrelhouse Rag

I am seeking $2,500 to manufacture physical product (CDs!), create art work for the cover (need to pay the artist!), publicizing and mailing costs.

I have a bunch of perks that range from receiving a copy of the CD, to guitar instruction books, and guitar lessons, as well as a private house concert.

If I don’t reach my funding goal I will still be able to put the CD out, but will probably have to dial back my publicizing efforts.

I have been down this road before so I am completely confident I will be able to achieve my goals.

story:
Why Me - Why this Project? 

Thank you so much for visiting my page. My name is Justine Wahlin and I’m a songwriter from Sydney Australia.

In the lead up to beginning this album and on deciding to seek crowd funding I have pondered the question, “why should anyone choose to help me?” This has led me to reflect on the many albums that I love, how they have woven themselves among my memories, how they have enhanced the landscape of so many of the special moments in my life and at certain times how they have brought profound healing when nothing else could. 

In 2012 I released 6 songs in a very stripped back acoustic EP called “Conversations with Crows”. The feedback I’ve received has been overwhelmingly positive and has reassured me that I’m not just playing music for myself but for others who have found solace and joy in the songs I write.

My hope is that this will be an album you'll treasure as much as some of your favourites.

The Album

"A Long Way From Home” is my first full-length studio album.

My vision is for these 10 carefully selected songs, is to bring them out with all the instrumentation they crave and to create a textured full-colour landscape for each one. Additional parts and sounds will be played and created with the help and vision of the very talented Michael Ward, Dylan Hartas and Glen Schollum. By the time the recordings are finished, these songs will have indeed come a long way from their birthplaces and yet they will hold fast to the thread that connects them to their roots. 

I’ll be so proud to bring you these songs in a professionally produced album that I hope will find a place beside some of your most well worn soundtracks.

The Numbers

The funding I’m seeking will cover only some of the costs, which include;

- Studio time and mixing $3,700

- Mastering $1,500

- Studio Musicians (Dylan, Michael and Glen) roughly $1,000

- Artwork, at this stage unknown but about $400

- CD production around $1,800

How you can help

There are many ways you can help and there is no small act of kindness that is not deeply and sincerely appreciated.

You can:

·  Donate. If you are able to contribute financially to this campaign, I have created a list of carefully considered perks for you to choose from, all with the central aim in mind, which is to bring these songs to your ears. If you cannot donate there are other ways you can help.

·  Spread the word. Share this campaign via email, FB, Twitter, any and all social media you use. Tell your friends, family, colleagues, neighbours, anyone and everyone you think might be interested.

·  Come to a show – I’ll be putting all money raised through up coming shows straight toward the album. Check my Reverbnation or FaceBook page for gig lists. 


Sending you love and and thousand thanks :)


Justine

story:
Be a part of our new EP release!

  • We're Under Dog House, a band hailing from Dallas, TX. After finding success from our DIY EP, "A Little Older A Littler Wiser," we are still playing shows and writing new music.
  • We're trying to raise money to help fund our brand new EP, and we need your help!
  • We want to get this new material out as soon as possible, so any contribution helps.


What We Need & How You Can Help Us Reach Our Goal!


  • We're asking for $2,000 to finish mixing & mastering all the new tracks, and $500 to help with artwork, CD production, shipping and all that fun stuff.
  • If you help out, you can receive digital downloads, physical CDs, t-shirts and more. We'll even come headline a house show for you or write you a short, personalized song!
  • Even if we don't get all the funding we need, 100% of every dollar we receive is going towards getting this new material out as soon as possible.

The Impact


  • Under Dog House has released 1 EP already and we're ready to release the 2nd one. This eclectic record will mix our pop-punk influence with a more musical sound that hopes to provide it's own niche in the music scene. 
  • We're all super excited to release these songs and we can't wait for ya'll to hear them. 

Risks & Challenges


  • We have been faced with the challenge of releasing our new ep. We used Westfall Studios in Austin to help deliver the best sound for this upcoming record. 
  • We chose this route to make a product that meets not only our standards, but our listeners as well. 

Other Ways You Can Help


  • Even if you can't donate, just a share of indiegogo could help us reach our goal!
  • And if you haven't already, follow us on all our social media websites, starting with facebook.com/underdoghouse

story:
Hello Friends!

Thanks for taking a second to have a look.  I'll keep this brief because I know you're really busy.  My name is Amos Fayette and I'm a classical violinist living in New York City.  My career over the past 10 years has taken me to some really interesting places; performances in Europe, outreach work in Colombia, and playing full time in an orchestra in South Beach, just to name a few.  Here's a link to my South American Concerto debut with the Orquesta Filarmonica de Medellin in 2013. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DzdqMyN4xy4

For the 2015/16 Season, I'm in the process of putting together a series of 5 performances for you, my audience.  Each performance will take place in and around New York City at a different venue.  

Venues will be announced at a later time during this campaign, but on the list are Greenwich House and Beethoven Pianos for sure, as well as performances at Queens College and the Collegiate Churches of New York, thanks to various connections around town.  The biggest recital will be my MM recital at The Juilliard School, which will be scheduled in September.  To cover the cost of paying personnel to perform on these programs with me, as well as to cover the cost of renting spaces and paying for piano servicing, I'm looking to raise a sum of $5,000.  The cost breakdown is below:

Musician Personnel : $3,100

Rental of Space at Beethoven Pianos and Greenwich House - $1,000

Piano Tuning - $500

Program Printing/Music Purchasing/Contingency Funds - $400

For just a $10 donation, you get not only entry to each of these 5 performances, but an invitation to the champagne reception that will follow each and every show.  So please consider donating just $10 and I promise it'll be worth it.

story:
Who Strong Water Really Is

      We are Strong Water! We all currently reside in the tucked away City of Harrisonburg in the great state of Virginia. All but one of our members are, or have been, students at James Madison University here in Harrisonburg. Even though only one band member actually majors in music,  we’ve all been playing some kind of music or other since we were in the single digits. Strong Water consists of a Fiddle, Cello, Guitar, Banjo and Drums, with a male vocal lead and back up female vocals. We would classify our sound to be: soulful rustic folk with a modern approach; where every line has a meaning, and every note has a purpose. We pride ourselves on writing and playing all of our own original music. However, for those who don't know what “soulful rustic folk” is, a good way to describe us would be is if The Steelwheels, Trampled by Turtles, and Mumford & Son all met and had a musical love child. If you don't know one or any of the bands previously mentioned, you should check them out along with Strong Water!

What We Need & Where the $$$ is Going

     We're asking for $5,000. $4,200 will be going to pay for the actual recording and mastering of the tracks at Blue Sprocket Sound in Harrisonburg, VA! This amount includes all of the set up, tear down, and engineering fees. The remaining $800 will go to making the actual CD's and new Strong Water gear. If we don't make our goal, we will still use the money for recording, but may have to wait just a little longer to start the recording process. We will also make sure everyone gets their Special Limited Edition Strong Water swag, regardless of the outcome.

The Impact You'll Have

    As many of you know, most of us are college students or recent graduates. This means that our cash flow has been reduced to a faint trickle, but musical creativity and friendship are at an all time high! By you helping us bridge the financial gap, we will be able to share our music not only with you, but the whole world! Okay, the world is a little bit of an exaggeration, but one day hopefully it won't be that far fetched.
    We recorded 2 singles in April, 2015 at Blue Sprocket Sound and these are now available for exclusive download once you contribute to our campaign. We recorded these in just one day, so just imagine what we could do with 5 days this time! By contributing to our campaign you'll be making our musical dreams come true! 

Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute there are other ways you can help! Share our IndieGoGo page with your friends and family via Facebook, Twitter, MySpace, etc. Also like and share our Facebook, Instagram, Soundcloud, Reverbnation, and Bandcamp pages. This will help get the word out! We will be running a contest/raffle, with a special onetime gift (to be revealed), for those that Like our Facebook page and share the IndieGoGo link. You could also just come to our shows and show your support. We love nothing more than to see our fans out at shows!
Below are the links to our pages!


www.facebook.com/strongwatermusic
https://instagram.com/strong.water.music/
www.soundcloud.com/strongwatermusic
https://www.reverbnation.com/strongwater4
https://strongwatermusic.bandcamp.com/ 
Below is a link to the Shirt and Sticker designs!!!
https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.1034139969950029.1073741827.373277826036250&type=3
story_txt:
Who Strong Water Really Is

      We are Strong Water! We all currently reside in the tucked away City of Harrisonburg in the great state of Virginia. All but one of our members are, or have been, students at James Madison University here in Harrisonburg. Even though only one band member actually majors in music,  we’ve all been playing some kind of music or other since we were in the single digits. Strong Water consists of a Fiddle, Cello, Guitar, Banjo and Drums, with a male vocal lead and back up female vocals. We would classify our sound to be: soulful rustic folk with a modern approach; where every line has a meaning, and every note has a purpose. We pride ourselves on writing and playing all of our own original music. However, for those who don't know what “soulful rustic folk” is, a good way to describe us would be is if The Steelwheels, Trampled by Turtles, and Mumford & Son all met and had a musical love child. If you don't know one or any of the bands previously mentioned, you should check them out along with Strong Water!
   What We Need & Where the $$$ is Going
     We're asking for $5,000. $4,200 will be going to pay for the actual recording and mastering of the tracks at Blue Sprocket Sound in Harrisonburg, VA! This amount includes all of the set up, tear down, and engineering fees. The remaining $800 will go to making the actual CD's and new Strong Water gear. If we don't make our goal, we will still use the money for recording, but may have to wait just a little longer to start the recording process. We will also make sure everyone gets their Special Limited Edition Strong Water swag, regardless of the outcome.
   The Impact You'll Have
    As many of you know, most of us are college students or recent graduates. This means that our cash flow has been reduced to a faint trickle, but musical creativity and friendship are at an all time high! By you helping us bridge the financial gap, we will be able to share our music not only with you, but the whole world! Okay, the world is a little bit of an exaggeration, but one day hopefully it won't be that far fetched.
    We recorded 2 singles in April, 2015 at Blue Sprocket Sound and these are now available for exclusive download once you contribute to our campaign. We recorded these in just one day, so just imagine what we could do with 5 days this time! By contributing to our campaign you'll be making our musical dreams come true! 

    Other Ways You Can Help
    If you can't contribute there are other ways you can help! Share our IndieGoGo page with your friends and family via Facebook, Twitter, MySpace, etc. Also like and share our Facebook, Instagram, Soundcloud, Reverbnation, and Bandcamp pages. This will help get the word out! We will be running a contest/raffle, with a special onetime gift (to be revealed), for those that Like our Facebook page and share the IndieGoGo link. You could also just come to our shows and show your support. We love nothing more than to see our fans out at shows!

Below are the links to our pages!


www.facebook.com/strongwatermusic

https://instagram.com/strong.water.music/

www.soundcloud.com/strongwatermusic


https://www.reverbnation.com/strongwater4


https://strongwatermusic.bandcamp.com/ 

Below is a link to the Shirt and Sticker designs!!!

https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.1034139969950029.1073741827.373277826036250&type=3

story:
Who Am I?

I'm Adam Hendey! I'd like to say that I'm a member of the rising generation of new Celtic musicians. I'm primarily a whistle player, but I also play guitar and bouzouki, bass, percussion, and some other fun things. Over the course of my journey through music, I've experimented playing jazz, classical, rock, hip hop, and other folk musics, but Celtic music has always been my home.

I have a serious interest in writing, performing, and studying Celtic music - both its traditions historically, as well as its status as an evolving, contemporary culture.

My first real step in pursuing this passion is producing this album. I've made so many close friends through this music. I can't wait to show all of you the tunes I've been writing, and the style of playing - the musical voice - that I'm developing every day.

My Goal

In order for this album to become a reality, I'm going to need $5000. This money will go towards funding time in a recording studio (which I've already booked for the month of September), mixing, mastering, production, CD distribution, and compensation for guest artists.

I can't thank you enough for believing in this project, but there are some fun things I can do for you. In exchange for supporting this album, patrons can receive digital downloads; physical copies of the album; honorable mentions in the liner notes; private lessons, either in person or via Skype; personal tunes (which could potentially be played on the album!); private house concerts; recordings of a Napoleon Dynamite quote of YOUR choice; and much more!

In the event of the sad possibility that we do not meet our goal, whatever money is raised will be put towards producing the album, though perhaps at the expense of luxuries like featuring guest musicians. But no matter what, we'll make this album happen, and I think you're going to enjoy it.

Our Objective

For too long, Irish music has slowly relegated to the realm of the academic interest, remaining unchanged for fear of straying too far from convention. I want this album to help change that. As a young American who, nevertheless, plays this traditional, non-American form of music, I have a unique perspective of what this style's potential can truly be.

I want to make this music new again, and with the help of my friends, I'm sure we can do it together.

Spread the News!

We only have thirty days to raise $5000. To meet this challenge head-on, I ask you to share this campaign with as many people as you can. Even if supporting the album monetarily isn't an option for you, the biggest thing we can do for this project is to raise awareness.

You have all given me so much, and I want nothing more than to give this album to you... So I'll ask you now to give just a little bit more. Thank you so much for honoring me with your support.

story:
The OTT Select! Facebook group is a small band of music enthusiasts and record collectors.  Within their ranks are a number of very talented musicians and visual artists.  We wish for their talents to be appreciated, in the spirit of camaraderie and good cheer.  To that end, we will release a compilation LP featuring art and music created by the group's members.

A single edition of 300 black vinyl records in standard covers WILL  be made, with no repressings.

An assortment of great artists have donated their time and labor to this project, including Sky Picnic, The Kitchen Cynics, and Trappist Afterland.

A single edition of 300 black vinyl records in standard covers WILL  be made, with no repressings. An assortment of great artists have donated their time and labor to this project, including Sky Picnic, The Kitchen Cynics, and Trappist Afterland.

story:
Short Summary

Pacific huh? They some kinda rap outfit? Yes, I mean no. We're so much more! We are a rag tag group of friends who love playing music together.

Lisa Halling hails from the land of lingonberries and ABBA (Mozambique, obviously). Her energy on stage has been described as "the best thing I've ever seen."

Summer Brighton is the empresario behind such ventures as Summer Sky and Cloud 11. She sings, plays bass and hosts ridiculously cool parties.

Alex Vega is... have you heard of Autostraddle? Then you know Alex Vega. She plays percussion and keeps us honest.

Jim Briggs is our guitarist. He has a big beard and a cat. He's been known to keep it real.

What We Need & What You Get

We have already begun tracking our first EP with Justin Gariano at Treehaus Recording in Los Angeles, but without your help it will never see the light of day (or hear the light... of... hmmm).

Could we have recorded this EP in Jim's living room on a MacBook Pro? Sure, but would anybody want to listen to it? Probably not, unless you think Daniel Johnston is "overproduced." We want to do this right and deliver the best possible product to YOU! 'Cause you deserve it. And you're sexy. 

We have a lot of groovy perks for you, such as private concerts, signed CDs, guest list opportunities and we'll even play a cover song of your choice and put it on the internets!

The Impact

Your donation will be the deciding factor in whether or not this EP gets finished. Sorry to be blunt and all Debbie-downer about it but that's the reality. Without you, oh super listener, this project would sit on a hard drive on Woodland Hills until the zombie apocalypse. So I guess what I'm saying is, help us get this EP released before the zombie apocalypse and not during. 

Check out the gallery to see some of what we've done, like that time we were on Button & Bly's Travel show. That was cool.


Risks & Challenges

Zombies. Flesh eating amoeba things.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support financially, we DO read your tweets and emails. Keep 'em coming! We feel (quite strongly) that our music has value and it's so amazing that you do, too.

#PacificPublic

story:
Hello dear friends,

This is Sophocles (natively written 'Sofoklis') and I'm 31 years old.

Have you ever dreamed of doing something that's very YOU? Something that makes you feel that you did something unique, something that makes you very proud?

Well, when I was young I always wanted to work for a radio station. Never had the chance to though. I was dissapointed, still never gave up to my dreams and that's how this Internet radio was born after many years.

SKGLOBE.NET webradios launched in 2009 and is running since then 24/7 commercial-free. No advertisements or audio commercials are ever used on the website or the Internet streams because I've always wanted to create a channel that is entirely based on music so that I could enjoy it myself in the first place, then all the listeners around the world! The radio became succesful and recognized through the time by DJs and label companies alike.

Quality is what people expected and found here. This finally encouraged me and a few other people that joined me lately, to expand to more channels. In the end, Club music, Hits, Lounge and EDM channels were available through our servers in the Netherlands, Germany and Sweden.

We pay all of the expenses for licenses, servers, web hosting and events.

Lately, it's become difficult due to financial problems that led my country to do capital control. As a result big problems occured to individuals and companies that could not pay their invoices from abroad providers because of all Greek debit and credit cards being blocked.

This is where me and my small team would like to ask for your help.

We have an average of 600 euros per month to be paid to retain the servers running abroad and we would feel much safer by securing the expenses for the next 3 months, given the very unstable situation my country is going through.

With respect and love for the music.. we call all the art and music lovers to show their support.

Enjoy our weekly updated music here by clicking on the SKGLOBE.NET player.

Greetings from SKGLOBE.NET !

story:
Who we are

We at Fulham Opera are pretty damn good at putting on a show on a budget, and WHAT A SHOW Falstaff is. So good that we knew it needed to be revived and brought to a larger audience.  We are taking it to the Grimeborn Festival in Dalston: a renowned Fringe Opera Festival where many of London's fringe companies take their wares where they can be seen by a wider audience of critics and industry professionals.

All the singers at Fulham Opera are professionals making their main income from performing. But singing for a living is more complicated than just putting in the hours for a salary, and despite our small scale some of the best singers in London come and join us for far less than minimum wage. Despite Falstaff last year being a word-of-mouth hit with fantastic reviews, and people being turned away by the last performance, several weeks of full time rehearsal and four shows added up to a fee of roughly £200 each. 

Still, we are determined that this is a show worth doing - Verdi's last opera is quite possibly his greatest, and is a fantastic showcase for all the performers involved. Being in a theatre is a chance to be seen by companies, critics & agents that may not have considered heading to a damp West London church for the first run. So what can YOU do to help?

What We Need & What You Get

With just £2000 the whole cast could be taking home close to minimum wage for the rehearsals and shows of the revival.  More and they might even be able to pay for one or two of the singing lessons necessary for a career in our industry. 

We are continuing our search for funding through traditional methods, but we would hate to rule out this opportunity to further support our artists. We couldn't do this show without them.


The Impact

Opera is a visceral and vibrant art form, but these days breaking into a career in an opera house singing traditional repertoire is no easy task. Performing roles like these is invaluable to singers at this stage. Fulham Opera has a proven track record for excellence - indeed, back in 2014 we successfully staged the entire Ring Cycle!  We also got fantastic reviews for our Falstaff in November 2014, indeed Keel Watson's Falstaff was described as "vocally commanding.... a lived-in performance of tremendous appeal".  And here is a rather nice blog review:  ow.ly/EL7HY

This is our first production venture outside of Fulham, and we are very excited to be doing it.


Risks & Challenges

Opera singers....

Just kidding!

We thought we'd got the funding, but then it was suddenly taken away just before rehearsals began.  This has been a huge challenge, which is why we're doing this so late in the process...

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help us financially, please help us spread the word by sharing our campaign - see our facebook and twitter pages - 

OR 

COME TO THE SHOW! Tickets are selling fast, but there is still time: 

https://www.arcolatheatre.com/production/arcola...

story:
Hello friends! My name is Helen Newby and I am a cellist based in the San Francisco Bay Area. 

As I continue my career as a full-time performer & teacher, the need for a new instrument is increasingly vital. I've been reliant on borrowing instruments for the past four years, as the cello that I personally own doesn't quite fulfill my needs as a musician. In order to press on towards my professional goals as a freelance cellist, it is critical that I own a quality instrument on which I can fully express myself.  

By supporting my campaign, you are facilitating my very livelihood. Performing and teaching are my primary sources of income. Without a quality instrument, it is incredibly difficult to succeed in the competitive world of classical music. 

The cello that I am purchasing has been built especially for me by Brian Lisus, a California-based luthier born & raised in South Africa. Perhaps most notable among his credits is "The Quartet of Peace", a set of 4 instruments which honors the 4 Nobel Peace Prize Laureates from South Africa: Nelson Mandela, F.W. de Klerk, Albert Luthuli and Archbishop Desmond Tutu. The instruments have been played at charity events that support music education for children in South Africa. 

I have set this campaign up so that I will receive all funds donated and they will go directly towards funding the cello. The total cost of the instrument is $34,000 (not including tax), and I intend on personally paying for whatever portion is not covered through this fundraiser. 

Any little bit that you're willing and able to contribute really helps. And even more importantly, please feel free to share my campaign with your friends, classmates, co-workers, relatives, etc! 

Thank you so much for considering donating to my cause and supporting the arts! 

xoxo,

Helen

story:
New Fans & Loyal Fans--it's HERE!

Finally, XtothaO has finished and released his highly anticipated latest solo EP project, "Reserved" and he's made it FREE TO DOWNLOAD to the world via LiveMixTapes...click below and get it NOW!

CLICK HERE TO GET XtothaO's solo RESERVED EP ALBUM FOR FREE


Why is the RESERVED EP FREE?

XtothaO's fans connect to his style of expression in a way that is only found in top artists like Kendrick Lamar, J. Cole, Lupe Fiasco, and very few others. It is because of his unique musical and lyrical expressions and content, which are based on real life situations, that XtothaO is able to use his music to help real people deal with real life.


What's the CATCH?

After investing thousands of dollars, working full time to support his family and his musical career, XtothaO has decided to...#GoALLIn...by pursuing his musical career full time and is hoping for financial support to assist him and his family.


Who is XtothaO?

XtothaO is from the small East Texas town of Nacogdoches, Texas. He feels his music is important not only as his dream and passion but as a way of connecting to and helping others deal with struggles in their own lives. Something of a dying breed in this industry today, XtothaO has turned to music as his way of venting and expressing his feelings on real life situations which he has endured his entire life:

  • From being born as a premature baby
  • To dealing with his mother and father being addicted to drugs and alcohol.
  • To coping with his brother serving time
Check out more of his music exclusively on SoundCloud.com/XtothaO


What You Can Do & What You Can Get?

Living it by example & following his dreams, this will allow him to inspire others to do the same in their own lives--all the while, continuing to make great music for his fans for free as a true independent artist.

There are many ways you can help XtothaO reach his ultimate goal of reaching as many people as possible with his music: 

  • Donate once or donate often!
  • Help spread this fundraiser on social media and get your friends involved.
  • Send it & request play time from local Radio Statio & Club DJs.
  • Play it at parties and social events.
  • Share his music & follow his career moves following him through:
  • Twitter.com/XtothaO
  • Facebook.com/XtothaO
  • SoundCloud.com/XtothaO
  • Instagram.com/XtothaO


Ultimately, your one-time or semi-regular donations and willingness to do any of the above items are helping XtothaO continue pushing and driving to support his pursuit of showing others that they can achieve their dreams if they #GoALLIn. 


What Comes Next?

Stay tuned into XtothaO’s Facebook & Twitter account for upcoming information on music videos, appearances, his follow up solo album (due out Q4), cameos, tour dates, merchandise, special features, and more!

Bookmark XtothaO's SoundCloud page to listen to exclusive new material that may or may not make the cut on his follow up album!


Be Part of Something BIGGER!

Not very often do the type of artists come along in this world that truly connect with their fans by giving away their music for free--this one is and you have the opportunity to support him from the beginning.

XtothaO is sacrificing and has GONE ALL IN on his dreams while still trying to provide for his family and making musical career moves! As more and more fans connect their lives to his unique style, XtothaO is fast on his way to making a huge difference in the industry--will you join him in your own life and #GoALLIn?!

Thanks for the continued support!

It’s Never Too Late To Live Your Dreams! #GoALLIn!!!

Check out more of his music exclusively on SoundCloud.com/XtothaO
What You Can Do & What You Can Get?Living it by example & following his dreams, this will allow him to inspire others to do the same in their own lives--all the while, continuing to make great music for his fans for free as a true independent artist.There are many ways you can help XtothaO reach his ultimate
goal of reaching as many people as possible with his music: 
Donate once or donate often!
Help spread this fundraiser on social media and get your friends involved. 
Send it & request play time from local Radio Statio & Club DJs.
Play it at parties and social events.
Share his music & follow his career moves following him through:
Twitter.com/XtothaO
Facebook.com/XtothaO
SoundCloud.com/XtothaO
Instagram.com/XtothaO
Ultimately, your one-time or semi-regular donations and
willingness to do any of the above items are helping XtothaO continue pushing
and driving to support his pursuit of showing others that they can achieve their
dreams if they #GoALLIn. 
What Comes Next?
Stay tuned into XtothaO’s Facebook & Twitter account for upcoming information on music videos, appearances, his follow up solo album (due out Q4), cameos, tour dates, merchandise, special features, and more!
Bookmark XtothaO's SoundCloud page to listen to exclusive new material that may or may not make the cut on his follow up album!


Be Part of Something BIGGER!Not very often do the type of artists come along in this world that truly connect with their fans by giving away their music for free--this one is and you have the opportunity to support him from the beginning.XtothaO is sacrificing and has GONE ALL IN on his dreams while still trying to provide for his family and making musical career moves! As more and more fans connect their lives to his unique style, XtothaO is fast on his way to making a huge difference in the industry--will you join him in your own life and #GoALLIn?!Thanks for the continued support!It’s Never Too Late To Live Your Dreams! #GoALLIn!!!

story:
Short Summary

We are creating a five day Radio festival celebrating Aboriginal Week airing live from five venues in Vancouver beautiful British Columbia and will be broadcasted from station-to-station and  coast-to-coast in Canada. The live show will also be available via podcast or Internet Stream. We're raising funds to ensure quality of stage and broadcasts throughout the radio festival. The radio festival will run from June 17 till June 21.

What We Need & What You Get

What we need is money for equipment rentals and props? We also need money to fund the crews for the sound and stage to ensure a professional appearance as well to help with travel expenses. The show will appear before a live studio audience and then broadcasted from Vancouver BC to  Ottawa Ontario . Even the smallest of donations will receive our gratitude and thanks larger donations will receive digital link to copies of the show. Those who can contribute more will benefit from the professional sound with a downloadable MP3 copy of the five-day performance.

The Impact

The red jam slam radio festival will create an opportunity for listeners and audience members to hear expressions of healing and caring for mother earth and respect for our own cultural teachings while staying in tune with others living on mother earth

Risks & Challenges

The risks and obstacles have been to ensure a clear radio feed provided by CITR UBC Campus Radio Station from each venue to each participating station. We have tested the feed and received positive results. Your contributions will enable us to have continued success during the Red Jam Slam radio festival from June 17th -June 21st from 1PM-5PM Pacific Time.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understandThat not everyone can help with money. And we still need your help because you can share this event with your friends your family and communities. we asked that you share this on Facebook and Twitter with your  community because no matter how many friends you have can be a big contributor to this campaign.

story:
Hello there! My name is Adam and I am a composer of contemporary classical music. I have dedicated four years of my life to creating this album of my music and I worked with so many incredible performers including the Carpe Diem String Quartet and legendary pianist Donna Amato. I have completed the recordings out of my own pocket, designed the album cover, and engineered every track myself resulting in massive cuts to cost. Everything is completed so all I'm asking for now is enough to cover the cost of duplication. 


Check out some of my music:


Behemoth for Solo Percussion (Included on the album) performed by Greg Jukes:

String Quartet No. 1:


And as a bonus, here is a a pretty dramatic clip from a movie I scored entitled Habit Forming:


The Album

Sonic Eugenics, among other things, is about the breaking down of musical ideas and the act of using those building blocks to assemble something new. It is a love letter to high modernism and to modern society’s need to be bombarded with information rapidly. 

The CD is divided into 3 parts. In part 1, I emphasize my dark modernist roots and play up the intensity and dramatic scope (and heavy metal influence!). In part 2, I explore more postmodern elements. I build from specific musical influences from across history and take them in exciting new directions. I even "remix" a track, thus using my own music as the seed to generate new music. Finally, part 3 consists only of a single piece, Unixos: Concerto for Piano and Electronics. This piece is my most ambitious work to date and is the culmination of years of passion and work to write this one piece.


Who am I??

I am a composer, sound designer, and audio engineer based in the Pittsburgh area. I have composed the score and have provided a great deal of audio  work for the independent film "Habit Forming" and the video game "Otaku." In addition to pursuing a career in media composition, I like to present myself first and foremost as a composer of contemporary classical music.


You can find me at adamshieldcomposer.com


Tracklist

Fanfare for the Final Frontier for Two Trumpets

String Quartet No. 5

Psychosis for Solo Piano

Phærnix (pronounced Fare-nix) for Tape

Fantasizing for Solo Flute

Behemoth for Solo Percussion

Deconstructions for Solo Piano

Variations on a Post-Modern Fantasy for Tape

Reconstructions (String Quartet No. 4)

Unixos: Concerto for Piano and Electronics


Run time: 46 minutes

All of the program notes for the music on the album can be found on my website.


Perfomers Featured on the Album

Carpe Diem String Quartet

Donna Amato - Piano

Junyi Liu - Piano

Jessie Nucho - Flute

Greg Jukes - Percussion

Gerald Hildenbrand - Trumpet

Matthew McCormack - Trumpet

Myself - Electronics




Thanks for looking! You're support is greatly appreciated!

I'll leave you with one more piece I wrote for full orchestra.


Carnival of Chaos for Orchestra:

story:
The Hyphenate

My name is The Hyphenate and I'm a recording artist/producer who is passionate about making real hip hop and about making a difference. I make lyrical, thought-provoking, entertaining, and socially conscious music that both hardcore hip hop fans and young new enthusiasts equally enjoy. I also am very involved within the community and I utilize my influence and voice to advocate change and progress for a better tomorrow. I'm an independent artist; I produce my own beats, write my own lyrics, engineer my own songs, direct/edit/create my own videos/designs/photos/media content, and I'm continuously building a stronger and bigger support base.

Why This Is Important

This crowd funding campaign to help me finish my new album is extremely important to me for many reasons. I've done as much as I can on my own up to this point, but I need your help for this next step. My upcoming album Fighter is a personal and influential album filled with music that entertains but also connects with its listeners on a deeply emotional level. People relate to my music and are inspired by it. My mission is to use my music and my voice to make people feel good at the same time make them feel motivated enough to never give up on themselves despite what life brings. I'm also excited to use this album to give back by donating 10% of all profits from this album's sales to children's shelters across the nation. My support base has been growing and the demand for a professional studio album has gotten to a point where I have to give my amazing supporters what they want.

How Your Contribution Will Help

Your contribution to this project, no matter the size, will be a HUGE help to my music career and movement. It is very hard for me as an independent artist to do everything and provide the resources to make an album with a proper release, but with your help, we can do incredible things with this project. Your donation will help with:

●Professional Studio Recording

●Professionally Mastered "Fighter" Album

●Professionally Reproduced and Packaged Album

●Official "Fighter" T Shirts and Pull Over Hoodies

●Album Distribution to all Digital Stores (Including iTunes) 

●Kick Start My Nationwide "Fighter" Tour

You will help me complete a dream of mine, you will help me get this professional album in the hands of people who want and need this art in their lives, you will help me to be seen as a serious factor to industry professionals, you will help me spread an uplifting message across the world, and you will help me make a positive difference.

What You Get

For helping me finish my album and starting my tour, every person who donates will receive something by way of the various perks offered. Entrance to the album release party and other concerts of mine, signed copy of the physical album, hand written lyrics from my songs, clothing, merchandise, exclusive collectables, and even a private concert for you and your friends. Check out the perks section for more info.

Risks & Challenges

I've done my research to make sure I'm capable and prepared for any obstacle that comes my way. I've put myself in a place where I have multiple options in case something doesn't go according to plan. I have back up plans for mastering engineers, venues, marketing specialists, recording studios, and manufacturing. I am able to adapt to any situation if one were to arise. I'm independent but I do make music professionally and know how to make sure I deliver on a promise. If somehow all of the funds aren't raised, that doesn't mean the project will fail. I'm also personally investing into this project and I currently have my amazing publicist working on gathering sponsors and investors as well. Ideally I'd like to start off with having 1,000 physical copies of the album made and have an album release party at a venue that holds at least 500 guests, but if somehow we struggle with funding, then the album production and merchandise for all those who contributed will be fulfilled no matter what. With the momentum we have going and with all the positive vibes in our movement, I have no doubt in my mind that we will reach our goal and things will go smoothly according to plan.

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand not all of you who support my movement will be able to contribute financially. I understand and will greatly appreciate if you can at least help make noise by sharing this campaign with all your friends and family via facebook, twitter, instagram, email, and more. Let's make history!

#DoubtMe

story:
There is a fresh and innovative sound taking over the music scene in the Queen city of Charlotte, NC and their name is Lovely Budz.  These young and determined musicians have set out on a mission to provide a musical experience unmatched by any other band.  Lovely Budz made their debut in March 2014 officially but all of the band members have been playing music for quite awhile.

Lovely Budz consists of Robert Samuel Tyler Vickery on Rhythm guitar/Lead Vocals but Tyler can play any instrument.  He is very skilled on Tuba and Trombone to mention a couple.  On Lead Guitar is Mason Slocum.  He also can play the keys as well as Tenor and Alto Saxophones.  On Drums and anything percussion is Kody Farris.  Tyler, Kody, and Mason have all been playing in marching and concert ensembles since the 6th grade.  The latest addition to the band is none other than Clifton Bundick on Bass.  Clifton attends the University of North Carolina at Charlotte and has been accepted to study the Jazz Bass by the UNCC department of music. The bands home location is the “Lovely Lab” located in Indian Land, SC.  When these four musicians aren’t practicing or playing a show they are out in full support of other local bands.  They spend most of those shows soaking up the knowledge of other bands that have laid the foundation before them and finding their own unique ways to contribute to the ever growing music scene in the Charlotte area.

Some of the artists that have been huge influences on Lovely Budz are Sun Dried Vibes, Zach Fowler, Treehouse, Rebelution, Of Good Nature, Passafire, Young the Giant, Roots of a Rebellion, and Nahko and Medicine for the People.  Lovely Budz has already shared the stage with several of these bands at Chop Shop for the annual Wintersplash and Give Thanks Festivals.  There are big plans on the horizon as these guys are looking forward to sharing the stage with more fantastic artists in the Charlotte area as well as touring the southeast.  This tour will cover a large area over the Carolinas, Tennessee, Georgia, and more.  Lovely Budz tries to play as many local shows as possible while still juggling a rigorous school and extracurricular schedule.

Before Lovely Budz embarks on their first tour they are planning on recording their debut EP titled "The Sound" which will consist of hit singles and crowd favorites.  They also have an impressive and affordable merchandise section to promote not only the band’s name but their patented message “Circle of Love.”  As a child Tyler learned from his Great Grandmother about how everyone in their family including close friends were all in a circle of love and no one can break it.  This philosophy has been incorporated into their shows and how they treat their fans.  At every show you will notice people holding their circle of love symbol high in the air.  You will also notice the band having just as much fun as their audience and encouraging a positive and loving experience.

Lovely Budz has a unique sound full of powerful lyrics complimented by precise delivery.  Their energy is contagious and it forces the audience to sing along and dance the night away.  Shortly after the experience of hearing Lovely Budz for the first time you will find yourself reciting the catchy lyrics from the night before and researching online to find your next opportunity to witness something magical.  The members of Lovely Budz have the full support of their families and friends and quickly they are gaining the recognition as one of Charlotte’s premier bands.  But they are not content to limit their exposure to just the Charlotte area, they are ready to take their talent and their message to all over the country and eventually the world.  Lovely Budz encourages you to follow them on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter for updates and tour dates.

story:
I HAVE COMPLETED AND MASTERED MY DEBUT CD 

The first CD of 17 songs in now complete and shipping!  I am also halfway into my second twelve recordings and am still recording. The material is waiting. The musicians are available and excited, all seasoned pros, some with the gold stuff on the walls, we are performing together as well as uniting from great distances. There is an expanding fan base by online data. 

The musical travels and journeys have gone and will be going many places and I would welcome your company on the journey,  documenting portions as I go and always assembling new musical synergy and new songs and performance, I am an actualizer of music synergy.

                 CLICK ON THE "GALLERY" BUTTON TO REVEIW SONGS!


Animation by Chris Casady




I HOPE YOU WILL SPONSOR ME IN THIS DREAMQUEST

Check the MUSIC IN THE "GALLERY" section, some live & some masters
