story:
Our Vision:

Hebrews 6:19 "We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure."

Grounded in the gospel that seeks the lost and shows the way of salvation. This love breaks down the barriers of race, class, age, and person and  makes healing, renewal, transformation, and grace available to every soul.  

Growing through a fervent dedication to discipleship.  Beginning where a person is and journeying through a lifetime of learning, training, apprenticing, searching, and seeking.

Grafted into the purposes of Christ’s Kingdom.  

We passionately join with Christ as a group of active participants in the renewal of ALL things.

Going steadfastly in the direction of His Kingdom.  Realizing that His Kingdom coming pushes us away from consuming to pursuing Christ.  


Our Values

Core Cultures are the Values that we live out both personally and collectively.

Rhythms are the Elements that we weave into the framework of everyday.  



Holiness

Sacrifice-  In reflecting the ultimate sacrifice of Jesus, we consider it a privilege to give of our time, resources, gifts, strengths, and comfort.  

Pursuit- Choosing the pursuit of His Kingdom coming over the pursuit of worldly glory.

Empowerment- Having access to the power of God through discipleship will change the church and the world.  


Wellness

Presence- Living in a way where we are present in mind, body, and spirit- always aware of God’s movement in the workings of the everyday.

Creativity- Putting our diverse spectrum of gifts and talents to use allows the world to see God’s beauty in the midst of a broken world.

Simplicity- Choosing to live out the simplicity of the Gospel as reflected in our habits, finances, schedule, consumption, lifestyle, and pursuits.


Authenticity


Grace- Giving that, which we, as believers, have already been given.  

Family- Functioning better in community/family we demonstrate the love of our Father.

Storytelling- Telling our own stories that are riddled with sorrow, brokenness, joy, miracles, and truth often brings about redemption and healing.  


Providence


Refuge- Providing the physical space, the emotional investment, spiritual gifts, and resources to offer a haven to those seeking shelter.
Missional-  Living with the mindset of embedding ourselves into the work of God out in the world and not waiting for the world to come find us.  

Renewal- Joining with God in the renewal of all things- from self to the entirety of the world.


Why Sharonville?

A staggering 47.5% of the Sharonville population are Unconnected (not attending any religious service).

Sharonville is the barren spiritual ground that demonstrates the model unchurched identity.  The Anchor Fellowship has the tools, passion, design, and calling to meet Sharonville with the love of Jesus.


Why Shawn?

In 1995, an ordinary person received a calling to join a movement of God.  Shawn has since committed his life to pursuing this call into ministry.  He has invested into multiple aspects of church and non- profit ministry, whether youth, young adult, women’s centers, community assistance, music, or pastoring in order to hone into where God has called him.  Shawn, his wife Katy, and their three children moved to New York to attend Alliance Theological Seminary for his Masters in Divinity.  There he further engaged with his clear calling to be a lead pastor.  Backed by the full support of his family and home church, Shawn and Katy attended Discovery Center in September of 2014 and received a green light.  Shawn is called and convicted in the areas of spreading the Gospel,  transforming ordinary people, meeting tangible needs, discipling, and building Christ’s Kingdom.  Having been involved in multiple ministries and churches based in many varied locations, cultures, and socioeconomic groups for the last 19 years, the Blevins’ family are ready and excited to invest even more into the vision God has given them for The Anchor Fellowship.  Already a part of the community in relationships and participation- Shawn and Katy are a relevant cultural fit for the people and community of Sharonville.  



The How of the Anchor Fellowship:


Expressing of Worship through Music and the Arts

Remembering through the practice of the Ancient Disciplines

Becoming better Christ followers through Discipleship

Renewing through teaching and preaching for all ages

Transforming the community through the Parish Model


One way that the Anchor will meet the needs/lifestyle/demographics of this community is a Saturday Evening Service.  With a large segment of both families and unmarrieds- this service time fits with the regimented schedules of sports, work, and community events.  Because we believe that strong families help keep the community and church body strong, we will use a take home program called Carry Out.  Sunday’s Sabbath rest will be encouraged and then combined with Christ-centered discipleship ideas for families, singles, and couples that will be provided to spark creativity through Carry Out.  Responsibility for personal discipline and leadership in the home will communicate the work of the church being something every individual can actively own.  

Following the pattern of breathing:

The inhale- Saturday worship/teaching, the pause- Sunday Sabbath, and the exhale- Monday back into the world.  


What We Need 

We need $15,000 in order to do several crucial things.

- File all the necessary legal paperwork for 501©3, incorporation, PO Box, etc.

- Receive a Matching Donation from our sending church.

- Secure a building and necessary renovations.

- Secure supplies for Launch on November 7th, 2015.

- Host our first Outreach Event in August for the Community followed by 2 more pre-launch events.

- Start compensating Staff


The Impact

Your financially gift lets us hit the ground running.  It will enable us to literally be in the community making an impact both spiritually and tangibly.   It enables us access to even more funding through our sending church.  You will get to be a part of a church where people who are unchurched, dechurched, or healthily churched can find a home, meet Jesus, and actually BE the church.  We are asking for you to partner in this Revival now.


Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Facebook.

Maybe you love design or admin work- we could use that!

Volunteer!

Come with us!
story_txt:
Our Vision:
Hebrews 6:19 "We have this hope as an anchor for the soul, firm and secure."
Grounded in the gospel that seeks the lost and shows the way of salvation. This love breaks down the barriers of race, class, age, and person and  makes healing, renewal, transformation, and grace available to every soul.  
Growing through a fervent dedication to discipleship.  Beginning where a person is and journeying through a lifetime of learning, training, apprenticing, searching, and seeking.


Grafted into the purposes of Christ’s Kingdom.  

We passionately join with Christ as a group of active participants in the renewal of ALL things. 
Going steadfastly in the direction of His Kingdom.  Realizing that His Kingdom coming pushes us away from consuming to pursuing Christ.  
Our Values
Core Cultures are the Values that we live out both personally and collectively.
Rhythms are the Elements that we weave into the framework of everyday.  
Holiness
Sacrifice-  In reflecting the ultimate sacrifice of Jesus, we consider it a privilege to give of our time, resources, gifts, strengths, and comfort.  
Pursuit- Choosing the pursuit of His Kingdom coming over the pursuit of worldly glory.
Empowerment- Having access to the power of God through discipleship will change the church and the world.  
WellnessPresence- Living in a way where we are present in mind, body, and spirit- always aware of God’s movement in the workings of the everyday.
Creativity- Putting our diverse spectrum of gifts and talents to use allows the world to see God’s beauty in the midst of a broken world. 
Simplicity- Choosing to live out the simplicity of the Gospel as reflected in our habits, finances, schedule, consumption, lifestyle, and pursuits.
Authenticity
Grace- Giving that, which we, as believers, have already been given.  
Family- Functioning better in community/family we demonstrate the love of our Father.
Storytelling- Telling our own stories that are riddled with sorrow, brokenness, joy, miracles, and truth often brings about redemption and healing.  
Providence
Refuge- Providing the physical space, the emotional investment, spiritual gifts, and resources to offer a haven to those seeking shelter.


Missional-  Living with the mindset of embedding ourselves into the work of God out in the world and not waiting for the world to come find us.  Renewal- Joining with God in the renewal of all things- from self to the entirety of the world.



Why Sharonville?

A staggering 47.5% of the Sharonville population are Unconnected (not attending any religious service).


Sharonville is the barren spiritual ground that demonstrates the model unchurched identity.  The Anchor Fellowship has the tools, passion, design, and calling to meet Sharonville with the love of Jesus.

The inhale- Saturday worship/teaching, the pause- Sunday Sabbath, and the exhale- Monday back into the world.

- File all the necessary legal paperwork for 501©3, incorporation, PO Box, etc.
- Receive a Matching Donation from our sending church.
- Secure a building and necessary renovations.

- Start compensating Staff

story:
Hello! My name is Emma Rae Marie Shaw and for the last 12 years, I have been a passionate and devoted Upright Bass player. I have been involved in music for most of my life, playing other instruments and singing for as long as I can remember. When my transition from elementary to middle school meant a transition from a small beginning violin class to an orchestra, I had to choose what instrument I would like to play. “Play all the instruments, and at the end of the day, write down your name and which you’d like to play on a piece of paper,” said the orchestra teacher, Mr. Frank. I made a bee-line for the bass, big and curvy an beautiful, and when I heard the deep and echoing resonances that sang from its wooden body, I knew exactly what instrument I wanted to play. So I wrote down in childish handwriting on a small piece of paper- ‘The Big One, -Emma.’

   So I started my career as a bassist with The Hoover Middle School Orchestra, received a scholarship at Capp Community Music Center in San Francisco, and played first bass all city from 7th grade until my senior year of high school. I then went on to play two European tours with the Peninsula Youth Orchestra as one of the youngest members accepted, and played with the Lowell Symphonic Orchestra during high school, first bass in an all state orchestra my senior year. I played at the renowned Davies Symphony Hall, home of the San Francisco Symphony Orchestra. Recently I have branched out into new and exciting genres of music with my two current blue-grass style bands Harbor House and Abalone Grey, the latter with whom I will be touring this summer.

   Through all this time playing, and after so many great experiences, I have used a single stand up bass, which my parents so graciously gifted to me after a few years of playing, and which I lovingly bestowed the name Charlie. I owe him a great deal for providing me with countless amazing opportunities and adventures, but sadly it is time to move on. Charlie has some serious problems and damage from so much happy use and will not make it to my upcoming tour. But as the circle of bass continues, a new bass will take his place, with your help.

   I am asking you, friends, family, fellow musicians and sympathetic souls, to help make my dreams come true! I need all the help I can get if I am to continue my career as a dedicated musician and lover of the bass. With your generous donations, my musical path can continue on, not only for the sake of my own fulfillment but hopefully so that I can continue to help create inspiring songs for my bands' already devoted listeners, future fans, and for you!

   The funds you contribute will go mostly to the purchasing of a new beautiful or used upright bass. Unfortunately in this day and age, a 3/4 size double bass like the one I play is one of the more expensive instruments out there, and I hope to find a suitable and reliable new heart pounding stand-up for around $2500 (and this is aiming low!). The remaining $500 will be used for the inevitable expenses that accompany playing this instrument, especially in front of large live audiences. The bass will need to be refitted so that it can be amplified, which is crucial for my upcoming tour with Abalone Grey, and this comes in at around $200 or $300 dollars. And finally, for many of my new songs, the bass needs a bow and I need electrical chords, bow rosin, maintenance items etc. Which is why I need your help! I can't do this alone, and any help that you can provide will be so, so appreciated.

   To show my appreciation, I will give you, the contributors, my own gifts in return. These include CDs of my music from both Harbor House and Abalone Grey, one on one bass lessons, and merchandise from my bands in addition to my everlasting gratitude.

  Every small amount helps, so thank you and I hope to play for you and with you in the future!

story:
Summary

For the fourth year, New Orleans’ Bastille Day weekend’s main event is Bastille Day Fête: a free, public festival held on the Riverwalk's revitalized Spanish Plaza (turned French for the day!). Catch a Mississippi River breeze while feasting on delicious French food from local restaurants and dancing to the sound of live music. This year’s line-up will feature exceptional local artists and francophone acts. Children will be treated to face painting, French storytelling, and arts activities. 

And to top it off, dogs are invited too…dress up your pup for the annual “French Dog Contest” where all dogs are welcome to show off their French spirit and win prizes!

Bastille Day Fête is presented by The Alliance Française de La Nouvelle-Orléans (a 501(c)(3) non-profit) and the French-American Chamber of Commerce, with the support of the Consulate General of France in New Orleans.

How Funds Are Used

Your donation will help cover costs including:

  • Music: bands and set up costs such as staging, etc.
  • Kids' activities including face painting, storytelling, crafts, and games
  • Keep this event FREE! We want Bastille Day to continue to be an all-inclusive, public celebration!
  • Even if our goal is not reached, we can still use the funds raised toward these costs.

The Impact

Your contribution will help us to fulfill our broader mission:

  • Promote and preserve New Orleans' unique French heritage
  • Encourage the use of the French language
  • Present French culture to the local community and encourage intercultural understanding

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute financially, you can still support us in many ways:

  • Get the word out...Share this page with your friends!
  • Speak a little French during Bastille Day weekend July 11-14, even if it's just "Bonjour"!
  • Volunteer at the festival. Sign up here!

story: '52 Commercial Road' are an instrumental rock group from the D.I.Y / underground scene in London. Having started playing together in 2004 the band have gone on to have an extensive career including 3 studio albums, a remix album and 3 film scores. Poised on the verge of completion of a new album set for release in 2015, the band needs your support to make it happen. Emerging from the post-rock era of guitar music, this record promises to be characterised by a new dynamic, unconfounded by restrictions of genre.

story:
Recording in The Attic will be a treat. It is a cozy sweet-sounding room, and The State Theatre as an organization has a huge heart for local music. For me, this music journey has been marked both with local venues who gave my art a chance and collaborating musicians who've improved my artistry. Performing with them has helped the music reach more people in the community. And with this album, the music can go beyond and reach even more ears, more hearts.

This journey also has included local folks who believe in what this music could be, which has been transformative particularly because State College is where I was born. So, it would be awesome to have the energy of a local audience captured in the recording.

Donations will go toward the following:

$4000: Earwicker Productions + collaborating musicians
$2300: CD pressing/production + songwriting royalties for cover songs +
commissioning album art

Total: $6300

There are two ways to give on Indiegogo:

1) You can donate ANY amount by clicking the BACK IT button. 

2) You can get a perk at the donation level listed.  If you'd like to get one, click on the perk you'd like. (Quantities are limited.) I'm offering solo performances, digital downloads of the album, signed CDs, and a home cooked meal! I LOVE being in the kitchen.

Thank you for reading, and feel free to share this others :)

story:
Who is Elyse and What is #sadgirlpianomusic?

 

Elyse got her start writing music very young, writing lyrics and singing her words to anyone who would listen. As a Midwestern teenager, Elyse spent her free time tucked away in chorus practice rooms building a relationship with the piano. At 15, she began writing original songs with simple 3 note chords on the piano to accompany her vocals, using music as an outlet to help her process teenage heartbreaks, issues with identity, and to celebrate her love of poetry. This was the beginning of #sadgirlpianomusic. Putting emotion and honesty into song in a way that can be shared with all who hear it. 

All of that came to a halt just a few years later. Music is a vulnerable expression, and for a young girl just finding her voice, one piece of harsh criticism deflated her quickly. Soon she found herself selling her keyboard, abandoning her piano, and considering her love for creating music a thing of the past.

Over the next twelve years and spanning several moves and careers, Elyse's love for poetry and lyricism would lead her to publish 2 collections, NUDITY and Watermelon by Fall 2016. Yet, even after pouring herself into words, still she felt a part of her was missing.

All that changed in 2017. With the state of the political and social climate, Elyse took to music once again as an outlet, soon finding that her passion for creating poetry into music had never left, but needed to be set free. Given a piano as a gift, she spends hours playing and writing each day. Passionate, determined, and inspired, and recognizing that everything happens for a reason, she saw that being given a piano once again meant she has something to share.

A lover of music of all kinds, she surrounds herself with musicians, gleaning their stories and their knowledge. While finding inspiration by attending shows and buying albums made by local artists, Elyse wrote the title track "Afterlife" to put into words the feeling of watching everyone around her live her dream while she stood in the crowd, wishing she could be a part of it. It was this song that was the breaking point. She decided that her first step is just to try. 

"To see what happens when I work my ass off doing something I'm passionate about."

The Afterlife EP is a 5 track extended play that is an introduction and an exploration into the heart of a woman unafraid to be vulnerable, raw, personal, and emotional. Varying in style but succinct in their simplicity and honest expression, each track on 'Afterlife' is a heart-wrenching, bittersweet lullaby for the tender nerves of any listener. Inspired by artists such as Fiona Apple, Regina Spektor, Jeff Buckley, Erykah Badu, Cat Power, and her own friends and lovers, Elyse honors the art of #sadgirlpianomusic by holding nothing back.

Why I Need Your Help

My goal for this campaign is to raise $6,000 to cover:

  • Production/Equipment Rental
  • Additional Artist Rates
  • Mastering
  • Pressing
  • Marketing (Artwork, Merch, etc)

Not a cent of this campaign will go to waste! What's most important to me is to produce this project with integrity and respect for all those lending their time and talents to bring it into fruition.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ok so you don't have the cash to support now? That's rad!

  • Share this with your friends!  
  • Follow me on Instagram, Facebook, and YouTube
  • Wanna hear me play somewhere? Book me, baby!

I am doing this thing because I can't not. Whether it's just me playing alone in my little apartment to my house plants or for packed crowds, recording on my iPhone or in a studio, passing out cassette tapes or selling platinum records, the fact that I'm making music at all means I am successful. But I want to take this as far as it can go. I want to share my work with you and let it take me wherever I'm meant to be. I'm ready to work. I'm ready to give this my all. What are you willing to give?

Lastly:

MAJOR shout-out to Kelsey, Laura, and Jason for the images and video for this campaign!! Support your local content creators!

Share this with your friends!  
Follow me on Instagram, Facebook, and YouTube

I am doing this thing because I can't not. Whether it's just me playing alone in my little apartment to my house plants or for packed crowds, recording on my iPhone or in a studio, passing out cassette tapes or selling platinum records, the fact that I'm making music at all means I am successful. But I want to take this as far as it can go. I want to share my work with you and let it take me wherever I'm meant to be. I'm ready to work. I'm ready to give this my all. What are you willing to give?Lastly:MAJOR shout-out to Kelsey, Laura, and Jason for the images and video for this campaign!! Support your local content creators!

story:
WHY I AM PRODUCING A BENEFIT CONCERT SERIES

The United States Virgin Islands was decimated by two of the most powerful Atlantic hurricanes in recorded history. Yet, this devastation was largely absent from national news reports. Being hit by Hurricanes Irma and Maria within a 12-day period was unimaginable, until it happened. Thousands of our American brothers and sisters lost everything to the 170-plus mph winds and many remain in shelters. Electrical system lie on the ground, destroyed; many poles snapped into pieces like matchsticks. The raging winds burned  green hillsides nearly black – stripping every leaf - and ripped massive trees out by their roots. Heavy rains and storm surge caused mudslides and flooding and mutilated sections of pristine coastline. The Territory’s only two hospitals were damaged beyond repair and many schools have been heavily damaged. U.S. Virgin islands now remains in 80 percent darkness as they maintain a stiff upper lip and work with each other to bring back some sense of normalcy to the islands.

 

WHO I AM

I am founder and President of Linnette Harrigan Media Inc.  My team and I work regularly on music for feature films, documentaries, TV series, pilots and teaser reels.

I am also a music producer, publisher, director and songstress of Caribbean Heritage.  I  have close personal ties to St. Thomas & St. John – 2 of Islands making up the U.S. Virgin Islands, as my entire family was born on these Islands.  My aunt and other family members are now homeless, since the Hurricanes. With all the devastation that has occurred on the islands, I decided to help.

For years, I have performed as singer and songwriter, I've organized events, produced music for TV & Film projects and co-curated concerts with various  groups and organizations for more than decade. 


A series like this one is quite a challenge, but I’m extremely grateful for the interest and support already received by media and amazing performers collaborating with my team and me.

The videos above are just a sample of what we are working on -  with your help we can create and do much more.

WHAT WE NEED TO MAKE IT HAPPEN

 NOW, all we need is YOU, to help us move forward.  Your contribution will pay for marketing, administrative costs, ticketing, insurance and venue rentals.  Your contribution will also allow me to pay the performing artists.  I’m very proud to bring you excellent performers from stage & screen and these funds allow me to pay them for their imaginative, moving performances they are bringing to the stage.  ANY amount you give will be deeply, deeply appreciated.  

 

YOUR REWARDS

 There are also some amazing perks when you donate to this campaign.  We have gifts for EVERYONE – who gives from $5 all the way up to $1000

We have everything from CD’s, musical consultations, tickets  to an event of your choosing, etc.  Of course, all donors will also be recognized in the program for their generous support.  

You can give any old amount you want, odd or even, listed or not.  We are also happy to provide a a customized package of perks for those making a contribution of $1000 or more.     

Every contributor who gives even at the lowest level will receive regular updates on the creative process, with photos and short videos.  Some contributors will receive an extra exclusive level access.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

PLEASE SHARE this campaign with your friends.

Even If you are unable to  contribute monetarily, we appreciate if you would spread the word about this project with your network of friends and colleagues, or anyone who you think might be interested, via word-of-mouth, social media, or any other medium you choose.  

 

here's a link for cutting and pasting: 

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/lhm-benefit-...

Thank you in advance for connecting us to  new friends, partners and fans, which  is also great support.

THANK YOU!!!!!!!!
story_txt: WHY I AM PRODUCING A BENEFIT CONCERT SERIES The United States Virgin Islands was decimated by two of the most powerful Atlantic hurricanes in recorded history. Yet, this devastation was largely absent from national news reports. Being hit by Hurricanes Irma and Maria within a 12-day period was unimaginable, until it happened. Thousands of our American brothers and sisters lost everything to the 170-plus mph winds and many remain in shelters. Electrical system lie on the ground, destroyed; many poles snapped into pieces like matchsticks. The raging winds burned  green hillsides nearly black – stripping every leaf - and ripped massive trees out by their roots. Heavy rains and storm surge caused mudslides and flooding and mutilated sections of pristine coastline. The Territory’s only two hospitals were damaged beyond repair and many schools have been heavily damaged. story:
We all love Bluegrass!

We love this music so much, don't we? Let's keep it going!

We are so thankful and blessed to have grown up just down the road from Doc Watson in Deep Gap, North Carolina where we all were raised playing and listening to bluegrass. We now spend our time practicing, writing, composing, and performing in hopes of continuing this long tradition of music that we are so honored to be a part of.

If you've seen us perform, or jammed with us, or been in a camp where we've taught, you know our passion for this music and our desire to keep it going. We all love bluegrass and we believe investing in our new album is investing in the future of bluegrass.

If you know us...

After nearly 4 years as a band and through the support of our fans over that time, we are proud of what we've been able to accomplish together with you! We don't have to tell you who we are because you know. 

Three years ago you helped us represent bluegrass and the United States of America as the first band to play bluegrass at the United Nations world music festival in Argentina. Thank you!

A year and a half ago you helped us record our debut album that hit #9 on the Billboard Bluegrass album charts, every track got airplay, and it helped launch our band into a new level performance opportunities. Thank you! 

Now it's time for us to take the next step and put out an album of original music, many of these songs/tunes you've heard in our shows, and we need your help to make it happen!

If you are new to the band...

Just briefly: nearly four years ago we started a musical journey that has grown into a passion that we want to make our future. Each young man in the band plans for a future in the industry.

15-year-old Liam Purcell sings and plays mandolin/fiddle/dobro: Liam is the youngest Wernick Method certified teacher ever, he teaches at camps, he writes lyrics and composes music, he is homeschooled, and wants to one day work in bluegrass playing, teaching, and working behind the scenes in a studio.

18-year-old Tray Wellington plays banjo: Tray is a student in the ETSU Bluegrass Program. You might recognize Tray from his 2-page spread in the 2017 Deering Banjos catalog. Tray has a passion for writing tunes and teaching banjo and hopes to make a career of music. 

20-year-old Eliot Smith plays bass: Eliot is studying to be a luthier with Joe Thrift at Surry County Community College. Eliot has built 5 violins/fiddles so far, a guitar, and is working on his second guitar and a bass. Eliot plans for a future performing and building instruments. 

20-year-old Casey Lewis plays guitar and sings: Casey is from Rocky Gap, Virginia. Casey writes lyrics and composes music. Casey graduated from Wytheville County Community College. Casey teaches in the JAM program as well as private lessons and hopes to make a career of playing and teaching music. 

As a band we've done a lot through the support of our fans. Our debut album hit #9 on Billboard's Bluegrass album charts. We were selected as an IBMA Bluegrass Ramble band for 2017, marking us as an emerging bluegrass band with a sound geared toward the future of the genre. We've played MerleFest, Bristol Rhythm & Roots, Remington Ryde, Bluegrass on the Plains just to name a few of the more than 100 shows we've played from New York to Missouri to Kentucky to Alabama to Pennsylvania to Tennessee to Virginia and throughout the Carolinas...and internationally in Argentina!

Now that you know us, what can you do?

In short, invest in our 2018 album. Times have changed. No longer do big record companies swoop in and fund emerging bands. People don't buy CDs like they used to, so even small record labels are asking bands to help foot the bill for the recording process. After recording, there are additional costs from mixing to mastering to mailings to rights to manufacturing to design to promotion. 

Even though CD sales are down, it is still the industry standard for getting on air, getting booked, and for selling to fans at shows. It is still something we need to do, and want to do to keep the music moving forward. Sure people will stream it for free, but we still have to pay to make this wonderful music we all love called bluegrass!

We depend on those who believe in us and our mission to continue the bluegrass tradition. 

What We Need

We hope to pre-sell $12,000 in CDs and merchandise to fund the recording, production, and promotion of this 2018 album. Here's a rough breakdown of our budget:

  • 25% studio, mixing, mastering, producer
  • 15% manufacturing
  • 15% cost of perks for crowdfunding campaign
  • 10% rights to record cover songs
  • 10% design, cover, inside, art, photography for album and promotion
  • 5% mailing to crowdfunding supporters, DJs, promoters
  • 5% other fees, UPC codes, SoundScan, Nielsen, AirPlay Direct, atVenue, etc.
  • 5% promotion, printing, one-sheets, etc.
  • 5% cost hotel, food, gas to travel to studio for a week
  • 5% to crowdfunding platform - Indiegogo 

Any funds raised above our goal will be used to distribute and promote single releases, record a video, and promote the album at industry conferences. 

Why Now?

It's been a year and a half since we began our last recording project. It was extremely successful in putting us on the map by charting. Now it is time for us to move to the next level by putting our original work out there for the bluegrass world.

We hope to have this album out in the Spring of 2018. We've grown so much since recording our last album. We've added Casey to the band and we believe we are ready to take it to the next level!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about the campaign!
  • Share on social media!
  • Like us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter!
  • Visit us on YouTube or our web page www.canemillroad.com
  • Come see us at a show!

Thank you all so much! We love you! And we can't wait to see what we can do together!

Cane Mill Road

Liam, Eliot, Tray, and Casey

Come see us at a show!

story:
Hi this is David Garza aka Lynx Bigtooth Maple

If you've seen me play and/or sing in Texas, Mexico, North Carolina or Maryland, I'm grateful.  I've honed my craft, made my poetry and am so ready to make this album.

  • I'm originally from Maryland, raised from 12 years old on in Texas, and born in Washington D.C.  I started writing, singing and playing professionally about 20 years ago.  I'm moved by rhythmic guitar playing and poetic lyrics.  I like rhythm and I experiment with it often in both my guitar and my voice.   I've picked up influences from african, arabic, celtic and indian music while remaining true to my own vision.  
  • This campaign is the culmination of years of performing, honing my craft and developing my art.  I've been so moved by so many things in life and written about them.  I feel it's time to get some of the best songs down in a simple album.  The good thing is, I've created a lot of goodwill for myself in San Miguel de Allende, Mexico.  As a result, I have free recording time set up as well as donated cover art work and photography from my generous friends down there.  What I need is money to get down there and record.  And money to set up a website with Bandzoogle so I have place where you can download the album when it's done.  If I raise more than the amount that I need, I'll use it to bring in musicians that I know and trust to add more beauty to my songs. If I raise a lot more, I'll use it to get a nice van, hahahah.  (but really, I will)
  • I think the thing here is mainly that through synchronicity, hard work, goodwill and artistry, I have the opportunity to record a nice album for virtually nothing except the travel and website expense.  I'm grateful for that synchronicity in my life as well as the friends who've encouraged me along the way. In the perks section, I'll break down what each level of donation gets you.  I've kept it simple.  Thanks so much for your time, Lynx
  • Where the money is going:  1. Travel to and from San Miguel.  2. Set up of website.  3.  Bringing in musicians to record.  4.  Incidental studio fees.  5. A van ! (only if I exceed my limit significantly :) )  
  • What I already have:  1.  Free recording time in a friend's professional studio.  (He's the real deal and has recorded AC/DC, Air Supply, movies soundtracks and lot more for a very long time.  I'm lucky to be his friend.)  2.  Free artwork by a renowned watercolor artist who's amazing.  3.  Free photo artwork by a renowned veteran photo-journalist/art photographer formerly of a major city newspaper publication.  
  • If you've ever seen me play and sing, you know I go to another place and my hope is that you go there with me.  My rhythms are infectious and my voice is hypnotic, soothing and moving, or so I've been told numerous times.  I believe it because it still moves me so much, I can't imagine that others aren't moved too.  My approach was gained by studying and working through Julian Cameron's book, The Artist's Way, where I learned simply to get out of the way of the creative impulse and flow with it.   My song's are about beauty, women' rights, synchronistic moments, and of course, love.   Mingling my lyrics with my unique guitar playing style has created something I really enjoy performing.  I still love it to this day.  I've developed my own style, my own voice and my own poetry.  I'm sure you'll love it too.  
  • If I don't reach my donation goals, I'll use the money to set up the website, so when I record, I'll have a place you can get the album from. 
  • What you get at each level.  10 to 25 dollars - a download of the completed album.  100 dollars and above - a download of the completed album and a ticket to one of my album release concerts.  I'll be doing them in both San Marcos, Texas and San Miguel de Allende, Mexico once the album is finished.  I have nice venues lined up in both places and can do more than one concert in each place to accommodate bigger crowds of supporters.   

 

One thing I'm really excited about is my Women's Trilogy, which are 3 songs that came to me about women's rights.  It's past due (about 10,000 years) for women to be at least 50% in charge of the world.

story:
Short Summary

1927 Jubilee: 90th Anniversary Of The Bristol Sessions is a collection of New, Orignal, Unreleased songs by artists from Northeast Tennessee and Southwest Virginia such as Carson Peters & Iron Mountain, Virginia Ground featuring Dave Eggar, Dolly Parton, Tuatha Dea, Richie Owens & the Farm Bureau, 49 Winchester, Bone Feather, Fritz & Co., Julie Williams featuring The Fiddle Scene, Moose Roberts & Th' MonkeyPaws!, Isaac & Laura Mainer and Mary Munsey.

Over 50 different artists recorded over 60 songs, many on the historical dates of July 25th through August 5th and all being recorded and mixed in Bristol, VA/TN, 1927 Jubilee truly celebrates the 90th Anniversary of the Bristol Sessions.

Recorded in the same spirit of Producer Ralph Peer, 1927 Jubilee captures the essence of Bristol's sound 90 years later. This album takes you on a musical journey through time from the first track, "Little Valley" by Isaac & Laura Mainer that sounds much like songs recorded in 1927 by Jimmie Rodgers and The Carter Family, into Dolly Parton's  mountain girl dreaming of "Something More", Virginia Ground's Americana call to the wild in "Fireflies" and finally into the last track on the album, "Anchor" by 49 Winchester that sounds more of a modern Indie Folk and Rock sound of 2017.

When you pledge your support to our project you will be supporting the artists recorded and the rich history of American music that has been inspired by the "Big Bang" of country music in 1927 that is "The Brsitol Sessions". We thank each and every one for their pledge and cannot wait to get your merchandise to you ASAP!!!

story:
Suppose your nose

Was where your elbows goes...

Would you call them SMELLBOWS??

Johnny Shortcake would!

In 2016, Johnny Showcase was offered an artist residency by The Kimmel Center to begin a new artistic venture. Along with invited friends Rumi Kitchen and Ross Bellenoit, we had one singular vision- WRITE HIT SONGS FOR KIDS. Our time together soon poured into an even bigger vision: a fully produced stage show! THE JOHNNY SHORTCAKE SHOW is premiering at The Kimmel Center January 27-28! But we can't stop there... We need to send these songs out into the world with A JOHNNY SHORTCAKE ALBUM!!

The songs of Johnny Shortcake range from dance/funk to jazzy soul, with even a little bluegrass sprinkled in for good measure. Your child will be dancing and singing so hard, they might not notice that the songs:

  • Promote love, acceptance, and collaboration
  • Talk about dealing with feelings
  • Offer a toothbrushing tutorial
  • Encourage silliness and imagination

But you'll notice, and you might also notice that you cant get them out of your head, either. And you'll notice that you are now singing & dancing & laughing together, which are the three greatest things that we can do with the kids in our lives.

Please help us send this vision into the world. Our kids deserve it.

 

What We Need & What You Get

$4,500 will help us finish and print the album.

The remaining $1,500 will help us make our very first video for our hit song SMELLBOWS (omg you have to hear SMELLBOWS). Any money raised above our goal can towards creating more original video content for kids.

Perks!

There are wicked awesome perks to be had, from copies of the cd and coloring posters, to birthday parties appearances and a personalized song for the child in your life!

The Impact

This album, in conjunction with our debut show at The Kimmel Center, is just the first step in bringing smart, silly, and super fun content to the world of kids entertainment. Your contribution will bring these ideas to life! THANK YOU!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out! Please share with others who have kids in their lives.
  • Come see our show at the Kimmel Center January 27-28th.
  • Bring our show to your local libraries, festivals, concert halls, schools and theaters!
story_txt:
Suppose your nose
Was where your elbows goes...
Would you call them SMELLBOWS??
Johnny Shortcake would!
In 2016, Johnny Showcase was offered an artist residency by The Kimmel Center to begin a new artistic venture. Along with invited friends Rumi Kitchen and Ross Bellenoit, we had one singular vision- WRITE HIT SONGS FOR KIDS. Our time together soon poured into an even bigger vision: a fully produced stage show! THE JOHNNY SHORTCAKE SHOW is premiering at The Kimmel Center January 27-28! But we can't stop there... We need to send these songs out into the world with A JOHNNY SHORTCAKE ALBUM!! 
The songs of Johnny Shortcake range from dance/funk to jazzy soul, with even a little bluegrass sprinkled in for good measure. Your child will be dancing and singing so hard, they might not notice that the songs:

Promote love, acceptance, and collaboration
Talk about dealing with feelings
Offer a toothbrushing tutorial
Encourage silliness and imagination

But you'll notice, and you might also notice that you cant get them out of your head, either. And you'll notice that you are now singing & dancing & laughing together, which are the three greatest things that we can do with the kids in our lives.
Please help us send this vision into the world. Our kids deserve it.
 
What We Need & What You Get

$4,500 will help us finish and print the album.
The remaining $1,500 will help us make our very first video for our hit song SMELLBOWS (omg you have to hear SMELLBOWS). Any money raised above our goal can towards creating more original video content for kids.
Perks!
There are wicked awesome perks to be had, from copies of the cd and coloring posters, to birthday parties appearances and a personalized song for the child in your life!

story:
What is Flood?

I'm Claire Michelle, a musician in Seattle, WA and I want to release a flood of singles to raise awareness of transgender musicians, "Enepec" is the first of many.

I, like many trans people, have had to climb my way up from the bottom. When I was 21, I was kicked out of my parents home for my gender. I took it as an opportunity and drove to Seattle where I survived out of my car until I was able to find a place to crash. I've worked incredibly hard these last few years to get to where I am now, and I could really use your help to get to the next step.

When I was coming up here in Seattle, I was overlooked often and I know how hard it is for trans people to even make a dent in their careers; If they're an artist, it's even harder. I want to release so many singles and saturate the market so much that they can't ignore me. By bringing up my own awareness, I can in turn bring up other trans artists as well.

What I Need & What You Get

It costs about $1000 to record a single, $100 to master it, and $400 to pay the members of my band.

As this the first of many IndieGoGo campaigns, by supporting me at the $15 tier you'll be receiving every single single from this era. That's right, every, single, single!

I've also been getting into live streaming quite a bit and I'd really like to share with you what's happening in the studio! The $30 tier will put you on "the list" and you'll see what it is we're recording, and when we're recording it!

If you're a die hard fan, I'd love to send you a physical copy of Flood once all the singles has been released! This may be a while, but no worries, I'll make up for it by printing your name on the cover for eternity! ETERNITY? Yea, that's like, forever.

The Impact

I strongly believe that we can't create an inclusive society for transgender people without social awareness. This single aims to change that. I wrote an Op-Ed specifically about this issue, I encourage you to read it and understand what we can accomplish for trans people by supporting arts.

A critical part of transgender equality is being overlooked. Social activism is being shrouded by political activism, and it’s setting up trans-integration for failure.

At 21, I was kicked out of my house. My step-mom told me shortly before she kicked me out I was setting myself up for a long and difficult life.

It’s clear to see why; my parents had no idea who trans people are. Nothing they saw on the news was positive. It was always about how trans people we’re fighting for rights and never finding equality and acceptance. When trans people finally win a fight, society quickly replaces it with another problem, and the media are on to cover that issue. Trans people are being ignored as capable members of society and are instead being covered for our problems and negative stereotypes.

We may have (arguably) removed the trans stereotype from entertainment media, but the hot political issues all focus on one thing: sex. I’m not talking about the act. I’m talking about biology.

Whether it’s in the bathroom or in the military, both issues come full circle to discuss genitalia and/or the act of transition. Trans people are once again being focused on because of our unique anatomy, while our human qualities are being ignored.

If we are to change the view of transgender people in our society, we must stop focusing on trans people for their transition. The solution to trans acceptance lies with the social activists. The solution to trans equality lies with the political activists.

We are currently focusing on the politics of trans people, and thus creating a lack of acceptance in our quest for social integration. The more we focus on the transitional related issues of trans people, the more the trans community will be treated as outcasts. Political activists ensure trans people are equal in right, while social activists ensure that people respect those rights.

Respect does not come from broadcasting hot issues. Respect comes from acceptance, and acceptance comes from empathy.

With empathy in trans people, we can start shifting the viewpoint of others to agree with a fight for equality. We can start rallying allies and creating an even bigger voice for trans rights.

Art and song help people empathize with the issues trans people are facing, and artistic social activists play a key role in finding empathy through the stories they share, the art they create, and the music they sing.

Social activism makes society aware of trans people in a positive light. By focusing on trans people for their individualism others can relate to trans people. Trans musicians tell stories of their hardships, the things they’ve had to endure and overcome. These stories are not exaggerated by a member of the media, they tell only what the artist has experienced and nothing more.

Songs about overcoming, mourning, love, and friendship are relatable to everyone. Music plays an incredibly important role as an auditory medium in that the listener can only take what they hear. Stereotypes can not exist if you are not aware that the artist playing on the radio is transgender.

With a lack of knowledge on gender, and stories told in a catchy, relatable way, trans musicians, have the ability to challenge the belief of bigotry. Social activists have the power to sway the viewpoint of an unaccepting society.

Yet we as both the media and the trans community are not giving power to those voices that can influence the trend for trans equality. I’m working hard to change that through my music.

Risks & Challenges

To put it simply, without the amount I'm seeking I can't release the song. I'm not going to record anything half-fast as I want to represent myself in a polished way. With that said, by raising only a partial amount I'm going to take the contributions and put them away until I can raise the rest on my own.

Recording these songs is the most important thing to me right now, and I'm going to do it regardless of how long it takes. I'm dedicated and driven beyond belief and I want to create something so great that we as the trans community not only hear it, but feel it's presence reverberate.

It's difficult for me to describe any sort of challenge because the last 3 years of my life have been a challenge. Funding the release of this single will happen, even if I starve myself in the process. Perhaps the biggest risk anyone is facing here is a delayed release date.

I've kept every promise to my fans and I intend to keep them moving forward.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign on Twitter with #GoFlood and tell your friends! Want to help even more, please shoot me an email at claire(at)clairemichellemusic.com and we'll figure some things out!

Thank you for your pledge!

Thank you for your pledge!

story:
We're Back. In Full Gear. Ready to Record.

The past few years have been quite a whirlwind for members of the Icicles. We’ve added several new additions to our families (5 children in 5 years) not to mention multiple job changes. All of these ventures brought on a hiatus for the Icicles. We each spent time figuring out how to juggle family, music and work. And at long last, it’s official. We’re back. In full gear. With an album’s worth of songs ready to be shared with the world. We’ve been busy writing, practicing and preparing to record. Now we need your help to raise enough funds to make this album a reality. Please support us on this endeavor!


Our Plan

We’ve always been a goal-driven band. And big dreamers to boot. With multiple albums under our belt, we know how to get our music recorded and into the Universe. This album will be no exception. Our IndieGoGo goal of $10,000 will allow us to professionally record, mix, master and print our upcoming album. Once the album is complete, we’ll go into full promotion mode to distribute the album to college radio, music supervisors and promoters.

All funds will go towards:

  • Recording

  • Mixing

  • Mastering

  • Printing

  • Promotional materials


Be part of our team!

One of the great things about this campaign is that we will be able to communicate with our supporters throughout the process. You will get to see studio updates, hear some of our material during the recording/mixing process and you’ll be the first to know when the album is complete.

Check out our perks over on the right side of the screen  ------------------------->


Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone can contribute financially. But just as important is spreading the word about this campaign so we can expand our community of support. Please share this campaign with everyone you know!

You can also:

Invite people to Like our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/theicicles

Follow on Twitter: https://twitter.com/theicicles

Check out our website: http://www.theicicles.com/

Thank you so much for your support!


About the Icicles

Hailing from Grand Rapids, Mich., the Icicles are a melodic indie pop ensemble fronted by singer/songwriter/guitarist Gretchen and her longtime musical partner, the ethereal keyboard alchemist Joleen Rumsey. Lead  guitarist Rebecca Rodriguez, who joined for 2007’s Arrivals and Departures, offers an increasingly emphatic reverb-drenched counterpoint to Joleen’s spaced-out sounds. The band was joined on Renegade Parade by a new rhythm section — Zane DeVault and Aaron Ekins (making it a family affair — Zane is Gretchen’s hubby and Aaron is her brother-in-law).

With a new lineup solidified, the Icicles embarked on a period of breakneck creativity, recording Renegade Parade released in 2012. And even with the higher mope factor, the  Icicles did not abandon the spoonful of sugar approach to the bad things in life. As the music turned darker and examined more adult themes, the sounds became more lush and beautiful, at that knife edge where beauty and sadness are joined. The band sounds less self-consciously retro and more au courant.

The Icicles were founded by college pals Gretchen DeVault and Joleen Rumsey (along with original drummer Korrie Ottenwess) in 1999. Following 2001’s Pure Sugar EP, bassist Emily Krueger joined the group. By the time of 2004’s  A Hundred Patterns, founding drummer put away her vintage Rogers drum kit and was replaced by Greg Krupp. That album’s big single “Sugar Sweet” was picked up by Motorola in an international cell phone commercial. That was the Icicles’ first flirtation with the big time.

Next up was 2007’s Arrivals and Departures, which features “La Ti Da” — a tenacious earworm that was used by Target in the mega-retailer’s “Feel the Happy” campaign.

As the Icicles enter their second decade of existence, the group remains a vital creative force. “Just need a space, a place where I can clear my head,” Gretchen sings on “Would You Know.” As the heebie jeebies of adulthood creep up, that space of clarity is still found most easily inside the music.

Tempus Fugit. Time Flies.  Ars longa, vita brevis. Art is long but life is short.

story:
Delhi NCR Food Banking Music Video Project

Delhi NCR FoodBank provides access of nutritional food, water, sanitation and hygiene (WASH), apart from education, health and livelihood interventions to vulnerable children. Implemented by the Responsenet Development Services (RDS), since its inception, the Delhi-NCR Foodbank has served 2 .7 million nutritional meals across 38 feeding centers, galvanizing the support of over 121 companies and 70,000 individuals.

Know more about delhi food banking at http://www.delhifoodbanking.org


The Project - A heart warming Music Video Project

We will be creating humble and candid music video to be shot in some beautiful village, where a set of people (musicians & dancers) go to villages and schools, and play live music with the kids.

The Reach

These videos will be produced for social media platforms such as youtube, vimeo and facebook social shares, with an estimated reach of 3,00,000 to 10,00,000 viewers, it will help create awareness of Delhi Food Banking Organisation, and help promote a link where people can directly donate. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help spread this campaign by sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, or any other means possible.


Production of the Video

Music Video will be produced by speaking pictures entertainment, a team of professional filmmakers. 

Know More at http://speaking.pictures

story:
We are Sit Kitty Sit, the Hard Piano Rock duo from San Francisco, California.  Our dream is to tour the world and make people happy by playing amazing music. In our short five-year-existence we have released three records, three full production music videos, quit our day jobs and toured the United States for the last two years building up an amazing fan base.  


And now, we’re taking a leap we once only imagined:


We’re going to Europe!


We are thrilled to announce that we are teaming up with TJ Concerts and heading overseas.  We’ll be focusing on the Netherlands, Scandinavia, Germany and the UK, and will be overseas for just shy of a month, from mid October to mid November.


This is the big break we’ve been working toward for so long -  but we need to physically GET THERE and with your help, anything is possible.


We are asking for $3,000 to help cover the cost of our round trip plane tickets (because we’re totally coming back… maybe  ;). If we surpass our goal,  we will use the additional funds to cover car and drum kit rental, and to stock up on merchandise before we leave.  


To entice you, we’re offering downloads of our new, previously unreleased tracks; postcards and gifties from overseas, and (if that wasn’t enough) a song written all about you.  Oh yeah.


If we do not hit the full $3,000 we will still put the money toward our plane tickets. Any little bit helps!


Why is this beneficial to you?  You will be supporting independent music and helping us spread our unique creation to an entirely new audience.  Technology has made it super easy for people to write and record music - which is amazing!  But there is a balance to all things.  Easy music means more music.  Which can mean at times those musicians who have studied music since they were mere babies can get lost in the shuffle.  Have you heard the difference?  You’re about to.  And with your much appreciated contribution we can finally “slap some Kitty” onto Europe and continue spreading intelligent music to the stars and beyond.


With your help we kicked ass on our last campaign to raise money to help us pay for the packaging for our 2014 release, Everlasting Fire, when the album turned out too epic for the packaging we budgeted for.  What a fantastic problem!  You know what else is a fantastic problem?  Having to figure out how to get yourself to Europe because you’ve been booked on a month long tour.  These are the best problems ever.  


This trip is not without risk.  We’ll be going into completely unknown territory.  Into countries where we don’t speak the language.  And because clubs there traditionally do not have backlines, we will have to rent a drum kit, which also means renting a car.  Which means Mike gets a whole new medium in which to get a speeding ticket. (Can you get a speeding ticket on the autobahn? Mike will find out.)


But - we are confident.  We have been touring in the US for two solid years.  And have  THIRTY ONE collective years of working in the music industry.  When we were forced to have day jobs Kat ran multi million dollar sales and marketing campaigns and Mike was an accounting whiz.  We got this.


Most of all - we have you.  Our incredible fans.  We are unbelievably grateful for you every single day for inspiring us to continue on this crazy journey.  And we are so happy we have people to turn to when we run into these marvelous roadblocks.


How can you help?  Every one dollar is awesome.  You can also help by spreading the word about this campaign, you can tell your friends about this awesome band you heard about and you totes won’t believe how good they are.  You can add us to your Spotify playlists.  We actually make a few cents every time someone plays our music, so that really helps a lot.  You can follow us on Facebook, or Twitter, or Instagram.  You can read our blog on our Official Website.  You can watch all our crazy adventures on our YouTube channel and maybe subscribe.  You can believe in us and send us good energy.  You can become part of our crazy family.  It’s the best family in the whole world.  


We love you - thank you for reading!

If we surpass our goal,  we will use the additional funds to cover car and drum kit rental, and to stock up on merchandise before we leave.  To entice you, we’re offering downloads of our new, previously unreleased tracks; postcards and gifties from overseas, and (if that wasn’t enough) a song written all about you.  Oh yeah. If we do not hit the full $3,000 we will still put the money toward our plane tickets. Any little bit helps!Why is this beneficial to you?  You will be supporting independent music and helping us spread our unique creation to an entirely new audience.  Technology has made it super easy for people to write and record music - which is amazing!  But there is a balance to all things.  Easy music means more music.  Which can mean at times those musicians who have studied music since they were mere babies can get lost in the shuffle.  Have you heard the difference?  You’re about to.  And with your much appreciated contribution we can finally “slap some Kitty” onto Europe and continue spreading intelligent music to the stars and beyond.With your help we kicked ass on our last campaign to raise money to help us pay for the packaging for our 2014 release, Everlasting Fire, when the album turned out too epic for the packaging we budgeted for.  What a fantastic problem!  You know what else is a fantastic problem?  Having to figure out how to get yourself to Europe because you’ve been booked on a month long tour.  These are the best problems ever.  This trip is not without risk.  We’ll be going into completely unknown territory.  Into countries where we don’t speak the language.  And because clubs there traditionally do not have backlines, we will have to rent a drum kit, which also means renting a car.  Which means Mike gets a whole new medium in which to get a speeding ticket. (Can you get a speeding ticket on the autobahn? Mike will find out.)But - we are confident.  We have been touring in the US for two solid years.  And have  THIRTY ONE collective years of working in the music industry.  When we were forced to have day jobs Kat ran multi million dollar sales and marketing campaigns and Mike was an accounting whiz.  We got this.Most of all - we have you.  Our incredible fans.  We are unbelievably grateful for you every single day for inspiring us to continue on this crazy journey.  And we are so happy we have people to turn to when we run into these marvelous roadblocks. How can you help?  Every one dollar is awesome.  You can also help by spreading the word about this campaign, you can tell your friends about this awesome band you heard about and you totes won’t believe how good they are.  You can add us to your Spotify playlists.  We actually make a few cents every time someone plays our music, so that really helps a lot.  You can follow us on Facebook, or Twitter, or Instagram.  You can read our blog on our Official Website.  You can watch all our crazy adventures on our YouTube channel and maybe subscribe.  You can believe in us and send us good energy.  You can become part of our crazy family.  It’s the best family in the whole world.  We love you - thank you for reading!

story:
Infinite Sound Summary

Click here to go to the Infinite Sound website

Infinite Sound will empower independent musicians and record labels to take control of every facet that makes their art their business while making it easy as possible to do all these things in one place under one log-in, so that they can better support their way of life.

Infinite Sound will also reintroduce a sense of community into the process of discovering new music, and build the community in a way which helps artists find new fans, and provide an incentive to these new fans to tell all their friends about their new discoveries (and not give them away). We want to make the buying process engaging and fun, rather than just another point 'n' click online shopping exercise. To help this process the fans will be financially incentivised by the site to spread the word about the music they love.

In short, the aim of Infinite Sound is to put a bit of soul back into the buying and selling of music.

The dream is to get it as close to this as an online experience can be:

Infinite Sound will be an internet music hub that will provide a solution to the issues that the independent music label, or musician, face when trying to sell their music for a fair price and stay in touch with, and increase, their fan base. It also aims to address the fact that the process of discovering and buying music is not engaging for the consumer.

Streaming may be touted as being king, but it is unfair on those that provide the music, and also unpopular with a small, but still significant, proportion of the music buying public, who want to own music in a high quality format and support those that make it. We also believe that computer algorithms are no way to recommend music, and that a good old-fashioned human recommendation is far superior.


The website will allow Labels/Musicians to:

  • Sell their music directly to the consumer, with no need for them to use aggregators or other digital distributors, while setting their own price for it. The consumer will know that 100% of this price will be received by the Label/Musician.
  • Choose the genre of music they wish to sell under, as well as tag their releases with their own sub-genres.
  • Upload samples of their music that they choose.
  • Have access to real time sales information, and draw down their sales money as and when they want to.
  • Build a network of fans they can communicate with directly and interact with in the way they would on facebook, but this time being guaranteed that all their followers would see their updates. So all the people following them will hear their gig news, or that they have a new release, for example.
  • Not have to worry that they are up against people who buy followers, or plays, as the only stats the site will use will be based on sales.
  • Not have to worry about the new European Union VAT regulations which are targeted at music downloads. Infinite Sound will collect the appropriate VAT on each sale and deal with it in accordance with the regulations.

The website will allow the consumer to:

  • Have their own mini-site, here they can receive updates and news from Labels/Musicians as well as other users they choose to follow.
  • They will be able to list their musical interests, blog/review about music they have bought on Infinite Sound, as well as gigs they have been to of Labels/Musicians they follow.
  • They will be able to link whatever they write to releases on the site, and if another user clicks that link and makes a purchase as a result of doing so, the user that posted the link will receive a slice of the sale in commission, which we will call user ‘credits’. The commission would be repeated for each extra sale. These links will work on external sites as well.
  • Credits can be redeemed against future purchases on the site.
  • Users will have different classes, depending on how much they engage with the site, and how many credits they earn. ‘Super’ users who are prolific reviewers will be easily identifiable within the genres and sub-genres of their interest, and other users will be able to find them and follow them. This will allow users who do not know anyone else on the site to make use of the recommendation/credit system.
  • Users will also be able to make use of highly detailed and filterable sales information in the form of charts and tables of new releases.



What We Need & What You Get

The website is built to a basic level, but we need to spend money on refining the functionality, for example, so that people who buy and share music from new/less well known sources will get a greater reward when their friends and followers also buy it through them than they would if it was a well-known artist. Money will also be spent on web design to make the site look better, and intuitive to use.

We also need to spend as much money as we can on marketing to bring as many artists, record labels and music buyers as we can in order to build the community that will ensure Infinite Sound survives and then thrives.

The money we raise will be split 50/50 between site development and marketing.

As an incentive to provide funding we will be offering a range of Infinite Sound branded merchandising, from t-shirts and hoodies to portable speakers for those who want  to use Infinite Sound to buy music, as well as a range of heavily discounted  offers for those that want to sell it. If you are an artist, or if you run a record label, if you buy our top package then we will pay to advertise your next release on your Facebook fan page in order to help migrate your fans and followers to the same platform your music is actually sold on.

If you buy a two year subscription we will guarantee, as a thank you for your support, this annual price for as long as you wish to use the site.

It is a 'flexible funded' campaign, so if you invest you will get your perk what ever happens. Merchandise will be sent after the campaign has concluded and we know how much to order, but the content perks for musicians and labels can be activated before the end of the campaign. We will contact you within a couple of days of you pledging with the details.


The Impact

We very much believe that this model will result in much time saved for artists and record labels as they concentrate on one platform rather than flipping across multiple sites promoting their music, and all the while the music is not available to buy on any of them. We believe that a greater proportion of the revenue will be received by those that are truly integral to the creation of this art.

We also very much believe that this model will encourage a) consumers to buy music again, as they know they are making a proper economic contribution towards the making of it, and b) making the journey of discovery that is finding new music a more rewarding experience. 

There is so much new music out there it can be over-whelming, but Infinite Sound will be set up to help the cream rise to the top, and to reward those tastemakers that spot the potential in a song, or an act, before the masses do.

 

The Challenge

The challenge is to get the word out to enough people so that we get the critical mass we need to make the site work. The business model makes economic sense for those making and releasing the music only if the site can provide them with an audience. The idea of the site being the place to be to follow your existing favourite artists and labels, as well as to find new ones, needs to be sold to as many people as possible as quickly as possible.

If you are unable to contribute financially but like what we are trying to do, then please share this campaign as far and wide as you can. Thank you.

story:
MONINGA ANNUNCIA IL PRIMO OPEN AIR – FUNDRAISER PER L’OSPEDALE

PEDIATRICO DI KIMBONDO, CONGO.

SABATO 18 E DOMENICA 19 LUGLIO DAI IL TUO CONTRIBUTO BALLANDO SOTTO AL PALCO.



DRINK TO ME, HIS CLANCYNESS,
WOLTHER GOES STRANGERS,
ALTRE DI B, KARPOV NOT KASPAROV,
and many more….


SABATO 18 LUGLIO 2015
DOMENICA 19 LUGLIO 2015

Formigine (MO)

Via per Sassuolo, 6

INGRESSO AD OFFERTA LIBERA

www.moninga.it - www.facebook.com/moningaonlus -


Prima edizione di MONINGA OPEN AIR, due giornate di live, arti e performance che

racchiudono, nella splendida cornice di Villa Benvenuti, dimora storica con ampio parco,

una serie di appuntamenti con la musica indipendente italiana e non solo, impegnata a

raccogliere fondi per l’ospedale pediatrico di Kimbondo.

Si parte con una line up internazionale, capitanata da His Clancyness, ovvero Jonathan Clancy, ragazzo di Ottawa da anni di casa a Bologna. La sua musica è stata definita dream pop, un viaggio veloce attraverso 50 anni di western pop, kraut e cultura psych. Il singolo Summer Majestic, tradotto in immagini dal videomaker Jamie Harley, è stato scelto dalla rivista Rolling Stone come uno dei migliori della stagione passata. Calcherà il palco anche Drink To Me, band di Ivrea tra le più quotate della scena italiana grazie al suo elettro-pop brillante , che presenterà il nuovo album, Bright White Light, uscito ad ottobre per 42 Records. A seguire Wolther Goes Stranger il progetto solista di Luca Mazzieri (già A Classic Education) ora assieme a Massimo "Colla", Linda "Bru" e Stefano Cristi. Dopo il primo disco, "Love Can't Talk", sulla scia comune di un sorprendente cantautorato dance, è appena uscito, "II", ideale per ballare, sudare e amare.

Tra gli ospiti anche Altre di B, una delle realtà più belle e curiose che si sta affermando sotto le Due Torri di Bologna, cinque ragazzi che in pochi anni hanno sviluppato una resistenza da maratoneti, una forza da scalatori, una follia di fondo da combinata nordica: hanno vinto un numero sterminato di concorsi, hanno suonato in America, all'Ypsigrock e allo Sziget, hanno condiviso il palco con chiunque, dai Marta Sui Tubi a Patti Pravo, da Stephen Malkmus a Of Montreal, non disdegnando anche qualche sagra dell'asparago.

Direttamente da Bucarest, un duo amante delle performance sperimentali ed eccentriche, i Karpov not Kasparov. Il duo è nato nel 2009, come una partita di scacchi musicale tra synths e drums, viaggia costantemente tra i ritmi dance di Berlino e le pizzicate classiche di Vienna, passando per le sonorità orientali dell’est Europa, confezionando tracce sofisticate e mai banali.

Nelle line up delle serate anche l’ambient di Harptical e il danzereccio sound di Socialite, direttamente da Milano. Dalla periferia urbana di Modena, due realtà musicali differenti per astrazione sonora e intenti, Lo Twinz e Piet Row.

LINE UP 18/07: WOLTHER GOES STRANGER, ALTRE DI B, HARPTICAL, KARPOV NOT KASPAROV, SOCIALITE
LINE UP 19/07: HIS CLANCYNESS, DRINK TO ME, INUDE, PIET ROW, LO TWINZ.

___________

Moninga, che in lingala significa amico, è un’associazione di volontariato nata a Formigine nel 2015, si ispira a principi laici di civiltà e di educazione delle nuove generazione. Lo scopo sociale dell’associazione è il finanziamento della Fondazione Pediatrica di Kimbondo, un’ospedale pediatrico ed orfanotrofio situato nella periferia di Kinshasa, capitale della Repubblica Democratica del Congo. La Pediatria, costituita alla fine degli anni ’80 dalla dott.ssa Laura Perna come dispensario medico, ha accolto nel corso degli

anni migliaia di bambini. Per i piccoli abbandonati, malati e con disabilità, la Pediatria costituisce tuttora une delle uniche opportunità di vita in un contesto di gravissima povertà come quello congolese. L’orfanotrofio accoglie attualmente circa 800 bambini e l’ospedale è l’unico gratuito nell’arco di centinaia di kilometri.

story:
We want to make music with you.

Lauren Strange & the Pretty Killers are Lauren, Adam, Chad, & Sam. We are pals who love making music. 

Photo by Mary-Beth Blankenship (l to r: Sam, Adam, Lauren, & Chad)


We are self-funded, and have reached a point where we want to take things to the next level -- which means doing things that surpass our financial means as an independent band. We all work day jobs, and put EVERYTHING we have into making music, because we love it! So far we've footed all of the costs for recording, PR, videos, etc. all on our own (and thanks many wonderful friends who have helped us along the way!!). 

NOW we want to give you a new single and a set of music videos, but need YOUR help to make that a reality. We're offering limited edition perks like your own private house show & even one of Lauren's guitars (what?!) for your support. Once these perks expire, they're gone forever, so grab 'em while you can!! 


Other Ways You Can Help

MAKE SOME NOISE. Listen & follow on Spotify (on repeat!). Share with your friends on social networks like Facebook, Twitter, & Instagram. Email your friend who has a similar taste in music and send him a link to our project!

Come see a live show. Be our friend. Be a part of making our dreams a reality.

Thanks for reading this. We love you!

- LS +PK

story:
The Purpose:

 Instead of working with a label I would rather just work with my fans. Help me "Omeil" create the 2nd Studio Album after 10 years.

Info on Omeil and Her Country:

Picture a person who loves doing music more than anything else in the world, but is unable to do the music she want to do coming from a 3rd world country with limited resources. The small island that Omeil is from is a complete mess, from the high crime rate to an economy that is so horrible that the average pay is $11,500 Jamaican dollars per week, which is $127 US dollars, the cost of living is as if you're living in the United States. 

Most people who visit Jamaica go to the North Coast of the island,which is beautiful and setup for tourism, mean while the other side of the island to the South is filled with people who are sleeping in boxes, zinc homes and can hardly survive. Omeil's goal with this new album is to help her country of Jamaica to become a better place and reach as many people as she can impact and help in doing this album. One person cannot change the world, but one person can in fact make a significant change that changes lives for the better.

Figure 1: Shows the Crime stats of 2013 in Jamaica by Parish

:

Figure2: Picture of Omeil's Hometown

Figure 3: What children face in Jamaica just going to school

What Foreigners see when they visit Jamaica:

Figure 4: Picture of the North Cost

Figure 5: Picture of the North Cost with Tourism

What Omeil Needs & What You Get From Omeil

Omeil have watched other musicians use this method and actually succeed, So she decided to give it a try. There are many approaches that can be used to allow fans of music to understand the need, but sometime that is usually missing is, how the funds are spent.

Lets breakdown and and show you how every dollars is spent on this project. Who knows, if Omeil is successful or exceed this goal, Omeil will be able to do things we may have only dreamed about. Essentially, the success of this campaign will determine how amazing this record will become. We are set up for Flex Funding which means if we don't reach our goal, we are still getting the money that is raised. So, if we don't reach our goal, we will have to reevaluate how we are planning to do this record. Regardless, we are ready to deliver this thing however our campaign plays out.


If the goal is reached of the $125,000 US; Omeil goal is to produce an album that allows her to open doors for others in her country.
