2. Kadions by Omeil Sneakers for Men (Colors: Brown or Black)

Omeil's Bio:

Kadion "Omeil" Lewis better known as First Lady Omeil is hailing from Kingston, Jamaica. Omeil execute her first studio album at the age of sixteen with Ms. Terrelonge whom first introduce her to studio life. She was name the first lady as she was the one and only artist at the time and not due her being apart of the Portmore Empire Gaza Team. Yes, Yes, Yes, before Gaza Slim and the others, Omeil was the first and only lady of the Empire of Portmore. Ms.Terrelonge and Vybz Kartel see one common goal in Omeil, the pure talent for the artistry of music and not only as a Sing-jay, but as writer, dancer, great stage performer and growing producer. Currently Omeil is working to be known on an international scale. Omeil looks to become a household name, and she is doing the necessary steps in order to make the second (2nd) studio album a great success.

With the changing Wave of technology and the right infrastructure in place, Omeil sees a light at the end of the tunnel. Having now teamed up again with Ms. Terrelonge again after a 10 year break, the two pack is on a mission to make the second round history renounced. In the past years, Omeil has shared stage with acts such as Mr. Vegas, Gyptian, Christopher Martin, Dexta Daps, Elephant Man, Beenie Man, Sacario, Devonte, Tontrometro, Foxy Brown, Glen Washington, Bounty, Capleton, and Sanchez. Omeil completed a successful northeast College Tour and appearance in the Caribbean Day Parade in Hartford, CT, Summer Jam, Caribbean Jerk Fest, and other countless venues. Her genuine performance displays a unique mixture of Reggae & R&B that was influenced by many legends such as Whitney Houston, Aaliyah, Monica, Beenie Man and even closer to her heart, her grandfather who spent a lot of time and energy in her musical development. Omeil is very involved in her musical career. And with a heart of gold she plans when she get to Billboard to help whom she can to have a future in this glamour hardworking industry that is called entertainment.

Along with the second album, Omeil will be releasing her merchandizing collections of hair extension, Lipstick, sneakers, and tops. Omeil plans to become a true artist in every mean and medium necessary that will allow her to gain the success she needs in order to have an international presence. Click her to visit her online store.

Omeil has worked with producers Delion Reid, Sean Todd, Preston Stuart, and David McFarlane on her debut album "The Reggae Sweetheart" Outside of that she has been on countless riddims and work with Vybz Kartel, Stephen “Di Genius McGregor and other well known Artists and producers. These producers have devoted many years to making music. While each producer has their own unique styles, they all demonstrate diversity with their capability to produce Reggae, R&B, Hip-Hop and more. The team Renee Terrelonge (Management), Track Star (Production), and TwiinTouch ( Writer) has come to together to produce an exceptional display on Omeil's 2nd Studio. Their resumes exhibit production work for some of the most respected artists in the industry such as Shawn Paul, Beenie Man, Lady Saw, Sanchez, Wyclef and Alicia Keys.

Omeil is currently is currently being managed by Longe Magazine & Distribution Inc management division. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends about our 2nd record!
  • Share on twitter, Facebook and Instagram!

 FAQs

  • What sizes are available for the Merchandizing & where do I pick?
    Standard sizes are S-XXL. Prior to shipment we'll send you an email and you'll be able to choose your size.
  • When will the album come out?
    We have not announced a release date as of yet but will communicate that to you at the end of this campaign.
  • When will my stuff ship?
    Just prior to release of the album (see above). Digital copies of the album will be emailed to everyone at least 48 hours prior to official release.
  • How do I pay for the international shipping?
    After clicking "Contribute Now" and selecting your package you can increase the contribution amount in the field above by $10.
  • I forgot to pay $10 for the international shipping!
    No problem, just click "Contribute Now" again and make a contribution that is not for any specific package. Please make sure you make this contribution under the same email address as the original. Thanks!
  • I placed an order and have a question.If you've placed an order you can email omeil@omeil.net. If you have not placed an order please tweet @firstladyomeil or visit the website www.omeil.net and we'll do our best to respond within 4-5 Business days. 

Thank you so much and Nuff love you!!!!!!

- Omeil
story_txt:
The Purpose: Instead of working with a label I would rather just work with my fans. Help me "Omeil" create the 2nd Studio Album after 10 years.Info on Omeil and Her Country:Picture a person who loves doing music more than anything else in the world, but is unable to do the music she want to do coming from a 3rd world country with limited resources. The small island that Omeil is from is a complete mess, from the high crime rate to an economy that is so horrible that the average pay is $11,500 Jamaican dollars per week, which is $127 US dollars, the cost of living is as if you're living in the United States. Most people who visit Jamaica go to the North Coast of the island,which is beautiful and setup for tourism, mean while the other side of the island to the South is filled with people who are sleeping in boxes, zinc homes and can hardly survive. Omeil's goal with this new album is to help her country of Jamaica to become a better place and reach as many people as she can impact and help in doing this album. One person cannot change the world, but one person can in fact make a significant change that changes lives for the better.

story:
What is this?

It's an album!

And hi! I'm a Kristoph, like the movie Frozen, but not because of it.

I look almost exactly like this, but less serious.

Kristoph Gies, trying his hardest to smolder


When I set out to make this album, I wanted to capture the spirit of now. I wanted to express exactly what it's like to be one of those "Millennials" our drunk uncles are always shouting about at family gatherings. I wanted to define our generation and how we defy definition.


Almost a year later (A little more than 9 months, so you could say it's my baby) and here we are. It's written, and it's got music and storytelling unlike anything you've ever seen. A lot of people will tell you something is "unlike anything you've ever seen", but it's a different thing to tell you why. Here's why I believe in this story.

  • These characters are real and raw. Every one is flawed and beautiful--we used dialogue from real conversations, and worked it to fit the actors.
  • The plot is about relevant stuff: How our online presence affects us, how we deal with each other in relationships now that Tinder is around, how we deal with Trolls. No 12-minute numbers about how pretty flowers are.

  • Hailey Young
  • I built this music using rad-sounding Jazz and Neo-Romantic harmonies, while using modern instrumentation (aka pianos, synthesizers, T-swift-like acoustic guitars). You can jam to this---but it's different from the same I-IV-V pop progression they've been using since the 50's. 

  • I wanted to throw stereotypes out the window. So I did. No one takes the path you'd expect them to; the characters calling each other "Bae" turn out to see their relationship deeper than you'd think. No one is a stereotype in real life, why should they be one in fiction?


What We Need & What You Get

Our wonderful sound designer and studio owners, while they are generous and pure of heart, also have to pay the rent. So, we're asking you guys for some assistance, so you can listen to a professional, shiny recording instead of a mix tape some kids made in the garage. But that's not all! 

Da'merius Ford,  another excellent co-star

Your contribution also goes towards getting the word out about this revolution in music storytelling, and making it even better. With enough funds, we are hoping to make some rad music videos (we've even got a few exciting partners lined up we want to work with), and do extra stuff for our fans. There's really no limit on how much of an impact we can make.


So what are you trying to do here?

Living in the 21st century, we get a lot of images pushed on us. Be pretty, be perfect, be thin, be strong. 
"You're a white girl, of course you drink Starbucks."
"You're black, of course you play basketball."
"You're fine. Get over it."
We're trying to fight against all the negative energy coming at us on a daily basis. We're portraying what it's really like to live now. We're sending a message that it's okay to be who you are, and even though popular media might try to define you on one shallow characteristic, you are so much more.

The Plot

Disturbed by countless tragedies that have shocked the nation, the Queen of the Internet calls upon her boyfriend the King (who is much more popular; think Pewdiepie or dude Jenna Marbles) to speak out against violence and hate, and endorse a certain exciting candidate for president. The King doesn't disagree, but thinks it makes no difference what he says either way. 
So begins the Queen's fight to save the world, which turns out far messier--and bloodier--than she intended.

The Cast



Kristoph Gies--The King

Kathleen Mitchell--The Queen

Hailey Young--Yvette

Da'Merius Ford--Darius



Gabe Lasley--Allen


Anonymous--G

with

Michael Alexander

Jake Louis

Tomas Escarpita


Sounds awesome, what now?

We're recording during July, and the finished album will be released August 10th! With your help, we can make some awesome stuff to go along with it, as well as 

  • Paying our lovely sound designer
  • Getting the word out
  • Music Videos
  • Possible Live Version

Thank you guys so much for being here. It really does mean a lot to me, as you can tell. This project has been what I get up in the morning and get to bed late for. When it's released, with your help, it'll all be worth it.

story:
Jimmy Shand was world renowned as player, composer, band leader and innovator. Less well known is that he was also a discerning collector of old music books.

Friends of Wighton bought The Jimmy Shand Collection at auction and we are now raising money to have the volumes conserved so they can be used by musicians, scholars and the community.

To bring the music off the page and into life and to celebrate the works being made available we’ll run, in Dundee, Angus and Fife, a series of concerts, ceilidhs and workshops under the title The Sir Jimmy Shand Connection.

We would like to thank Jimmy Shand jr and all the Shand family for their support of this project.


THE FULL STORY...

A multi-disciplinary project to conserve and bring back to life the collection of  rare old Scottish music books from the collection of the late Sir Jimmy Shand,  preserving and presenting rarely heard treasures of old  Scottish music in live concerts and online.

The purpose built Wighton Heritage Centre, in Leisure and Culture Dundee's Central Library, is home to the internationally important Wighton Collection of old Scottish music books, mostly dating from the 18th and early 19th centuries, which was left to the people of the city by merchant, musician and collector, Andrew James Wighton.  The Centre also houses other important music books and collections donated over the last 150 years.

To preserve, protect, and raise awareness of this wonderful resource, the Friends of Wighton group was formed in 2006.  As well as having successfully raised funds to enable rarer parts of the Wighton Collection to be microfilmed, the group has brought the Collection to life through education and performance.  Monthly Lunchtime Recitals and Cappuccino Concerts are held in the acoustically excellent Centre, also the home for weekly classes in Scots song, Gaelic song, fiddle, whistle and clarsach. Larger events and dances take place on board the Frigate Unicorn.

It is very much our ethos that the Wighton Collection and the Wighton Heritage Centre belong to the community and ticket prices and class fees are kept at a modest level to encourage wide participation.  Our students range in age from 6 to 79.  We also give workshops and performances in local schools, day centres, care homes and community centres.  Admission to our Lunchtime Recitals is free.  This event and our monthly Cappuccino Concert are very popular, particularly with those who for reasons of age, infirmity, transport or other reasons find it difficult to attend an evening concert.

In 2013, Friends of Wighton successfully bid at auction for 23 music books of the 18th, 19th and early 20th centuries which were in the personal collection of the late Sir Jimmy Shand, the world famous accordion player and band leader who lived and worked in Dundee for many years.  The books include a first edition of Niel Gow’s “A Collection of Strathspey Reels” c.1785 which is bound with several other collections of interest,  “Music for Harpsichord – Selection of Scottish Airs” with material by  Urbani and others, Balfour’s “Ancient Orkney Melodies” and an original “Gesto Collection”, as well as other items of musical and historical interest.  Possibly the most fascinating of all are several manuscript books from the Brechin area which date from the late 18th and early 19th Century.  These volumes of handwritten notation give a unique insight into the musical life of Angus at that time.


Because of their age, and their varying histories, most of the books require conservation work before they can be made available for use by musicians and scholars and put on display in the Centre.

As conservation of each volume is completed we intend to celebrate by having, as appropriate, workshops and a concert, recital or dance based on its music and/or song.  

The venues will be mainly the Wighton Heritage Centre and Frigate Unicorn but others in Angus, Perthshire or Fife may be used where there is a strong local connection.  

The core group of artists will be the current Wighton Centre tutors, who include Gaelic singer Wilma Kennedy, Scots singers Amy Lord and Sheena Wellington, whistle player Helen Forbes, fiddle player Karen Hannah and historical harpist Simon Chadwick.  They will be augmented by our excellent local musicians including harpsichordist Mark Spalding, singer Barbara Dymock, piper Kyle Howie, accordionist Luke Brady and guitarist Paul Campbell and guest artists such as Sandy Brechin, Gavin Marwick and Bruce Davies, high profile performers renowned in their field and with a large following.

When the volumes have undergone conservation they will take their place in the Wighton Heritage Centre and be available for study and use by musicians and researchers as well as the community in general.

We are asking you to help raise £5000. But this is just the start! The conservation alone will end up costing over £7000. But we are keen to get started with the work on the most fragile books, and get the concerts and events series up and running. We look forward to welcoming you as part of this great project!

Thanks to Kevin McGinley for making our video!
story_txt:
Jimmy Shand was world renowned as player, composer, band leader and 
innovator.  Less well known is that he was also a discerning collector 
of old music books.  

Friends of Wighton bought The Jimmy Shand Collection at 
auction and we are now raising money to have the volumes conserved so 
they can be used by musicians, scholars and the community. 

To bring the music off the page and into life and to celebrate 
the works being made available we’ll run, in Dundee, Angus and Fife, a 
series of concerts, ceilidhs and workshops under the title The Sir Jimmy Shand Connection.  

We would like to thank Jimmy Shand jr and all the Shand family for their support of this project. THE FULL STORY...A multi-disciplinary project to conserve and bring back to life the collection of  rare old Scottish music books from the collection of the late Sir Jimmy Shand,  preserving and presenting rarely heard treasures of old  Scottish music in live concerts and online.The purpose built Wighton Heritage Centre, in Leisure and Culture Dundee's Central Library, is home to the internationally important Wighton Collection of old Scottish music books, mostly dating from the 18th and early 19th centuries, which was left to the people of the city by merchant, musician and collector, Andrew James Wighton.  The Centre also houses other important music books and collections donated over the last 150 years.To preserve, protect, and raise awareness of this wonderful resource, the Friends of Wighton group was formed in 2006.  As well as having successfully raised funds to enable rarer parts of the Wighton Collection to be microfilmed, the group has brought the Collection to life through education and performance.  Monthly Lunchtime Recitals and Cappuccino Concerts are held in the acoustically excellent Centre, also the home for weekly classes in Scots song, Gaelic song, fiddle, whistle and clarsach. Larger events and dances take place on board the Frigate Unicorn. But this is just the start! The conservation alone will end up costing over £7000. We look forward to welcoming you as part of this great project!Thanks to Kevin McGinley for making our video!

story: Hi Friends and Family, we are excited to share with you all that we started a company this year. Voski Music Group was started in early 2015, we are an artist management company based in Los Angeles, CA. Voski is currently in the beginning phase and in need of support. We are confident and excited with our growth potential. Our dynamic artists and strong leaders in the company give us the confidence to drive ahead in the industry. Since starting we have made amazing connections and have a great network of producers, writers, artists and industry contacts.  We are hoping to get the support of our nearest and dearest to help us fund a few exciting projects, which I am sure you will all enjoy upon completion. Thank you in advance for your support and we hope that you are all well!

story:
AtlantaFest Re-Launches in 2016

Summer 2016 marks the 30-year anniversary of AtlantaFest, and it’s returning with plans and an artist line-up that is bigger and better than ever before. The three-day festival has featured top names in Christian music each year, recently including TobyMac, Lecrae, Newsboys, Switchfoot, and a long list of other headliners.

AtlantaFest is returning under new ownership by Dr. Chris Leader, founder of Ignite Outreach and President of Food Aid International and Kids Against Hunger, and Jeffery Wall, founder of The Lighthouse Events and the RiverRock Music Festival. Dr. Leader has worked in ministry and international missions for over 10 years. Mr. Wall has worked for over 20 years in Christian Radio and concert promotion, including over 450 concerts throughout the Northeast.

AtlantaFest is scheduled June 16-18, 2016, keeping its signature date in early June. Tickets will go on sale August 1. The venue and core artist line-up will be announced that day, as well. "I’m excited to be part of carrying on the tradition of the South’s oldest and largest music festival," said Jeffery Wall. "We’re looking forward to building upon the heritage of AtlantaFest and producing a strong line-up for 2016 – one certainly fitting for the 30th anniversary of the festival."

We Need Your Help

In order for AtlantaFest to successfully re-launch in 2016, we need your support!  As we are scheduled to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the festival, we need the financial support of those eager to see AtlantaFest continue to reach thousands with the Gospel of Christ in the years to come!

What We Need:

  • To re-launch on June 16-18, 2016, we need to raise $50,000!
  • Your gift of any amount allows AtlantaFest to continue using Christian music to minister to thousands every year!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help!

  • Help us spread the word about re-launching AtlantaFest on Facebook and Twitter!
  • Encourage your friends to join you in supporting this ministry!
  • Visit atlantafest.com for updates on the festival!

Thank You!

Thank you for partnering with AtlantaFest in proclaiming the Gospel and building the kingdom through Christian music! Whether you donate $5 or $500, you are taking part in reaching the world with the eternity changing message of Jesus!

story:
Deanna's Needs

The artist development process is rather expensive, especially for a young lady living on a small island like Anguilla. Deanna's raw talent is undeniable and she's certainly an island favourite. However, to win X Factor UK and fulfill her dreams of sharing her music, voice and brand throughout the world, there's more artist development work to be done. Below are some of the costs that Deanna will be putting your much needed contributions towards.

Travel Costs

  • Flights
  • Hotels
  • Meals
  • Living expenses
  • Ground transportation

Artist Development Costs

  • Performance coach
  • Vocal coach
  • Dance coach
  • Styling & clothing
  • Hair & make-up
  • Social media development & marketing

 

Deanna In Her Element

story:
Hi everyone!

My name is Vasko Mladenov and I make music, mostly Rap and R'n'B. Since I started rapping in 2009, I have recorded and published 3 studio albums and I'm currently finishing work on my upcoming 4th album. You can listen to my previous album, called "VNY3" if you click on the link below:
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjhAuimn...

Since the life of a pro tennis player is hitting hard on one's wallet, I've been struggling to find money in order to record my album, and this is why I will need your help.


Currently, my goal is to record my fourth studio album, which I believe will sound way better in terms of music and a few new things, which I have never done before will appear there, for example:
1- recorded live instruments
2- I will sing in many songs, other than rapping
I am more than sure that a great quality product will be produced after the work is done
In order to achieve this goal though, I need your help! Recording a full album will cost me $7000. This sum will cover all the studio expenses needed, such as vocal recording, arrangement enhancement, recording live instruments, mixing and mastering.
In order to show my gratitude I will send special gifts and items, that have to do with the album to those of you, who help me fund this project. Also, I will be posting videos and live streams from the studio so you can see how the process is going and take part in it!
Last, but not least, I promise you that the product will be top quality and I truly hope that you will be able to confirm my promise in the near future!

 

Всем привет!

 

Меня зовут Васко Младенов, я пишу музыку и тексты песен как себе, так и на заказ. Начиная с 2009-го года издал 3 студийных альбома в стиле рэп и уже заканчиваю работу над четвёртым. Вы можете послушать мой свежий альбом под названием "VNY3" по этой ссылке:

http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLjhAuimnL...

Моя цель на данный момент – запись в марте моего четвёртого альбома, который, на мой взгляд, будет звучать намного богаче, интереснее и разнообразнее в плане музыки, а также ещё глубже и более замысловато в плане лирики. В процессе записи планирую две вещи, которых раньше не делал:

1) запись живых инструментов;

2) запись мелодичного вокала (местами буду петь).

Уверен, что продукт получится очень качественным не только в музыкальном, но и в литературном аспекте.

Как гласит известная русская поговорка, один в поле не воин. И это действительно так! Чтобы реализовать этот проект – запись альбома – мне также будет нужна помощь, ваша помощь. Ведь эти песни я записываю для ВАС, слушатели, для того, чтобы ВЫ смогли услышать то, что я хочу донести в своих песнях. Если бы я это делал только для себя, мне бы даже не нужно было ничего записывать.

Поэтому я обращаюсь к вам.

На полноценную запись альбома понадобится сумма в $7,000 до марта. В неё входит всё: обработка заранее написанных мною аранжировок в студии, запись живых инструментов и вокала, сведение и мастеринг.

В знак благодарности за вашу помощь я приготовил вам специальные подарки, которые каждый, кто помог этому проекту, получит от меня. Ниже вы сможете ознакомиться с этим подробно.

Кроме подарков, я буду скидывать в интернет видео и прямые трансляции из студии, чтобы вы смогли поучаствовать в процессе создания этого проекта комментариями и идеями!

Обещаю, что продукт получится отличным, и надеюсь, в ближайшем будущем вы сможете сами в этом убедиться!

story:
Short Summary

I have been working hard on developing a full-length album, which will be entitled “TRANSCEND THE SKIES”. However, in order to see this album completed within the year, I am going to need some help - and that is where you come in.

What We Need & What You Get

I have estimated the basic costs at $5,000. The official album launch may happen the beginning of 2018.

All the funds raised for this project will be going completely towards studio expenses, mixing, mastering, art, CD manufacturing, and packaging of all the products.

In order to raise the funds I need for this project, I put together pre-order packages with lots of cool gear and exclusivities!

Please pre-order one of my exclusive packages I have put together for you in advance! I have incredible packages and some fun limited experiences for you all.

The Impact

The impact of your early contribution is huge, as it all goes directly towards the production of my debut album, impacting the quality and success of this album. The ability to write meaningful and powerful songs and getting my music out into the world is all contingent on the amount of backers I have. The more of you that order the rewards, the more resources I have to put back into this record to make it phenomenal.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a spot to contribute to the production of this record, you can still help! The best way is by sharing this campaign via email and social media using the IndieGoGo Share Tools by the "BACK IT" button the top of the page!

story:
Dear Friends and music lovers:

We live in a world where silence has been lost. We live in the constant search for social acceptance, and our universe revolves around social networks. How can we talk about what is happening today in the world, if we do not know what is happening within us? We do not know our hearts, natures, and potential, and most of us are too afraid to confront our true selves. This work: Experiential and Indeterminate Songs, Op. 9 (Experimentelle und unbestimmte Lieder Op. 9) is a call to silence, to the exploration of our inner processes, and to the search for fullness.

About the Concert:

Our show will have two formats:

1. Concerts:

which will present the complete musical cycle Op. 9 (voice, piano, and synthesizer)

2. Performance (Art + Music + Exhibition)

The complete Cycle Op. 9, accompanied by the artwork of painter Maestro Jorge Posada. A captivating performance in an unconventional dark industrial site, where Ms. Hippert plunges us into an inner journey, while dialoguing in the darkness of the master's paintings.

Whispers I (Oil on canvas 78x62 inches)

Support our music and our performance:

Please help us to bring this music and this message to different stages in NYC. We strongly believe that music is a powerful tool in the social transformation and with your donation, it will be possible to present this project in different venues and spaces. No matter the value, your donation will help our independent label IGM to continue its commitment to excellence, discourse, and support for new artists and new visionaries. Help us continue to promote new concert proposals, new artists, and new ideas.

Below you will find detailed information about the music, the artists, the notes of the album by musicologist Susan Campos, and the relation of our work with the art of the painter Jorge Posada.

Thank you very much for your attention and generosity.

IGM team

Cycle Op. 9 | Introduction by composer Julián de la Chica:

Experimentelle und unbestimmte Lieder op. 9 Experiential and Indeterminate Songs, Op. 9 is a cycle for voice, piano, and synthesizer, inspired by reflections and experiences that I have had through the years, from which I began to consciously construct a spiritual interior life. I explore the sound of the interior voice that speaks to us in our daily intimacy, a voice that questions and challenges us. A voice that is conditioned by the world and its egos. The system.

Distanced from a religious vision, apologetic and ascetic, I work with processes that in my personal opinion have helped me in attaining self-knowledge, acceptance, and finally, plenitude. It is a method based in the Buddhist meditation Vipassana, whose process of self-purification is realized through self-observation.

I propose the search for individualism not from a moral egotist perspective, but from the perspective of becoming part of a collectivity that saturates and critiques us. We know ourselves, re-cognize ourselves, re-discover ourselves when we decide to live freely. This brings us to a deep and raw understanding of our misery. We walk completely alone in the darkness. In the coherence of consciousness, we define ourselves and evolve.

 

 

Exploring the silence, a theme that composer John Cage questions and proposes in his work, is a process that I feel is necessary and vital in our existence and creative experience. In accordance with this reflection, minimalism, as a musical proposal, brings me closer to this experience. Discovering who we are, deciding to accept ourselves, and live in the plenitude of the coherence of consciousness that governs our actions and words is an ideal in the daily process of survival. The cultivation of the spirit invites us to traverse an intimate path in solitude that brings us the fullness of interior peace, a state that should not be confused with “false comfort” or a harmonious appearance that is governed by sociological protocols or canons.

The interior path, then, helps us to construct a global and objective vision of our being. It helps us in a concrete manner to endure situations and experiences, to never lose perspective, and in the final state, to experience peace, enjoyment, plenitude, including in the most vulnerable moments of our spirits, of our dark nights.

 

 

Jorge Posada and the Cycle Op. 9

"I met Maestro Jorge Posada thanks to a great friend who bought one of his works. When she brought me to his studio I was mesmerized by his art, specially his artwork Silent Witnesses. it was if I had glimpsed the Cycle op. 9 on canvas. Maestro Posada has the ability of seeing inside of us; he knows our misery, our glories, and his paintings are the radiography of them." - Julián de la Chica.

"The human figure, from the beginning of my career, has a very important role. Sometimes I depict it in a very realistic manner others only as a blurry suggestion of a human form but, always with the same intrinsic intention of exploring its qualities as a vehicle of formal expression. I prefer to establish a visual dialogue that ideally creates a communion of feelings and emotions between the public and my work." - Jorge Posada.

Jorge Posada + Info:

www.saatchiart.com
www.jorgeposada-art.com
www.facebook.com/posadastudiogallery

Add to the musical experience and get a an original painting by maestro Jorge Posada.

Please, check in the right site all the perks, and see below the artworks available.

Perk $300 - 5 pieces available.

Series Fragmenting Rubens (print enhanced by hand in watercolor 15x11 inches)

 

 

 

 

 

Perk $700 - 4 pieces Available

Movement XIII (oil on canvas 16x12 inches)

Movement XIV (oil on canvas 14x11 inches)

Movement XV (oil on canvas 12x12 inches)

Movement XVI (oil on canvas 10x10 inches)

 

Perk $1,000 - 6 pieces available.

Bodies (Oil on paper 20x28 inches)

Bodies II (Oil on paper 20x28 inches)

Movement II (Oil on canvas 16x20 inches)

Movement III (Oil on canvas 16x20 inches)

Movement XI (oil on canvas 24x20 inches)

Movement XII (oil on canvas 24x20 inches)

 

Perk $3,000 - 2 pieces Available

Exodus Zone of Silence (oil on canvas 28x24 inches)

Sacred Body Series (Oil on canvas 30x24 inches)

Perk $20,000 Silent Witnesses XVII 1 piece

(Oil on canvas 78 X 62 inches)

Note: please note that private concerts will be done in NY's metropolitan area; a piano will have to be provided. Travel fees will add to concerts outside NY. Artwork by maestro J. Posada can be picked up at his studio in LIC, NY. Other arrangements can also be made with the buyer. 
For more information please write to us at info@irreverencegroupmusic.com. CD's: U.S shipping is inclueded.

Album Notes by Dr. Susan Campos-Fonseca

“Minimalism means concentration” - Anton Batagov (2016)
“Remove, remove and remove until only the essential is left.” – Eduardo Chillida

How does Julián de la Chica materialize the question of “being” in sound? Through text and music as sound material: the choice of the German tongue as a philosophic language; in its sonority, the reference to the tradition of Lieder, a form where word and sound construct a system of meanings in search of the essential. Materializing it through sound, the works achieve this “concentration” of the essential, guided by the question of the “being.”

But, how do they achieve it? Long phrases, almost Gregorian rhythmicity, recuperate the capacity for enunciation born of medieval liturgical chant and Buddhist mantras. The concentration of power in the invoked words – to enunciate is to make real what is invoked. The essence is enunciated in the concept, in the construction of the enunciations that constitute the exoskeleton of these songs. The sound materializes the concept; it is sound that creates reality. The sound is in the center of the congealed hurricane. A person that asks the question of “being”, stops time. Their presence is now; only the now exists. That instant is nonetheless a whirlwind that in the meditative act stops in front of the asking person and contemplates their mortal state, unappealable: the state of mortality as illumination.

Piano and synthesizer induce vision.The compositional technique of the author is almost sculptural, tuning in with Eduardo Chillida: “Remove, remove and remove until only the essential is left.” In this way, it achieves what Anton Batagov (2016) summarizes in a sentence: “Minimalism means concentration.”

Rachel Hippert weaves an ontological experience with her voice. The soprano understands the underlying magma underneath the Gregorian tradition, mantra, and Lieder at the conceptual level. Her work is rigorous, contained and subtle.The dissonance between her voice and the sculptural piano and synthesizer can materialize flashes of something seen for only a moment.

The voice is a hologram of the sonic imagination, of the intellectual process of Rachel Hippert. “The quiet and still persists," Mr. Chillida wrote. In times like ours, where speed and media urgency seem to demarcate thought and creation, she stops, and with her voice, shows the density of space. Ms. Hippert seems to explore the quality that Mr. Chillida imagined in his sculptures: “I want my works to be still and quiet, the only way of escaping in part the influence of time.”

www.facebook.com/irreverencegroupmusic


www.Rachelhippert.com
www.facebook.com/rachelannehippert


www.Juliandelachica.com
www.facebook.com/Juliandelachica
story_txt: Dear Friends and music lovers:We live in a world where silence has been lost. We live in the constant search for social acceptance, and our universe revolves around social networks. How can we talk about what is happening today in the world, if we do not know what is happening within us? We do not know our hearts, natures, and potential, and most of us are too afraid to confront our true selves. This work: Experiential and Indeterminate Songs, Op. 9 (Experimentelle und unbestimmte Lieder Op. 9) is a call to silence, to the exploration of our inner processes, and to the search for fullness.About the Concert:Our show will have two formats:1. Concerts:which will present the complete musical cycle Op. 9 (voice, piano, and synthesizer)2. Performance (Art + Music + Exhibition)The complete Cycle Op. 9, accompanied by the artwork of painter Maestro Jorge Posada. A captivating performance in an unconventional dark industrial site, where Ms. Hippert plunges us into an inner journey, while dialoguing in the darkness of the master's paintings.Whispers I (Oil on canvas 78x62 inches)Support our music and our performance:Please help us to bring this music and this message to different stages in NYC. We strongly believe that music is a powerful tool in the social transformation and with your donation, it will be possible to present this project in different venues and spaces. No matter the value, your donation will help our independent label IGM to continue its commitment to excellence, discourse, and support for new artists and new visionaries. Help us continue to promote new concert proposals, new artists, and new ideas.Below you will find detailed information about the music, the artists, the notes of the album by musicologist Susan Campos, and the relation of our work with the art of the painter Jorge Posada.Thank you very much for your attention and generosity.IGM teamCycle Op. 9 | Introduction by composer Julián de la Chica:Experimentelle und unbestimmte Lieder op. 9 Experiential and Indeterminate Songs, Op. 9 is a cycle for voice, piano, and synthesizer, inspired by reflections and experiences that I have had through the years, from which I began to consciously construct a spiritual interior life. I explore the sound of the interior voice that speaks to us in our daily intimacy, a voice that questions and challenges us. A voice that is conditioned by the world and its egos. The system.Distanced from a religious vision, apologetic and ascetic, I work with processes that in my personal opinion have helped me in attaining self-knowledge, acceptance, and finally, plenitude. It is a method based in the Buddhist meditation Vipassana, whose process of self-purification is realized through self-observation.I propose the search for individualism not from a moral egotist perspective, but from the perspective of becoming part of a collectivity that saturates and critiques us. We know ourselves, re-cognize ourselves, re-discover ourselves when we decide to live freely. This brings us to a deep and raw understanding of our misery. We walk completely alone in the darkness. In the coherence of consciousness, we define ourselves and evolve.  Exploring the silence, a theme that composer John Cage questions and proposes in his work, is a process that I feel is necessary and vital in our existence and creative experience. In accordance with this reflection, minimalism, as a musical proposal, brings me closer to this experience. Discovering who we are, deciding to accept ourselves, and live in the plenitude of the coherence of consciousness that governs our actions and words is an ideal in the daily process of survival. The cultivation of the spirit invites us to traverse an intimate path in solitude that brings us the fullness of interior peace, a state that should not be confused with “false comfort” or a harmonious appearance that is governed by sociological protocols or canons.The interior path, then, helps us to construct a global and objective vision of our being. It helps us in a concrete manner to endure situations and experiences, to never lose perspective, and in the final state, to experience peace, enjoyment, plenitude, including in the most vulnerable moments of our spirits, of our dark nights.  Jorge Posada and the Cycle Op. 9"I met Maestro Jorge Posada thanks to a great friend who bought one of his works. When she brought me to his studio I was mesmerized by his art, specially his artwork Silent Witnesses. it was if I had glimpsed the Cycle op. 9 on canvas. Maestro Posada has the ability of seeing inside of us; he knows our misery, our glories, and his paintings are the radiography of them." - Julián de la Chica."The human figure, from the beginning of my career, has a very important role. Sometimes I depict it in a very realistic manner others only as a blurry suggestion of a human form but, always with the same intrinsic intention of exploring its qualities as a vehicle of formal expression. I prefer to establish a visual dialogue that ideally creates a communion of feelings and emotions between the public and my work." - Jorge Posada.Jorge Posada + Info:www.saatchiart.comwww.jorgeposada-art.comwww.facebook.com/posadastudiogalleryAdd to the musical experience and get a an original painting by maestro Jorge Posada.Please, check in the right site all the perks, and see below the artworks available.Perk $300 - 5 pieces available. story:
Who Am I?

My name is Josh Putnam, a Minnesota-born Oregonian, here in the beautiful Willamette Valley. I am recording a full length worship album filled with pictures of Jesus and moments that I hope will remind us of how real He is.

My passion is to see the people worship without holding back. Worship is simple, it's all about Him regardless of my feelings in the moment, He is always good. I want to see the church unite around the banner of Jesus and give Him praise. I believe this is the year of breakthrough. I believe we are entering a season where the lines that previously divided the church begin to fade. I believe the church will become ONE again and I believe that that will happen when we worship together. Jesus simply deserves the highest praise. Enough said!

More About This Projects

The costs to record a full length record are not insignificant. I will be recording for one month and the month after is dedicated to mixing and mastering. This costs about $10,000.

I'm also renting a venue in Portland, OR where I am having my CD release (July 2017) and a HUGE worship night (more about that in updates to come)! There will be about $5,000 dedicated to this event where I will be renting a public music venue, hiring a band, videographer and several other production costs. My goal is to fill this venue with believers from all different denominations to worship Jesus together and I am SO excited about this night.

If this project gets you excited or you feel inspired by some of the songs I'll be giving away throughout the campaign, please share what I'm doing on your favorite social media page, it helps so much!

Thank you to everyone who has helped me already, given me huge chunks of money (you know who you are), offered your help during the planning stages, and last but not least, brought an encouraging word as I step into what I know the Lord is calling me to do.

Thank You Friends!

'This is My Jesus' FREE DOWNLOAD LINK:
 https://joshputnam.bandcamp.com/track/this-is-m...

story:
The Project 

  • Growing up in Huntly, I've been exposed to the singing of tradition bearers from a young age through competitive ballad singing. With a passion for folksong in all its forms, I aim to keep the songs of North East singers alive, but showcase them in a fresh and innovative way. I am a student of the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland and I perform in the North East vernacular, Doric.  

  • In 2016, I released a self-funded EP, East (I'm now poor!), played at lovely venues and had a trip out to Italy with my band. I plan to record my debut album this year and release it on the 16th January 2018. But because I'm a full time student, I am disqualified from applying to most art funds.
  • I hope to fund the entire album to pay for musicians, studio hire, production, mixing and mastering, design and artwork, duplication, licensing, PR, promotional materials, video to name a few costs. It all adds up. Anything donated helps to make this happen! Albums are costly - £9000 is the minimum that they can be made for, but I'd like to raise as much as possible.

Stay Connected

Follow me on Facebook Twitter Bandcamp   Soundcloud     www.ionafyfemusic.com           Subscribe to mailing list

Song Preview 

Rewards!
  • Digital and physical copies of the album 2 months before release as well as digital downloads of my previous EP, East. Different bundles for those of you with different tastes! Folksinger, Artist and Musician bundles with posters, songbooks, exclusive research notes, set list and chord charts!
  • Skype and physical lessons, bundles, house concerts and album credits up for grabs! And I will even learn and record a song of your choosing especially for you! (Have fun...) 

My Work

Since moving to Glasgow, I've been working with some wonderful musicians to bring songs to life! The line-up of the band features singer and guitarist Luc McNally, fiddler Charlie Grey, bassist Callum Cronin, and piper Ross Miller. The album will be produced by the wonderful Jani Lang of Dallahan. But there just might be some guest musicians...

I look forward to playing at lots of North East festivals such as Stonehaven and Portsoy as well as clubs and festivals doon sooth such as Herga, Sark, Lewes, Haddenham and St Albans. This year we have competed in BBC Radio 2 Young Folk Award and are finalists in the Hands up For Trad Battle of the Folk Bands 2017!

Check out my 2017 dates! www.ionafyfemusic.com/events 

Performing at the BBC Radio Scotland Young Traditional Musician of the Year Final 2017

In the Press

Check out what has been said about my first EP, East

  • “Iona’s voice displays incredible confidence and maturity… Even without accompaniment, Iona’s voice is as finely tuned, precise and eminently enjoyable an instrument as you’ll find… Utterly haunting.”    – Folk Radio UK 

    “From unaccompanied voice to the band in full-flow, ‘East’ stands as a testament to the strength, endurance and adaptability of the tradition.”  – FolkWords

    “When it comes to folk music, she has one of the most stunning voices on the circuit today.” – Artree

Check out full reviews here: www.ionafyfemusic.com/reviews

Risks & Challenges

  • Creating an album costs a lot, but creating a great album which you are confident with and proud of costs even more and renders a greater financial risk! I want to give this a real good go and create a concept album which reflects my passion for tradition and innovation and which pays homage to the singers who have influenced me. To do that, I need as much support as I can get! Anything that is donated is appreciated in every way and in return, there’s a host of goodies, sneak peaks and bundles that you can opt for!

Lovely Molly / I Once Was a Ploughboy
 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you feel you can't financially help, sharing this page is invaluable to getting the word out. Social media, email, word of mouth, carrier pigeon... If you're sharing, you're helping!

And that's that!

story:
Album Teaser (#1)
 

 

The Nuts and Bolts (more videos at the very bottom of the post

We are SO pumped about our new album Satellite State! 

  • For those of you that don't know us, we're three friends (Andy Lehman, John Fahr, and John Pinkerton) that write and record music together.  We're from Greenville, SC, and even though the name on the album is "Andy Lehman", we are very much a band.  This is the 4th album I've put out, and it's easily my favorite. 
  • If we can at the very least raise enough to pay off the fee for Mastering the album, which is still sitting on a credit card (non-interest bearing) we'd be thrilled.  
  • The magnitude of raising enough to simply pay the mastering fee off would be enormous to us.  

If you don't read anything past this point, feel free to watch some of our videos towards the bottom of the post.  

What We Need & What You Get

Let's crunch the numbers:

  • We need about $3,000 to pay off a balance on a credit card that we used for mastering our new album Satellite State (Mastering is the final part of the process of making an album). Obviously, no one is required to help out.  But we'd be stoked if you came along side and helped us reach this goal!
  • Also..  This is the only place in the world to get a John Pinkerton Mug.  That alone is worth a contribution.  You get all of the albums I've ever made by supporting the John Pinkerton Package. 
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, it's ok.  We will survive.   And the album will still hit the streaming services soon enough (recording artists like us make very little money on those, but we love them nonetheless).  

Risks & Challenges

Zero.  As soon as you contribute, we send you your stuff.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you just can't contribute right now, that's ok.  But you can still help!

  • Help us get the word out and make some noise about this campaign (it really does help!).
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.  We love you all. 

Andy

 
Never Going Back (Official Lyric Video)

Album Teaser (#2)
 
 
High Wind (Official Lyric Video)
 

 

 
 

 

Limited Edition John Pinkerton Mug

In From the Cold (Handwritten Lyrics)

story:
A Hungarian FolkEmbassy - Magyar Népzenei Nagykövetség (English translation below)


"Csak az léphet elő világpolgárrá, aki egy nemzet polgára is" (Kodály Zoltán)

A FolkEmbassy - vonós népzenekar és köréje szerveződő informális kultúrdiplomáciai intézmény - két éve működik azzal a céllal, hogy Magyarországon és a világban képviselje az autentikus, feldolgozatlan magyar népzenét, az európai kultúra ezt a Kárpát-medencére bízott különleges és gazdag darabját. Táncházakat, koncerteket, follkkocsmákat muzsikálunk, emellett van egy szabadegyetemünk és egy kultúrblogunk. Négy nyelven tartunk interaktív ismeretterjesztő koncert-előadásokat itthon és külföldön.
Minderről bővebben tájékozódhatsz a Facebook oldalunkon és a honlapunkon.
Jegyezd elő most a megjelenő népzenei karaoke DVD-t, melyen közreműködik mások mellett Sebestyén Márta UNESCO Artist for Peace, Bognár Szilvia és a Soós András  (Junior Prima díj, Országos Prímásverseny Győztese) és Rosonczy-Kovács Mihály (Junio Prima díj, Le Femme 50 tehetség kiválasztott) vezette Hungarian FolkEmbassy.
Idén három kiadványt jelentetünk meg;
- egy multimédiás népzenei karaoke-DVD-t (kiadó: Gryllus - Hagyományok Háza) Rosonczy-Kovács Mihály "Felsütött a nap az égre" című válogatása alapján (9 tájegység 150 népdala)
- a Báthory-Bem-Balatonboglár-népzenével a lengyel-magyar barátságról című albumunkat (kiadó: Fonó), decemberben pedig
- a Kertem-FolkEmbassy Szabadegyetem első három évadját összefoglaló esszékötetet (kiadó: Magyar Napló)
A Népzenei karaoke DVD közreműködői: Sebestyén Márta, Bognár Szilvia, Navratil Andrea, Tintér Gabriella, Dóra Áron, Mihó Attila, Szabó Zoltán, Agócs Gergely, Csizmadia Anna, Hetényi Milán, Juhász Réka, Kubinyi Júlia, Tallabille, Berka és a Hungarian FolkEmbassy – Magyar Népzenei Nagykövetség

Szeretnénk az együttműködésedet kérni a törekvéseinkhez, egész pontosan a kiadványok és a táncház-szabadegyetemünkkel kapcsolatos, pályázati úton nem fedezhető költségek előteremtéséhez.

Mire fogjuk használni konkrétan a támogatásodat?

Összesen három ember dolgozik a FolkEmbassy stábjában; Szalai Luca, ügyvezető asszisztens, Mergl Lilla külügyi- és kulturális referens és Rosonczy-Kovács Misi, a FolkEmbassy vezetője. Ők hárman írják a pályázatokat, szervezik a szabadegyetemet, egyeztetik a fellépések technikai részeit, kezelik a honlapot és a Facebook oldalt, járnak a személyes tárgyalásokra, és további számos olyan apró, de fontos feladatot tartanak a kezükben, amire nem is gondolnál. Így érhető el az, hogy a Soós András vezette zenekar tagjainak csak a zenére kelljen figyelniük.

Működési költségekre (pályázatírás, honlap fenntartása, irodabérlés, hangszerek karbantartása, kiadványokkal kapcsolatos humán költségek, próbák költségei a parkolóórától a helyettesítők tiszteletdíjáig) nem, vagy csak nagyon ritkán lehet pályázni. Ugyanígy nem tudjuk pályázati vagy "piaci" úton biztosítani brácsásunk, Orsós Tamás útiköltségeit, aki Uraiújfalurúl, több, mint 200 km-ről jár a próbákra és a fellépésekre.  Ezeket a költségeket mindig a zenészek tiszteletdíjából kellett kigazdálkodnunk.

Most azonban három kiadvány anyagi fedezéséhez összesen még 3-4 millió forintot kell előteremtenünk fél év alatt pályázatok, és szponzorok megkeresése által, megfelelően előkészített anyagokkal felvértezve (amellett, hogy a négy kiadó, a Hagyományok Háza, a Gryllus, a Fonó és a Magyar Napló már így is sokat segített, és a források előteremtésében is együttműködünk velük).

Ezért fordulunk Hozzád: hogy biztosítani tudjuk a három kiadvánnyal kapcsolatos infrastrukturális és munkaerőt igénylő hátterünket.

Kampányunk abban az esetben is eléri a célját, ha a várt támogatások mégsem valósulnak meg maradéktalanul. Amennyiben a tervezett összegnél többet sikerül összegyűjtenünk, nemcsak a kiadványokkal kapcsolatban, hanem azon túl is, az eddigi bizonytalanság helyett tervezhetően tudjuk folytatni és gazdagítani tevékenységünket 2015-ben: A Youtube-csatornánkon rendszeresen jelentkezünk újabb és újabb népzenei összeállításokkal, a kultúrblogunkon portrésorozatot fogunk indítani adatközlő mesterekről és táncházzenészekről, és más rendszeres rovatokat indítunk, a szabadegyetemünket pedig közvetíteni fogjuk az interneten.

A támogatásodért cserébe postázzuk Neked a kiadványokat, feltüntetjük rajtuk és a honlapunkon a Nevedet a támogatók között, tiszteletjegyet adunk a koncertjeinkre, vagy akár tiszteletbeli tagja lehetsz a FolkEmbassy-nek.

Csatlakozz a csapatunkhoz, és legyél az elsők között, akik kipróbálják az első népzenei karaoke DVD-t!
ENG:

"You can only be a citizen of the world if you are a citizen of your nation as well"

(Kodály Zoltán)

The FolkEmbassy is a stringed, folk music ensemble, framed in the context of an informal, institutionalized cultural diplomacy. The Ensemble has been active for two years with the stated goal of representing Hungarian folk music, in Hungary and throughout the world, in its most authentic and non stylized form, as a segment and unique part of the broader European cultural landscape that is the Carpathian Basin. The Ensemble plays at táncház parties, at concerts at folk clubs, as well as providing a free university and a cultural blog. We also hold interactive, knowledge based presentations and concerts here at home in Hungary and abroad, in four languages.

For further information please visit our Facebook page and our homepage.

This year we released three publications:

-  a multimedia, folk music centred karaoke DVD (publisher: Gryllus - Hagyományok Háza) Mihály Rosonczy-Kovács “The sun has risen in the sky” entitled selections (9 regions 150 folk songs)

-  The folk music of Báthory-Bem-Balatonboglár about the Polish-Hungarian friendship entitled entitled album (publisher: Fonó)

-  and in December, the Kertem-FolkEmbassy Free University’s first three seasons’ summarized essay volume. (publisher: Magyar Napló)

We would like to ask for your financial support for our endeavours, more specifically, with respect to our publications and the Táncház Free University.

What will we use your donation for?

At the moment there are three people working for the FolkEmbassy; Luca Szalai - assistant to the manager, Lilla Mergl - foreign affairs and cultural desk and Misi Rosonczy-Kovács, director. All three write tenders for grants, organize the Free University, organize the technical aspects of the performances, manage the homepage and the Facebook page, attend personal meetings, as well as countless smaller, but just as important tasks, that one may not even think of. With this arrangement we are able to ensure that András Soós, the leader of the music group, is given every opportunity to exclusively concentrate on the artistic, that is the musical part of the responsibilities.

Our operational expenses, which encompass grant writing, homepage maintenance, office rental, instrument maintenance, personnel costs with respect to our publications, costs for practicing, from parking fees to paying for substitutes, can not usually be recuperated through the process of writing grant applications. Likewise, we are unable to ensure the money to cover our viola player’s, Tamás Orsos’, transportation costs through the grant application process or through a market solution either, instead we have always relied on covering these costs with the money we are personally paid through the various concerts we perform.

At the moment we are in need of 3-4 million HUF in order to cover the costs for 3 publications. The timeline for the publications is 6 months, and we hope to close in on this amount with the help of grants and sponsors, besides the fact that we are also supported and helped by all four of our publishers the Hagyományok Háza, Gryllus, Fonó and the Magyar Napló with finding sources for the raising of funds.

This is why we are turning to you, so we can ensure the infrastructure and manpower that such a project demands.

Our campaign will reach its stated goal, even if our expected donations do not entirely come to fruition. If, however, on the other hand we are able to raise more funds, above our stated goals, instead of uncertainty we will have stability in following up on our projects with respect to our publications, but beyond that as well, and there will be an opportunity to enrich and continue our pursuits in 2015.

We will continuously upload and refresh our Youtube channel with newer and fresher folk musical compositions. Our culture blog will continue with a portrait series of our mentors from the village, táncház musicians, as well as other regular columns. Our free university will be broadcast over the internet.

In exchange for your support, we will send you our publications, and we will include your name on our credit list, as well as on our homepage, as a supporter. You will also receive a complimentary ticket to our concerts or perhaps you can also become an honorary member of FolkEmbassy.

Join our team, and be among the first to try the first ever Hungarian folk music karaoke DVD.

story:
Hello, and THANK YOU for your interest in our project!

WHO WE ARE ~ booRADLEY
We are Michael Shawn Turner and Patricia Matson. Between us we have more than 30 years of professional music experience (If interested, please visit MSTMusic.com for more info). We formed booRADLEY as a duo less than one year ago and made the commitment to make music our livelihood. Today, we make our living as artists. It's not lucrative by any means, but it is OUR PASSION! 

We continue to receive a great response in the eleven different cities in which we currently perform on a regular basis. Those cities, in the Florida panhandle and along the Gulf and Atlantic Coasts of Florida, include Tallahassee, Havana, Apalachicola, St. George Island, Port St. Joe, Carrabelle, St. Marks, Panacea, Crawfordville, St. Augustine, and Fernandina Beach. 

We have a definite, structured game plan to expand our performance area by leaps and bounds! 

A FEW OF OUR SONGS

Cheryl's Song ~ Call to Say Hello (Written in loving memory of Patty's sister)

Uphill - Dining Room Sessions (Written about a struggling young family)

Help Yourself - Dining Room Sessions (Written about a woman who escaped an abusive relationship)

WHY OUR SONGS MATTER
Writing songs has proven to be very therapeutic to each of us as we work our way through life's hardships. (Our recent television interview speaks on that topic, as does this published scholarly article written by Michael in 2014.)

Many of our listeners have told us that they are touched by our songs, and that they relate very easily to what we are saying through our music. Michael recently obtained his Master of Social Work Degree...we can't think of a better way to use it than to reach people through our music! 

WHAT WE WILL ACCOMPLISH WITH YOUR HELP
Recording with a Legend: 

We are truly honored that the legendary recording engineer, Dave Jerden, has       offered to record our debut album! Dave has recorded The Rolling Stones, Alice in Chains, Jane's Addiction, The Red Hot Chili Peppers, Social Distortion, and many more successful artists. Dave recently contacted us and told us that our music is "exactly what's happening!" 

Promotion on Nationwide College Radio Stations:

We were contacted by Tinderbox Music, who has offered to promote our radio-ready original music to more than 500 college and non-commercial radio stations in all 50 states and Canada.

We are very excited about and grateful for these opportunities that are presenting themselves to us! We are enjoying an incredible amount of response to our music, and truly believe that with your help, we can make this happen!

Publishing and Licensing:
One of our main goals is to sell songs that we have composed to tried-and-true, already-famous artists. We understand that the music business is changing continually, and that artists are not making money selling albums as in the past; the money is made in touring and selling merchandise. We believe our songs are good enough that many established artists would be interested in singing them. Residual payments would help us to provide college educations to our children and grandchildren, which is really what we are all about!

HOW WE WILL USE FUNDS RAISED
With your help we hope to raise $25,000 to obtain our goals of recording and signing on with Tinderbox Music for promotional representation. Here is how the funds will be allocated: 

  • Studio rental costs for ten days of studio use and assistant engineer fees; (this will most likely be a six-song CD. To record a full CD with Mr. Jerden would cost much more than this campaign will provide.)
  • Recording engineer stipend ;
  • Replicating and packaging of 1,000 CD's;
  • Registration with Tinderbox Music for promotion;
  • Flight, rental car, and hotel room - all selected together through a discount site that bundles the three to give us the best price;
  • Food while we are in L.A.;
  • Gas - for the little bit of driving we will have to do in L.A.
By utilizing IndieGogo as our fundraising avenue, we will be able to use funds donated whether we raise the entire amount or not. Should we raise only part of the money, we will put what we have raised into a savings account and do smaller campaigns until we reach the full amount. We will gladly disclose savings deposit information to remain fully transparent with all monies received.

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
Aside from the personal satisfaction of knowing that you have helped two fellow human beings move forward in this world (which will in turn help other human beings), you will also receive certain 'perks' that will be our small way of saying 'Thank you!' 

Please look over the 'Perks' along the right side of this page to see the unique ways we have come up with to express our gratitude to you for becoming a part of this exciting journey.

WHAT IF YOU CAN'T HELP FINANCIALLY?
We of all people can appreciate that sometimes you just don't have the money to be able to donate. YOU CAN STILL HELP! 

By spreading word about our music and our fundraising campaign, you will be helping us in a huge way! The more people we can reach with our campaign, the more chance we stand of bringing this project to fruition. By 'sharing' our campaign on facebook, through email, through word of mouth, you will be joining our team and pushing us toward that finish line! (It's simple with the 'Share' tools provided on this IndiGogo page. 

We know the power of people joining together, and believe we can make this happen if everyone understands that there is no such thing as a 'too little' contribution. And, needless to say, if you have it to spare, we welcome any help you can give!

THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME AND CONSIDERATION!
Michael and Patty

WHAT WE WILL ACCOMPLISH WITH YOUR HELPRecording with a Legend: 

We are truly honored that the legendary recording engineer, Dave Jerden, has       offered to record our debut album! Dave has recorded The Rolling Stones, Alice in Chains, Jane's Addiction, The Red Hot Chili Peppers, Social Distortion, and many more successful artists. Dave recently contacted us and told us that our music is "exactly what's happening!" 

Promotion on Nationwide College Radio Stations:

We were contacted by Tinderbox Music, who has offered to promote our radio-ready original music to more than 500 college and non-commercial radio stations in all 50 states and Canada.

We are very excited about and grateful for these opportunities that are presenting themselves to us! We are enjoying an incredible amount of response to our music, and truly believe that with your help, we can make this happen!
Publishing and Licensing:
One of our main goals is to sell songs that we have composed to tried-and-true, already-famous artists. We understand that the music business is changing continually, and that artists are not making money selling albums as in the past; the money is made in touring and selling merchandise. We believe our songs are good enough that many established artists would be interested in singing them. Residual payments would help us to provide college educations to our children and grandchildren, which is really what we are all about!
HOW WE WILL USE FUNDS RAISED
With your help we hope to raise $25,000 to obtain our goals of recording and signing on with Tinderbox Music for promotional representation. Here is how the funds will be allocated: 


Studio rental costs for ten days of studio use and assistant engineer fees; (this will most likely be a six-song CD. To record a full CD with Mr. Jerden would cost much more than this campaign will provide.)


Recording engineer stipend ;


Replicating and packaging of 1,000 CD's;


Registration with Tinderbox Music for promotion;


Flight, rental car, and hotel room - all selected together through a discount site that bundles the three to give us the best price;


Food while we are in L.A.;


Gas - for the little bit of driving we will have to do in L.A.


By utilizing IndieGogo as our fundraising avenue, we will be able to use funds donated whether we raise the entire amount or not. Should we raise only part of the money, we will put what we have raised into a savings account and do smaller campaigns until we reach the full amount. We will gladly disclose savings deposit information to remain fully transparent with all monies received.
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
Aside from the personal satisfaction of knowing that you have helped two fellow human beings move forward in this world (which will in turn help other human beings), you will also receive certain 'perks' that will be our small way of saying 'Thank you!' 
Please look over the 'Perks' along the right side of this page to see the unique ways we have come up with to express our gratitude to you for becoming a part of this exciting journey.
WHAT IF YOU CAN'T HELP FINANCIALLY?
We of all people can appreciate that sometimes you just don't have the money to be able to donate. YOU CAN STILL HELP! By spreading word about our music and our fundraising campaign, you will be helping us in a huge way! The more people we can reach with our campaign, the more chance we stand of bringing this project to fruition. By 'sharing' our campaign on facebook, through email, through word of mouth, you will be joining our team and pushing us toward that finish line! (It's simple with the 'Share' tools provided on this IndiGogo page. We know the power of people joining together, and believe we can make this happen if everyone understands that there is no such thing as a 'too little' contribution. And, needless to say, if you have it to spare, we welcome any help you can give!
THANK YOU FOR YOUR TIME AND CONSIDERATION!Michael and Patty

story:
ACCORDIONS RISING is a documentary film I have been dedicated to for a few years now about how, contrary to conventional wisdom,  music of the accordion is alive and thriving!  With a focus on New York City artists/musicians and composers,  the film explores how appreciation for the music of the accordion is regaining its footing as a vibrant and versatile instrument and is finally taking its rightful place,

I intend to complete the film this summer, but  I need finishing funds to do so. Only the big ticket final post production items remain: color correction and sound mix. However, licensing fees, errors and omissions insurance, marketing, film festival, music festival and convention entry fees will also be needed for the film to reach its audience.

I hope that the trailer will inspire interest in all of you out there: people in the accordion world, fans new and old, music lovers of every stripe, as well as those interested in trends in American culture, to support the completion of this delightful and informative film.  It is time to shatter mistaken notions and tell the real story because the real story will be a revelation. 

                              June is  National Accordion Awareness Month. 

                                    This film celebrates the accordion.

                              Please Pay Homage. Make a contribution.

Once Accordions Rising is released, people everywhere can come to understand that accordions have returned, not only with amusement, but with a beautiful, eloquent, haunting, and downright exciting vengeance!

Just imagine all those who are not “in the know,” and are missing out on so much interesting music. Together we can fix that.

                                                   - Roberta Cantow, Filmmaker and Accordion Devotee

Your Support

To date, I have done the research, production and film editing completely with out of pocket funds. Before asking others to commit funds to this project, I wanted to be sure that, indeed, there was a story to tell.  Now, six years hence, I KNOW there is a story to tell, and I have put it all together on film.

       My budget to complete and launch this film is  $30,000

I am asking you, my friends and  acquaintances, my dentist and accountant, music lovers, musicians, accordionists worldwide and all those interested in cultural documentaries to come along on the last leg of this journey with me, as I am creating this film for you and for the edification of the nation.  I would like as many people as possible to know about and embrace the rise of the accordion because it is nothing to be ashamed of, and it is, at least in the US,  “as American as apple pie.” Put another way, ‘Accordions R Us.’

Please rise to the occasion in any way that you can: Make a donation of any amount  and forward information about the campaign to others. You will not just be making a donation, you will also be contributing to awareness and understanding of the instrument that so many of you cherish and so many more just need  to understand.  Long Live the Accordion and its astonishing range and complexity!

                                


ABOUT THE FILM

The resurgence of interest in accordion music  has  been occurring over the last 30-40 years.  Though many continue to see the it as the stodgy instrument of a bygone era - and accordion jokes abound - it is time to set the record straight! Accordions deliver a surprising range of styles, express the complete and complex range of human emotion, and reflect the diversity in our culture today

Accordions Rising is  the story of the variety of styles, cultural  diversity and extraordinary virtuosity of the instrument and the music that it can make.  Touching on its deep history but focusing on the present, the film offers entertaining, conversational style interviews, anecdotal commentary and both formal and informal music performances  from  celebrated accordionists, composers and bands working and performing in America today. These primarily New York based but globe and US trotting musicians, make up the colorful and thoughtful cast of characters who drive the story by tracing their uniquely personal attractions to the instrument and sharing their surprisingly divergent paths: from immigrant roots, Creole or Roma beginnings, for example, to a recognition of the very special niche this so-called "low art" form provides for inspirations in jazz, classical, new music, pop, fusion forms, operatic styles and beyond.

The film provides  a tapestry of fascinating individuals, their attitudes, deep passions, and above of all else, profound dedication to the instrument. We learn that though still a rebellious lot, these music makers have an audience in some of the hippest hide-a-ways and most sought after venues.  The film makes clear that the so-called “accordion world” reaches far beyond the borders of the  Big Apple, a microcosm of the larger landscape and a curious continuum that includes  the familiar wacky and  wild as well as the more sophisticated, serious, meditative and post modern. 

The film offers visual and poetic elements that demonstrate the many ways that this most maligned of all musical instruments has captured the imagination of many in the form of informal community events, photography, dance/video, performance, and site-specific work.

But let's face it.  Accordions themselves, are  not much without the people who play them. I am extremely grateful to all the film’s participants, the performers, composers and others who generously gave of their time as interviewees and storytellers.  The interweaving of their very unique personalities, musical  inventions and performance examples are the very heart of this story.  

Some of them include Guy Klucevsek, a thoughtful and reflective composer/accordionist prominent in new music circles ; William Schimmel, master accordionist, exuberant and philosophical; Pauline Oliveros, electronic and experimental improviser with a serious intellectual approach; Will Holshouser, jazz accordionist extraordinaire, low key as can be; Rachelle Garniez, singer, songwriter, musician, perhaps the edgy rebel, Peter Stan, Ambassador of Roma Music “par excellence," warm and personable; Bob Goldberg with his Famous Accordion Orchestra, spirited and community minded,  and Nicole Renaud with her “illuminated accordion”  angelic soprano voice, and steadfast French charm; among others,  

           LINK TO WEBSITE                  (opens in new window )            

       

3 Segments with William Schimmel, Nicole Renaud and Guy Klucevsek:

                                                      

 Undine's Curse/Nicole Renaud -A Sequence from Hyperbaric-Hyperbolic by Paul Etienne Lincoln© 2008 Paul Etienne Lincoln


Accordions Rising  will be a revelation to those who continue to think that “the accordion is dead.” As William Schimmel points out, “The accordion is the icon of the 21st century.”   Indeed,  this film only touches the surface of what is  going on out there in the world of accordion culture and accordion music. Not only does the accordion have a past, but a bright and energetic future is in store as well.

Join the Campaign and Receive Regular Updates with New Video Clips

Angels and Accordions, 2010 - Producer, Dance Theatre Etcetera in Collaboration with Green-Wood Historic Fund

NEXT STEPS

If I meet my funding goal, the project will be released into the world via film and music festivals/conventions beginning in the fall.  If my goal is not met, I assure you that the film will find its way to you, no matter what!

                       Other Ways You Can Help

                                                  Accordion Aficionados Unite!

Use the share tools below.
Forward this campaign to people within and beyond the music world. 
Ask them to share the campaign with their friends.  

Together we are stronger in getting the word out.

If you  or someone you know might benefit from a  sponsorship opportunity, message me personally at:  rcantow@originaldigital.net

story:
Short Summary

 I feel a bit tacky asking for $ but I am putting my pride aside because sometimes it's ok to ask for help.  Finances have not been the greatest since returning from Thailand. I started a job that treated me well but didn't really get me ahead financially. I held out because we were moving restaurants, no one screamed at me, and the potential to make $ was high. All in a matter of 4 days the owner closed the restaurant and did not hire any of the original staff back. I have been without steady pay since March and for the first time in my life have been late on rent. I am currently catering my little ass off to catch up. I am not asking for money to get out of debt. I just need help to purchase DJ equipment to sharpen my skills, make mixes, and bring to events and parties. I want to walk away from bar tending and pursue playing music while auditioning. It is my ticket out of the service industry. In the stresses of not having money I have thrown myself into creative things that I love, that being music and acting. Happiness is free and money comes and goes. Unfortunately, I picked an expensive sport. I trust  my talent and that this investment will only benefit and enhance my life. Any help helps. Thank you thank you thank you.

What I Need 

Pioneer DDj-sx2 $1000
$200 Speakers
$200 towards the % Indie go go takes
$160 Squarespace/gogo daddy hosting Website for a year
$150 Technics Professional DJ Headphones
$100 Traktor Software
