story:
Acoustic Preview of "Believe" By: Zenya

Coming soon to Artuvnoize Vol.1 

Short Summary

Hi Friends,

                  Thank you for taking the time to read this. Many of you looking at this page know me or have been following my journey for a while now but for those of you who don't know, here’s a little summary of my story.

I am a singer songwriter, recording artist from Newcastle, Australia. Seven years ago I saved up some money from singing in local clubs, pubs, as well as holding down a retail job and decided to pursue my musical career in NYC (enter the old adage "If you can make it there... You can make it anywhere"). Through social media and networking I began to find myself in writing sessions and showcases, where I further honed my skills. Over time, my networks began to grow, and through sheer persistance and God's grace I was noticed by some people in the music industry whom were awesome enough to give me opportunities.  That would in time put me on some pretty awesome platforms with REALLY awesome people. I considered my jobs with these greats, as an opportunity to learn as much as I could and apply it to my own project.  As grateful, as I've been for the blessings that I've received thus far, I knew that I would never be satisfied until I pursued my true goal.  To be my own artist, with my own platform, and to share my love of singing and songwriting with the world.

 I’m a person that believes that with a solid dream, deep prayer, being goal oriented, and having a good support system (not to mention a great attitude and quality product), I can do anything at all. I’ve seen it in my life time and time again. Now its time for my ultimate dream to begin as a solo artist and I can’t do it without you! 

I am creating 2 EP’s this year entitled Artuvnoize Volumes 1 & 2, that will contain 5-6 songs each, which will be combined as an overall album in 2015. I need your help to get Volume 1 off the ground with strong momentum. My style is top 40 pop infused with rock, reggae, electronic and dance using electronic AND real instruments. I write all of my music along with my partner Krunk-a-delic who produces all of the songs. We’re inspired to make songs that uplift people, making them feel good by creating quality music, expressive vocals and lyrical content that means something. We take pride in making every intricate part of each song so true to it’s story that you can actually close your eyes and see it as movie in your mind.

I have already written and pre-recorded most of the songs for Vol.1 and am getting ready to get into the studio to professionally record my vocals so I can give you the best quality possible. 

Once the EP is recorded, mixed, mastered and packaged nicely I want to be able to let my dedicated donators be the first to have it before it’s release date!

Thank you for paying it forward! :) 

Listen To Zenya's single "Freedom In A Kiss"

What We Need & What You Get

I have been researching indiegogo for a while now and have noticed successful campaigns always give a transparent breakdown of where the monies are spent, and perks that are worth it. I want you guys to really feel comfortable about donating and the only way to do that is to take off my musical cap and really sit and research how much it costs for me to record and release this EP professionally and independently and present it to you. I want to give you a complete breakdown of where every penny is spent. I have set this account to be a Flex Funding account which means that if I don’t make my goal, I will still receive the amount made however, that said, if I don’t reach my goal, I will have to reevaluate how I plan to make this EP. Regardless, I’m ready to make this happen and I’m grateful for the platform to do so!

What You Get!






The Impact

Know that when you lend your support, by donation, or otherwise, you become a significant part of this album and my career.  By taking part, you are helping me take creative control over my art as an independent artist. You are a part of bringing musical freedom to an art that has been a special part of our lives since the beginning of time. Whats your favorite song? How does it make you feel? Imagine that song never made it to radio, or even worse.. Your ears and your heart. I want to give people an opportunity to hear my music and with your help (big or small) I will get the chance to do so!


The Breakdown

Zenya - Artuvnoize Budget Breakdown

  • *Recording- $20,000
  • *Mixing & Mastering- $5,000
  • *Marketing- $5,000
  • *Promotion- $5,000
  • *Public Relations- $3,000
  • *Manufacturing- $2,500
  • *Indiegogo Fee's 4%- $2,200
  • *Shipping - $3,500
  • *Artwork Visuals, Graphic Design- $3,500
  • *Credit Card Fee's- $1,650
  • *Cost Of Goods For Perks- $3,650
  •                                          Grand Total - $55,000



Risks & Challenges

When embarking on journeys such as this one, risk always becomes a major factor.  What if I don't raise enough?  What if I do lol?  I want you all to know that regardless of the amount that the fundraising campaign will generate, I am committed to my art, and those whom support it by giving you the best music possible.  I honor and cherish my relationships with those whom have supported me thus far.  To give them or anyone else anything less is not an option.

Depending on the volume of postage, I am hoping to get everything out to you by the dates set in the Perks Boxes. If for some reason you don't receive your perks by then, please dont hesitate to email me at indiegogozenya@gmail.com so that I can you your perks right away! Thank You


Other Ways You Can Help

Don’t worry if you can’t contribute, sharing is caring! Sharing this campaign on your Facebook, twitter, instagram, website etc... is a great way to help. This way I can spread the awareness of the project outside of my immediate network and expand with your music loving friends... because you heard it first!  


Thank You, Thank You, Thank You! :)

I have set this account to be a Flex Funding account which means that if I don’t make my goal, I will still receive the amount made however, that said, if I don’t reach my goal, I will have to reevaluate how I plan to make this EP. Regardless, I’m ready to make this happen and I’m grateful for the platform to do so!
What You Get!














The Impact
Know that when you lend your support, by donation, or otherwise, you become a significant part of this album and my career.  By taking part, you are helping me take creative control over my art as an independent artist. You are a part of bringing musical freedom to an art that has been a special part of our lives since the beginning of time. Whats your favorite song? How does it make you feel? Imagine that song never made it to radio, or even worse.. Your ears and your heart. I want to give people an opportunity to hear my music and with your help (big or small) I will get the chance to do so!
The Breakdown
Zenya - Artuvnoize Budget Breakdown



*Recording- $20,000


*Mixing & Mastering- $5,000


*Marketing- $5,000


*Promotion- $5,000


*Public Relations- $3,000


*Manufacturing- $2,500


*Indiegogo Fee's 4%- $2,200


*Shipping - $3,500


*Artwork Visuals, Graphic Design- $3,500


*Credit Card Fee's- $1,650


*Cost Of Goods For Perks- $3,650


                                         Grand Total - $55,000







Risks & Challenges

When embarking on journeys such as this one, risk always becomes a major factor.  What if I don't raise enough?  What if I do lol?  I want you all to know that regardless of the amount that the fundraising campaign will generate, I am committed to my art, and those whom support it by giving you the best music possible.  I honor and cherish my relationships with those whom have supported me thus far.  To give them or anyone else anything less is not an option.
Depending on the volume of postage, I am hoping to get everything out to you by the dates set in the Perks Boxes. If for some reason you don't receive your perks by then, please dont hesitate to email me at indiegogozenya@gmail.com so that I can you your perks right away! Thank You
   Other Ways You Can Help Don’t worry if you can’t contribute, sharing is caring! Sharing this campaign on your Facebook, twitter, instagram, website etc... is a great way to help. This way I can spread the awareness of the project outside of my immediate network and expand with your music loving friends... because you heard it first!  

Thank You, Thank You, Thank You! :)

story:
ABOUT US 

People with hearing loss in Puerto Princesa, Philippines have little access to hearing aids. Starkey Hearing Foundation, as they do all over the world, has been working with local partners to build capacity to provide hearing care in this city.  Last year, Spotify became a partner to help bring hearing, and music, to their community.


WHAT WE NEED

Spotify helped Starkey Hearing Foundation give the gift of hearing to more than 900 people so far, but together we can reach our goal of 1,000. Make your contribution below.  

$100 = hearing care for 1 person.

THE IMPACT

Started in 1984 by William F. Austin, founder and CEO of Starkey Hearing Technologies, Starkey Hearing Foundation works hand-in-hand with local communities to provide the training and resources necessary to bring the gift of hearing to people who need it. Built on Austin's vision, "So the World May Hear," the Foundation builds sustainable systems of hearing care around the world and fits more than 175,000 hearing aids annually.

Spotify proud of its commitment to Starkey Hearing Foundation. So far, Spotify sponsored a hearing mission in Puerto Princesa, donated Spotify Premium to help make music a bigger part of the hearing aid fitting experience, donated media space on its platform to help raise awareness, and brought six Spotify employees to volunteer and help fit people with hearing aids during the Puerto Princesa trip. With your help, we can do even more - together. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t donate, don’t worry. Learn about this cause, and more, at Spotify.com/change. Spread the word about our campaign using Indiegogo’s sharing tools.

story:
Short Summary

Hey, this is Aaron Cox. For those who don't know me, I'm an independent recording & performing artist. My new album entitled "Wonder" was recorded in Nashville, TN early last year, and was digitally released in December. However, with the independently (personally) funded expenses of recording, mixing and mastering the album, as well as the personal expenses of recently getting married, relocating to a new country and preparing for a baby that's on the way-  personally funding the first run of physical copies of this album right now is out of the question. Contributing to this project will help to make this happen so that we can get off the ground with promoting and selling this album. Your support will be greatly valued!


What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to raise at least $1,000 to put with what we've saved so that we can get a reasonably priced order of CDs in jewel cases to sell at live performances and in stores. Check out the video gallery to hear a preview of the full album!

View the "Perks" on the right side of your screen to find out what's in it for you!



Risks & Challenges

With CD replicating companies, ordering any less than 500 copies costs nearly double the amount per unit, and the least you can generally get printed is 250 copies. So (as a general average of the local companies) getting 250 copies printed is about $2.50 per unit for a cd in a cardboard sleeve (so about $625 total) whereas getting 500 copies of the same thing printed is about $1.50 per unit (about $750 total). Since this is a full album, it would be great to get a jewel cases with the paper inserts so that the lyrics as well as more photos/art can also be printed also. This would cost closer to $1,300 for 500 copies. But depending on the funding, the cardboard sleeves will be an alternative option, and will at least allow us have physical copies of the album available at shows so that people who want a copy are able to buy one.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help, but are not able to contribute right now, you can share this campaign on social media, or using the Indigogo share tools. Any help is much appreciated!

story:
Let me introduce my name and why I need your help. First, sorry for my bad English because I just learn by myself from books and movies. Please read my story below:


My name is Nobuo Maulana Shigeno (20). Since I was a kid, I have already had an interest on music, but when I was 17 years old, the interest has been something serious. I have just started my music journey when stepping on the age of 17 years old, exactly three years ago when I was in the third grade of senior high school and decided to move to a music vocational school (Yayasan Musik Jakarta). However, because I did not have a solid foundation in the field of classical music, then I had to repeat my senior high school and went back to grade 1.  the skill that I have today. Diligent exercise and hard work, hopes and dreams, parents’ support, all make me reach this point. But I keep in practice, I even practice 8 hours a day, 12 hours sometimes.


My major is violin, and my minor is piano. For a young man aged 17 years old, it seems that it is not the right age to start classical music. But I keep trying, because here is the place where I put my dream and with music I want to make the people I love happy, my family.

In the course of my learning, I have learned a lot from teachers, doctors of music, and even professors. I get a masterclass with Albert Wang D.M.A (Assistant Professor of Violin Roosevelt University, Chicago.), Felix Ungar, and other teachers outside of my Country.

In playing or perform classical music, the goal of a performer is to deliver not only sound, but also the existing emotions. A performer must be able to make the audience feel the same feeling. The violin I have and I play in my videos (Soon to be Upload) is a violin from China, and its price ranges from US $ 400-450. Violin with the best quality is the violin during the 17th and 18th centuries, Italian violin-makers such as Stradivarius and Guarneri created the incredible violins that professionals use today. It was sold or auctioned with the price of around 3 even 15 million dollars. However, I would not dream of having it, what I need is a modern Italian violin with good quality and able to bring me up to the professional level.


(Violin - Me, Guitar - Yeremia)

I have tried hard to get to this point, and I also pay for my own purposes. I have to work to be able to buy my daily needs, teaching violin from homes to homes, with the revenue of around 130 US dollars a month. I can only harbor my dream to be able to buy the violin with professional quality, at the price of about 20,000 US dollars or above. My teacher always says, I need a good violin with good level for my future in professional musician. My teacher gives me an example: "how can a professional racer win the race in the circuit using family car with the standard engine?"

My dream is to play the Tchaikovsky Violin Concerto in a good, big Concert hall with my family and friends or even my teachers watching on me. And sadly my violin can't play this music.

(Violin 1 - me, Violin 2 - Joy, Flute - Mr. Toro, Viola - Efraim, Cello - Abel)

I get an invitation to study in Showa university of Music, Tokyo by Fumiko Eguchi (Chair Professor, and Special member of Executive committe for International Chopin Piano Competition in Asia) She and the school owner told me that I can get a scholarship for the classical music study program of violin major. I am very happy and eager. However, before I study to a higher level, I need a better violin.

I expect your assistance, and spread this to your family and relatives and siblings. I need a violin with the professional level. I want to reach a professional level and want to get a good career in classical music. But for that, I need a good violin.


What do I need and what do you get? 

I ask for your help to buy an Italy violin with professional quality at the price of 20,000 US dollars. In return, I'm offering a selection of "perks" at different giving levels, so check it out.

No matter how small it would be helpful! Crowd funding is a good way to raise funds. Because you don't have to spend a lot to help me out, You can donate a small portion, but many people coming together and making a contribution makes a huge impact. Small for you, but its really big for me.

Another way you can do to help me:

Please spread this page to anyone you know (family, friends, relatives, or anyone else) that you think can help and support me to achieve my dream.

And if you guys help me, I promise to myself, you, and my God, that I will practice even more harder. I want to be a professional violinist

Left to right - my mom, dad, brother, sisters, and me (first year of practice the instrument)

Note:

If the results of donations exceed the target, then its excess will be donated to the underprivileged and those in need for food or clothing. I will donate 100 percent of the rest of the money after I bought the Italian violin.

Thanks for the help :) 


Address:

Nobuo Shigeno

Kav. DKI Cipayung Jl.kenanga P.23, Jakarta 13840, Indonesia

(+62) 896-0999-3384

nshigeno@gmail.com

Facebook: www.facebook.com/nobuo.shigeno

Instagram: www.instagram.com/nobuoshigeno


Sincerely,

Nobuo Maulana Shigeno

story:
THE INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN IS OVER, BUT YOU CAN STILL CONTRIBUTE AND GET A PERK! Send PayPal donations to american_clave@hotmail.com, OR mail checks to:

American Clave
11131 Watermans Drive
Reston, VA 20191
USA

Be sure to include a note indicating which perk you'd like! Everything in the column on the right-hand side of this page is still available!


"Kip Hanrahan is the Jean-Luc Godard of music today..." 
-Le Monde (Paris)

"Simply put, Hanrahan is one of modern jazz's best composers, not to mention arrangers and producers...Hanrahan proves a master at maxing out the dynamic potential in any instrumental combo, and raises spirits in more ways than one."  -CMJ New Music Monthly

"There is nothing quite like Mr. Hanrahan’s music – a steamy blend of rhythmic and melodic tensions, drawn from musicians of different traditions (Latin, jazz, rock), yet with something very much his own." 
-New York Times

"The music of Hanrahan, and of the American Clavé label which he runs, is rich beyond compare." 
-The Independent (London)

"Great music... Tangled. Difficult. Exquisitely Beautiful." -BBC

"1984 isn't the year that Kip Hanrahan's 'Desire Develops an Edge' came out, but 1984 is the year of 'Desire Develops an Edge'"  - Le Monde (Paris)

"This is music with a sense of image and taste and, most of all, dripping in atmosphere." -Jazz Times

(for some american clave listening material, scroll to the bottom...)

AMERICAN CLAVE

For those of you who don’t know my music or the music of american clave Rekids, the following is a comically dispassionate (but oddly on-the-mark truthful) description of the label, including the very clear intent of the projects, 

a music company, a record company, an anthology of musics (sequences of angers, passions, sexualities made audible and intangable by music) formed by the labor of Kip Hanrahan, Jack Bruce, Astor Piazolla, Robby Ameen, Horacio El Negro Hernandez, Don Pullen, Silvana DeLuigi, Paul Haines, Milton Cardona, Ishmael Reed, Steve Swallow, Alfredo Triff, Allen Toussaint, Puntilla Orlando Rios, David Murray, Taj Mahal, Sting, Andy Gonzalez, Arto Lindsay, Giovanni Hildalgo, Fernando Saunders, Leo Nocentelli, Benjamin Bratt, Pablo Ziegler, Fernando Suarez Paz, Carmen Lundy, Bobby Womack, Robert Wyatt, Peter Scherer, Lester Bowie, John Tchicai, Mike Cain, Jerry Gonzalez, Xiomara Laugart, Lucy Penebaz, George Cartwright, Elysee Pyronneau, Pedrito Martinez, Olu Dara, Amadito Valdez, Yosvannit Terry, Chocolate Armenteros, Dziga Vertov and many others informed by, but irrevert of expected form; but informed by and not irreverent of passionate cause and intent ...

Look, we’re going to make another record, and we’re going to do it this year.  We haven’t been in the studio for almost 5 years, and the burning everyday discomfort, disquiet, of our not being able to make that turbulence, passion, darkness and brilliance made audible, made art, through our music is driving us crazy.  The once wistfully charming inevitable question from any of the musicians I work with about “seriously, when are we going back into the studio?” has lost any trace of that charm.  So we’ve decided that we’re going ahead and doing the next record this year, and insisting on maintaining the same astoundingly high audio and graphic quality as became part of the signature of american clave Records.  As far as maintaining the musical passion, intensity, musical subversiveness and sometimes uncomfortable, more often liberating personal honesty that forms the american clave music of the past 36 years, I really don’t think we know how to make music any other way.  There’s a reason Astor Piazzolla repeatedly told people the music he’d made with us was the best recordings he’d made in his entire life.  Astor:  “I gave my soul to those records!”  Well, that’s what we do with the best music, It’s one of the reasons the music’s not always the most easy to listen to, but it’s among the most rewarding, and, yeah, liberating, as long as you’re not needing music to be reduced to background  / wallpaper.  Then we’re not for you….

The difference this time around is that we’re using crowdsourcing as the way to raise the money to make the music, the CDs, the electronic transfers, maybe even the LPs.  Leijia and I had a hell of a lot of fun coming up with the arabesque menu of perks to the right of this text, and it’s part of it, but besides it in a way.   It’s not busking - we’re not just passing around the hat to raise the necessary money, we’re actually asking long term fans, recent fans, curious or driven new listeners, to be partners, in a way.  It’s no longer the schematic process of our licensing the music and packaging to a rekid company, which then releases it, and then the listeners buy it.  We’re now inviting the listeners to be engaged from the very beginning as direct partners without whom this project would not be possible.  There’s actually something pretty wonderful about the directness between the listener and the musician in this method, no?

This record will be under my name and will hopefully include many of the musicians I’ve been closely working with over the last stretch of years, such as:  Steve Swallow [CONFIRMED], Brandon Ross, Fernando Saunders, Robby Ameen [CONFIRMED], Horacio “El Negro" Hernandez [CONFIRMED], Charles Neville [CONFIRMED], Alfredo Triff, Xiomara Laugart, Roberto Poveda, Yunior Terry, Yosvanni Terry and a host of others, as well as asking some friends and collaborators we’ve worked with in the past like Ruben Blades, Carmen Lundy, Giovanni Hidalgo and a few others, AND a few new faces (voices?  hands?) who’s passion I’ve heard bursting through their music in ways that it seems that our project might be the perfect way to take their music even further into the emotional and musical complexity and honesty just waiting…     

I’m hopeful we’ll have enough money raised to start recording by the end of June, continue with both the recording and the mixing throughout the summer and into September, and master the record by late October 2015.  

A fuller budget is down below, and please understand that the reason the budget’s a little higher than most of the other music crowdsourcing drives is that we, as always, will be recording in real studios  - with REAL NEVE boards, and the right mikes and outboard - and will be mastered in a real (REAL) mastering studio, with Greg Calbi, the BEST.  It’s the reasons american clave records always SOUND so special, as special as the music itself is.

I also need to point out that even if we don’t reach the posted financial goal, we will STILL be making a record, even if the studio and packaging scale is scaled back, but, under no circumstances will the scale of the musical passion and quality be scaled back.  Again, as I mentioned above, I actually don’t think we know HOW to do that!  The point of this last paragraph is just to assure those of you who send in money for a single CD or electronic music transfer, you will get it, no matter what, with the expected date of delivery late October 2015.


budget:

$26,000 musician fees, studio costs, mixing, engineer’s fees, 

$4,000 mastering (I only use Greg Calbi, the best, which is one of the main reasons why american clave records always sound so great - it’s worth extra expense)

$1,000 publicist

$2,000 cover art 

$1,400 cost of gifts manufacturing (t-shirts, posters…..) and shipping

$4,000 CD manufacturing (with the special american clave style covers…)

$1,600 Indiegogo’s share


even if you're broke, you can still be a crucial part of this project and this music and its light and potential: 
-post and share the indiegogo page,
-email your friends and favorite blogs/websites/magazines,
-send out some well-intentioned carrier pigeons.
indiegogo's got some good sharing ideas, too, and we're down for pretty much whatever.

now here's some music!

music is driving us crazy.  The once wistfully charming inevitable 
question from any of the musicians I work with about “seriously, when 
are we going back into the studio?” has lost any trace of that charm.  
So we’ve decided that we’re going ahead and doing the next record this 
year, and insisting on maintaining the same astoundingly high audio and 
graphic quality as became part of the signature of american clave 
Records.  As far as maintaining the musical passion, intensity, musical 
subversiveness and sometimes uncomfortable, more often liberating 
personal honesty that forms the american clave music of the past 36 
years, I really don’t think we know how to make music any other 
way.  There’s a reason Astor Piazzolla repeatedly told people the music 
he’d made with us was the best recordings he’d made in his entire life. 
 Astor:  “I gave my soul to those records!”  Well, that’s what we do 
with the best music, It’s one of the reasons the music’s not always the 
most easy to listen to, but it’s among the most rewarding, and, yeah, 
liberating, as long as you’re not needing music to be reduced to 
background  / wallpaper.  Then we’re not for you….
The difference this 
time around is that we’re using crowdsourcing as the way to raise the 
money to make the music, the CDs, the electronic transfers, maybe even 
the LPs.  Leijia and I had a hell of a lot of fun coming up with the 
arabesque menu of perks to the right of this text, and it’s part of it, 
but besides it in a way.   It’s not busking - we’re not just passing 
around the hat to raise the necessary money, we’re actually asking long 
term fans, recent fans, curious or driven new listeners, to be partners,
 in a way.  It’s no longer the schematic process of our licensing the 
music and packaging to a rekid company, which then releases it, and then
 the listeners buy it.  We’re now inviting the listeners to be engaged 
from the very beginning as direct partners without whom this project 
would not be possible.  There’s actually something pretty wonderful 
about the directness between the listener and the musician in this 
method, no?
This record will be 
under my name and will hopefully include many of the musicians I’ve been closely 
working with over the last stretch of years, such as:  Steve Swallow [CONFIRMED], Brandon Ross, Fernando 
Saunders, Robby Ameen [CONFIRMED], Horacio “El Negro" Hernandez [CONFIRMED], Charles Neville [CONFIRMED], 
Alfredo Triff, Xiomara Laugart, Roberto Poveda, Yunior Terry, Yosvanni 
Terry and a host of others, as well as asking some friends and 
collaborators we’ve worked with in the past like Ruben Blades, Carmen 
Lundy, Giovanni Hidalgo and a few others, AND a few new faces (voices?  
hands?) who’s passion I’ve heard bursting through their music in ways 
that it seems that our project might be the perfect way to take their 
music even further into the emotional and musical complexity and honesty
 just waiting…     
I’m hopeful we’ll 
have enough money raised to start recording by the end of June, continue
 with both the recording and the mixing throughout the summer and into 
September, and master the record by late October 2015.  
A fuller budget is 
down below, and please understand that the reason the budget’s a little 
higher than most of the other music crowdsourcing drives is that we, as 
always, will be recording in real studios  - with REAL NEVE boards, and 
the right mikes and outboard - and will be mastered in a real (REAL) 
mastering studio, with Greg Calbi, the BEST.  It’s the reasons american 
clave records always SOUND so special, as special as the music itself 
is.
I also need to point
 out that even if we don’t reach the posted financial goal, we will 
STILL be making a record, even if the studio and packaging scale is 
scaled back, but, under no circumstances will the scale of the musical 
passion and quality be scaled back.  Again, as I mentioned above, I 
actually don’t think we know HOW to do that!  The point of this last 
paragraph is just to assure those of you who send in money for a single 
CD or electronic music transfer, you will get it, no matter what, with 
the expected date of delivery late October 2015.

budget:
$26,000 musician fees, studio costs, mixing, engineer’s fees, 
$4,000 mastering (I 
only use Greg Calbi, the best, which is one of the main reasons why 
american clave records always sound so great - it’s worth extra expense)
$1,000 publicist
$2,000 cover art 
$1,400 cost of gifts manufacturing (t-shirts, posters…..) and shipping
$4,000 CD manufacturing (with the special american clave style covers…)
$1,600 Indiegogo’s share
even if you're broke, you can still be a crucial part of this project 
and this music and its light and potential: -post and share the indiegogo 
page,-email your friends and favorite blogs/websites/magazines,-send out 
some well-intentioned carrier pigeons.indiegogo's got some good sharing 
ideas, too, and we're down for pretty much whatever.
now here's some music!

story:
Join us in the mountains for the inaugural Steamboat Movement Fest - a celebration of world-class yoga, live music and summer outdoor adventure. This four-day, Zero Waste event unites yoga, music, and movement in the unique beauty of Steamboat Springs, Colorado, and features live music acts, speakers, artists, guided hiking, biking, trail running, paddleboard experiences, and outdoor yoga taught by renowned local and national yoga teachers.

Our goal is to book great headliners that we can offer to you for FREE!  This is a community event and we want anyone who loves music, yoga, and the outdoors to get a chance to experience this transformational weekend.  Help us make this inaugural event a success that will live on for years to come!

To be straight up, putting on a festival takes a big chunk of chedda!  We need $62,000 for things like tents, production costs, location fees, etc.  To offer some quality music that everyone will enjoy, we need $25,000!  

Along with providing some great entertainment from July 24th-26th, we want to show our gratitude by offering some worthy perks for all of our supporters.                                                                                                                                                      

Get your early bird tickets by June 15th for only $198 @ steamboatmovementfest.com

No worries if you can't make a donation, we appreciate you spreading the word just as much! 

               Use the share buttons below!!

Check out some of our prizes!



Win a FREE weekend pass on our Instagram contest!


Campaign Link: http://bit.ly/1QSzfHe

story:
Hello and thank you for taking a minute to listen . . . .

  We're Catalina Shortwave, an original rock band based in Ridgefield, Connecticut.  

  Like many rock bands, this one started in a cold and unfinished basement with some guys sitting on old furniture writing songs.  We wrote 15 of them.  And then the dilemma happened - do we wait indefinitely until we can find the money to get these recorded properly, or do we try to get them out there sooner?  We chose the latter, and so we recorded our songs with our own equipment in that very same basement.  We used an old Mac that kept crapping out on us, and a 4-track cassette recorder so creaky that it made the Mac look like Peter Pan.  But we got it done.  We mixed the record ourselves.  At that (mixing) we were and are still amateurs, but we did the best we could with what we had.  And so, our first baby, the record we call  >>REPEATER>>, was born.  You can listen to songs from >>REPEATER>> here: 

https://soundcloud.com/catalina-shortwave

  We had always hoped that the strength of the songs would overcome the limitations of the equipment, the concrete basement and our limited skills as recording and mixing engineers.  We think they did.  

  Now, we find ourselves ready to make a second record.  We have the songs. We're ready, practiced, excited, and insanely eager to do it.  But again, we find ourselves with limited resources.  What to do?  

  Well, while we liked the DIY and rawness of the first record, we think we're ready for a little polish.  Today, we're a much better band, tighter, with better songs, more experience, better "feel."  We think a proper recording will really help us and let these new songs breeeeaaathe.   

  So, we need your help.  We've found a great little studio - The Enchanted Garden, in Ridgefield, CT - that can get the job done for a modest and reasonable fee.  That includes everything - the recording, mixing, mastering and manufacturing.  We're aiming to get the record done by mid-August.

   So, that's our hope and desire and our dream - and you can help make it happen.  

   And we will love you for it forever and ever and ever.

story:
L'Alizé présente:  


Axel Fisch Group + Invités

Événement spectacle - Lancement de CD + 50ans de bonheur et de musique à partager avec mes amis...  
Contribuez à la réalisation du dernier  CD du Axel Fisch Group , l'homme Univers, en achetant l'album en prévente .
Ou faite un don qui permetra à cette ambitieux projet à devenir  concret, merci  ❤️, Axel Fisch.

- 3 concerts en une soirée + Méga Jam
- 10 musiciens sur scène... 

                              Beaucoup d'invités... 

Magella Cormier, JP Zanella, Norman Lachapelle, Rogerio Boccato, Hélène Corini, Lauréat Cormier, Matéo Freire Fisch, Yvon Plouffe, Myreille Bédard, Joy Anandasivam, Simon Lapointe et bien d'autres...

Venez fêtez mes 50ans, avec nous, tout en musique! + lancement de mon dernier CD. -L'homme Univers.


- Billets en prévente à 15,00$

story:
7th Album! Lucky Number 7!!!

Pauline Reese is so excited to be able to launch this very special INDIEGOGO PRE-ORDER ALBUM  (produced by Dwight Baker, a platinum producer / engineer / mixer /songwriter who has worked with many artists such as Kelly Clarkson, Brandi Carlile, Bob Schneider, Blue October, Alpha Rev, and David Archuleta).

Album will be officially released in March 2016.

Biography

"Pauline Reese is my favorite female artist."~ Willie Nelson

Pauline Reese was twice named "Entertainer of The Year" by the Texas Music Association and has successfully carved her name in the male-dominated music business, touring with such notable Texas acts as Cory Morrow, Jack Ingram, Kevin Fowler and Pat Green. With a magnetic stage presence, quick wit and a smoking band, she performs regularly around Texas & Oklahoma.

If Pauline Reese had been born in the 1800s, she would have used a plow and a Henry rifle to carve her place the Wild West. Instead, she’s slinging a guitar and sharp-edged lyrics to blaze a trail in a man’s world of outlaw country music and staking milestones along the way, including praise from Willie Nelson as his favorite female vocalist and from the Texas Music Awards as the reigning entertainer of the year – the first woman to earn that honor. 

Pauline’s albums won critical acclaim since her self-titled debut in 1999. Willie joined her for a duet on “Pick Up the Pieces” on her 2004 CD “The Good, The Bad and The Ugly.” The Texas Music Awards bestowed album of the year honors on her 2007 CD “Too Texas,” a collection of her classics and others’. Her sixth CD, “Just Getting Started,” reveals Pauline’s growth as an artist in a powerful collection of folk, pop rock and alternative and contemporary country that reflects a life being lived to its fullest – from a leaving a rocky marriage and finding new love and a new role as a wife and mother with two young daughters to all the highs and lows in between.

For Pauline, there are plenty of trails yet to blaze. As the chorus in her latest CD’s title track says, “I’ve just hit my stride this ride ain’t over yet/ My heart is racing to see what’s waiting up ahead/ I’m about to make my mark/ Yeah, I’m just getting started.” "I am full of surprises," sings Pauline Reese on opener "Just Getting Started," and the Austinite's not kidding.

Reese challenges Carrie Underwood for Nashville good looks, but she's a crack Texas songwriter ("First Love") in the tradition of Dolly Parton ("Beautiful Shame," "Front Porch Sunday") and spends half the year on the road honing that craft. Reese isn't afraid to demand your attention; listen up.
~Margaret Moser, The Austin Chronicle

Its buoyant Red Dirt landscape splits hooks (“Just Getting Started”) and hope (the Django Walker co-write “Bring Me Down”) throughout shadows cracking with light (“Front Porch Sunday”). Each feels endlessly lived in. Pay particular attention to “Front Porch Sunday.” The title track might eventually connect radio waves for miles and miles, but Reese’s most compelling moment comes straight from the heart.
~Brian Atkinson, Texas Music Magazine

story:
Reginald L. Mobley+Agave Baroque+VGo Recordings - The Story Behind the Album

In early 2014, Agave Baroque asked Reggie Mobley to sing on their second album for VGo Recordings, Queen of Heaven: Music of Isabella Leonarda in Honor of the Virgin Mary. By the time it was released, they knew it was time to do it again, this time working together to produce Reggie's debut feature solo recording. This eponymous album features music written in the shadow of the Thirty Years' War, including works by Johann Christoph Bach (JSB's first cousin once removed) as well as his contemporaries Matthias Weckmann, Franz Tunder, and David Pohle.

This is music of extraordinary pathos and beauty, sung by the "barn-burning... phenomenal" Mobley and Agave Baroque, heralded by Early Music America for their "brilliant... shining... profound playing."

The live performances of “Mein freund ist mein” and “Christum ducem, qui per crucem” in the movie above were recorded in concert 9/9/14 at UNC School of the Arts.  The performers hope to maintain that kind of energy on the studio version!

Photo credits: Teresa Tam (Agave) and Liz Linder (Reginald Mobley)

We need your help!

Your contributions will go directly toward the basic costs of producing this album: travel expenses, instrument transportation costs, and the costs of hiring our extra musicians. That's it. What we don't make in donations comes out of our pockets.

Why should I contribute?

First of all, we at Agave Baroque are big fans of Reggie Mobley. His voice and stage presence have no equal, and we want to capture as much of the power of a live performance as we can on an album. We are thrilled to be working with him on this, his debut feature solo recording. We also love this repertoire, and think you will too. This album features some very seldom-recorded music, including works by David Pohle, a student of Heinrich Schütz, and an extraordinary anonymous work for alto, solo viola da gamba, and continuo from the circle of Heinrich Biber. It also includes world premiere recordings of two new arrangements of music by Heinrich Bach and Matthias Weckmann, as well as beloved works by J. Christoph Bach. While the disc features Reggie's exquisite voice, it draws power from the rich ensemble textures that a large string band provides. It is both accessible to the new listener and satisfying for the experienced lover of early music.
